title: Basic budget with great location!
text: Stayed with my family and 2 young kids. If you looking for a budget basic no frills with great location. This is the place. Breakfast is basic. Service is very good. Clean basic room setup.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Essenziale, buona posizione
text:
Camera 'superior' è essenziale, al secondo piano. C'è tutto il necessario ma i mobili e l'ambiente hanno un aria stanca e usurata. La stanza è pulita, il letto comodo. Non c'è un bollitore, solo un thermos per acqua calda. La reception è al quinto piano, piuttosto scomodo per lasciare le chiavi quando si esce. La cortesia alla reception è minima, invece molto disponibili e di aiuto per taxi e indicazioni il personale di security all'ingresso .
Colazione a buffet, ma poca scelta e solo cucina indiana.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Very Good
text: Comfortable rooms, clean and excellent services but the Breakfast needs some improvement. Entire staff EXCELLENT. especially room service.  Superb location for tourists close to train station, top of line restaurants and Marine Drive.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Odd experience
text:
We had booked a family room showing 3 separate beds. The room we were given had a double bed, plus a sofa with bedding provided. Comfortable enough, but not what was advertised.
Check-in was a rigmarole. Receptionist took almost an hour to complete our registration, which involved the usual sign in, handing over of our foreign passport, but then he went away (with our passports, always a nerve-racking time)  and proceeded to laboriously photo copy the main page, then meticulously cut out the photos and paste into another book.  Of course he stopped for dinner during this exercise. Very odd.
The breakfast room (breakfast not included) was equally odd. A large room, it had two small tables and then chairs spread around each wall. When our group of three moved a chair to be together, an attendant came over and put it back against the wall. Very odd.
Location is excellent on V.N. Road close to Marine Drive. An interesting place...
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great Location!
text: The best bit about this hotel is the location; it's just minutes from the station, has some great eateries even closer & is a short walk from some excellent bars with great views. The hotel itself is charming & clean, as was our room. The only downside was that our room was opposite the housekeeping area on the 1st floor, so we were woken early by their phone ringing, which was annoying. That said, I'll willingly stay here again.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good place in SoBo
text:
Wonderful staff.
Excellent location.
Good, clean and spacious rooms, ensuite.

(However, breakfast was neither free nor worth it. 
Tried the poha and veg mini cutlets. Both were cold. Bananas were under ripe. Unpalatable!
Check if you will be charged before you step into the breakfast room).
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Overpriced, Only location, no hospitality
text: Had to book this hotel for business related group booking. Called hotel a day prior in advance as we had some questions but they never reverted on call. On the day of booking, when we were finally able to get in touch with them and asked them some questions about the the occupancy etc in general, they hung up calls on us with no replies. The way they spoke on calls and behaved was quite  opposite of the hospitality. Just good location, avoid if traveling for work, management has ZERO patience and unhelpful.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A budget hotel with excellent location
text:
This hotel is a mixture of some plus and minus points. The biggest plus point is it’s location just next to Marine Drive which gives an easy access to all nearby important business and tourist spots. Rooms have multiple occupancy options suitable for groups and large families. 
  However, there are certain downsides also like not providing electric kettles in the rooms, limited food options that too for snacks only and narrow corridors. The structure has become old and needs upgrades. For security reasons hotel should provide card based entry to rooms instead of old lock and key system.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: comfortable and wonderful location
text:
the best part of the hotel is the location, walking distance from churchgate station and to marine drive. lots of food joints around for food.
well maintanined hotel, wonderful hospitality. All requests were met to with a smile.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Really good one
text: First choice when in Mumbai, an antique property, very well maintained. Total value for money. The staffs are really cordial and and the service is aweosme. Main highlight is the location of the property. Very near to the marine drive, morning walks and evening sea views is best to be experienced from here. Will be back here soon. Highly recommended.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Comfortable and budget friendly.
text:
This hotel is very pocket friendly and offers complete value for money.
Location is just next to marine drive and hence amazing.
Staff are friendly and helpful.
Rooms are clean and spacious. Good enough for a comfortable stay.
We requested for a late check out and they happily obliged. Much appreciated.
There are lots of restaurants nearby at a walkable distance.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: For freshup mind
text:
Hotel was good.. 
Staff was friendly and polite in nature...
Lovely ...
Food quality and rate was also very good for me..
Definately I will again and again visit this hotel..
Thnku very nice..
Great work..keep going..
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Lack of communication
text:
It’s a fact that Covid-19 has hit hard on the Tourism and Hospitality sector 
globally and unfortunately it has stopped people - who like to explore the world – 
from travelling.
It’s also a fact that prior to Covid-19 hotels have been able to stay 
in business and survive due to travelers who were more than happy to pay them a 
visit enjoying the hospitality during their stay.
I am sure that after the pandemic situation this interaction of reciprocity will 
remain unchanged.
What is truly disappointing is that – during these hard times - you’re being 
ignored by the hotel when trying to cancel your booking after having 
reached out to the them by email for assistance during months without any 
response. These are difficult times for everybody so a little help and 
cooperation is appreciated.
Guess my expectations for basic Customer service and good manners from Chateau Windsor were overrated.
Given the fact that there have been recent reviews on them, I can only come to 
the conclusion that they are open for business and reluctant to respond to my email for whatever reason.
Nevertheless, hoping to visit India when it is safe to travel again.
Chateau Windsor will not be one of my stops.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Rooms and noise
text: When we arrived, we were shown the "superior" rooms on the 5th floor I`d booked. They were small and looked like an east European hotel of the 1950s. Asked to be shown better rooms and for 500 rupees more , we took much nicer, larger, with fridge rooms on the 4th floor. Unfortunately they were very noisy. No double glazing, ill fitting windows, lots of noise from upstairs and corridor. It is a good location but make sure you get rooms on the right hand side of the hotel or stay at the Ambassador next door.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Noisy
text:
Rooms on the left side of the hotel very noisy.
We booked room 304 on the right side. Paid advance.
Inspite given insurance before booking  and arrival from the management , we were not offered what we paid for.
We got a corner room on the left side, very noisy.
Non cooperation from the management.
Breakfast very poor and limited - no special choice.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A good hotel and great location
text: The hotel room is well appointed and had great shower. the staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast was good. My only complaint is shady bookkeeping where they charged me for 2 nights when i only booked one. Then said they credit my account (my bank says no) and charged me another night at a different rate.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: 性价比不错的“海景房”
text:
【位置】离海滨百米之遥，离churchgate火车站也只有不到十分钟不行，到印度门稍微走长一点，十几分钟，总体来说，交通很方便。
【周边】门口街上有好几家吃的，往左手边，印度菜、西餐、日式、美式street food之类都有，价位也多重。
【房间】我们订的双床，不过给了个三人间522，房间比较大，还有阳台，从阳台上可以看到海——也算海景房了呢[调皮]设施不算多么好，但是基本需求都能满足。晚上睡觉也没觉得吵。
【餐饮】酒店的早餐不是自助，自己打9，餐饮部会送来，一个蛋饼（素的给一小碗炒饭一样的东东，荤的加了午餐肉等在蛋里），两片吐司+黄油+果酱，一壶红茶+奶，一个香蕉或橘子。简单，但也吃得饱。
【服务】我们上午到的，前台也给我们腾出房间来了。要热水、要碗，也都很热情地送来。
这里每个楼下面都有一个“保安”，负责提东西、叫车之类，每次都主动打招呼。
老式电梯上下楼，都有人按电梯。
最后一天我们退了房，买了东西没地方整理行李，人家会开到一半，让我们进会议室整理箱子，也是很体贴。
【问题】卫生状况有点差强人意，用过的粥碗（基本舔干净了…）放在桌上，满满的蚂蚁！！！
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good Hotel great location
text: I stayed with family. Good location nice staff. Marine drive in walking distance, Church gate station nearby. Lot of good reastaurant there. Gateway of India and other attractions can reach easily. Staff is helpful.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A nice stay, but...
text:
I really loved the 1939-Hotel... in a way. Staff was so friendly, forget that the hot water at o9.00 was not arriving after 11... The room had a balcony (204), but: Aircon was not working properly (felt like Maschine every 6-10 minutes on and off). The bathroom: tubes where leaking... the bed: 10 cm of a strange mattress is not comfortable.
Yet: the place is unbeatable. Having 2 toasts anyone egg-food plus butter, Marmelade and a banana for 260 rupies. ... a bit too much. After all: nice place,but...
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A homely stay
text: This is a nice hotel with very good central location near Marine Drive. We can look at Arabian Sea from our balcony. Room was good and spacious. The hotel is kept clean through out the premises. Staff are courteous and treated us as their family members. Breakfast has not much choice but is good and healthy.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: The Shining Star ✨ of Hotel Parle Intl is  Duty Manager Mr Vijayan
text: This was my 1st visit to the hotel but it did not felt like I m cuming to this hotel for the 1st time. Duty Manager Mr Vijayan was very courteous of all the people I met at the hotel. The way he welcomes u and helps u by going out of the way. He made my stay so wonderful that it felt like I m staying at my own home. I wud love to cum back to the hotel and recommend my family and friends to stay in hotel parle International. The most annoying thing about the hotel is wherever u go people are just behind u for the feedback. Housekeeping cums to your room in the evening disturbing u for the feedback. When u go the restaurant people over there disturb u they will not let u have your food also. I m annoyed with this behaviour of the people at the hotel.It seems they have been instructed by the management to take the feedback from the guest. As per my understanding the feedback is given at the time of check out before u leave but at this hotel feedback is taken right after u check in to ur room. Wifi connectivity is too poor at hotel. One thing I like to point out is when u call the room service no one is der to pickup the call and same thing is with the housekeeping, I think the calls are re-routed to the front desk and when u call for the water bottle it takes atleast half hour even after repeated calls because housekeeping is busy taking the feedbacks from the room. The first day I check in and  ask for the water bottle in the evening they give u free of cost in return for the good feedback whereas if u ask for the water bottle the 2nd day ther will charge u. Other people at the front desk are also helpful like Sachin, Ruchita and Rohit but out of all these people Duty Manager Mr Vijayan is the Shinning Star ✨ ⭐
placeInfo/address: B.N. Agarwal Commercial Complex Vile Parle East, next to Dinanath Mangeshkar Hall, Mumbai 400057 India
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Vile Parle East, next to Dinanath Mangeshkar Hall

text:

I would highly recommend hotel Parle International to others, and a special mention to Ruchita for her outstanding hospitality. People like her are an asset to any organization.

Thank you, Ruchita, for making our stay so memorable. We look forward to visiting again!

title: Excellent Location but badly maintained rooms
text:
Excellent Location but Bad Rooms.

I stayed in a club room. The first night was ok but the second night, the light didn't turn it off, I tried everything but it didn't.

I couldn't sleep the second night.

The toilet flush was blowing everything out and I had to close the toilet seat cover and then flush it. 

When I bought it to the notice in the morning they told me that I should have contacted them at night time. In fact I tried calling a few times but there was no answer.

Food was excellent, staff is friendly and helpful too.

Therefore I will be happy to stay again
ownerResponse/text:

We’re pleased to hear that you enjoyed the food and found our staff to be friendly and helpful. 

We genuinely look forward to the opportunity to welcome you back and provide you with an even better experience.

Best regards,

The Management Team
Hotel Parle International

title: Parle Local
text:
First the postives  - adequately manned and cheerful security staff, spacious parking lot, alert check out staff, sturdy and comfortable beds,  and a great housekeeping staffer called Shyam Singhji who was courteous, proactive and comptent.

And now the long list of negatives - pathetic room decor, oddly positioned electric switch points, stained bedsheets, toilet flush issues, cobwebs on walls and ceilings, dark spots, and horror of horrors -  horrendous exterior walls bearing a dilapidated and rundown look that matched the theme of a play we watched in the evening - titled Wada Chirebandi (Old stone mansion)  We ordered chicken clear soup and pasta which was served after ages and worse, the chewy chicken made our dining experience a torture.  

This used to be a sterling landmark of Vile Parle once, now a godforsaken shadow of its former self. At any point in time, you find more staffers than guests and some of the former are rude buggers. My son had a guest and asked for some space in the lobby where they could chat for a while without disturbance and without having to order food. The receptionist was quick to nod her approval but once seated a gentlman appeared from nowhere and explicitly told them to leave the place if food was not on the agenda. It was a question of 10 minutes and what fuss he made and used a derogatory tone. The receptionist was apologetic but to no avail. Avoid this place like the plague. The single star is for Shyam Singhji.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,

Thank you for your detailed feedback. 

We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay. We understand the concerns you've raised and regret that several aspects of your visit did not meet your expectations.

We're grateful for your positive remarks about our security staff, spacious parking, check-out team, and especially Shyam Singhji, whom we will be sure to recognize for his courteous and competent service. However, we deeply regret the issues you faced with room decor, cleanliness, and maintenance, including the electric switches, stained bedsheets, and toilet flush problems. We take your feedback seriously, and these matters will be promptly addressed by our team to ensure future improvements.

We also apologize for the unpleasant dining experience and the inconsistency in our staff’s behavior. We understand the frustration caused by the interaction with the lobby staff, and we assure you that we are taking steps to ensure better communication and service standards.

Once again, we apologize for all the inconvenience and are committed to providing a more comfortable experience in the future. We truly hope you will consider giving us another chance to serve you better.

Best regards,

The Management Team
Hotel Parle International

title: Great value, great location, very welcoming
text: This hotel has been owned by the same family for 70 years.  The hotel occupies several floors in an older building, it is well maintained and very welcoming.  The location is great.  Breakfast is on the roof, weather permitting, with a view of the sea facing Marine Drive and Fort facing the other way.  I have stayed here several times over the years, each time I have had a clean, quiet, well ventilated room with private bath.  I prefer to stay in hotels with some personality, so I find the fact that the building still has its original elevator operated by a person to be charming.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Helpful Mr. Joy !!
text:
I would like to acknowledge the Help rendered by Mr. Joy manning the hotel front desk. I somehow made a mistake of booking the hotel twice - one via expedia & one myself which I pre-paid. I forgot to cancel the expedia one & was automatically charged for that. In fact I did cancel but only a day before instead of 48 hours per the rules. After going back & forth a little, Mr Joy did help in arranging to get my refund back & I thank him for that.

Otherwise the hotel itself is just about okay. It's location being very near marine drive (walkable) is good. However the room cleanliness & upkeep could definitely do with an improvement.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Not at all worth staying there....even for free...!
text:
The place is not kept well. Almost looks like abandoned building, that too in such a prime location...
The lift is too small. The reception is on fifth floor. The rooms are on 1- 4 floors. 
Many rooms do not even have windows for ventilation and on top of it, they also do not have exhaust fans. 
I got the the shock of my life when I was told that it does not have a restaurant of its own, which is not mentioned on their site.... Kind of fraudulent attempt in getting clients.....
For every request the first response from the staff is that " This is not allowed....".
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Not value for money
text:
This is a run down hotel with rooms scattered on different floors. We had asked for a quiet room at the back and were given one that smelled so bad of smoke that we had to move. The next room did not smell as bad, but was at the side of the hotel, so traffic from the busy road in front was clearly audible. Doors banged throught the night, adding to the noise,

Our room was not that clean and did not have a kettle, cups, tea and coffee. Breakfast was abysmal, with a very limited selection. 

Staff are very friendly and the location is convenient for sight seeing, but they were the only positives.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A lucky pick!
text: We booked two nights and were really pleased! The location is just perfect, the room was nice and big, service was really good. Especially the door men, lift operators and house keeping staff. Breakfast was served at the roof top which was really nice but a bit poor with only eggs, toast, banana and tea/coffee. If I go to Mumbai again I’d stay there again.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Hotel bien situé pour visiter à pied en 2 jours les sites touristiques de la ville
text:
Nous avons apprécié la disponibilité du personnel. Notre chambre était de bonne taille et la propreté était au rendez vous.
Comme nous avions un avion tôt le lendemain matin, nous avons pu effectuer le check out plus tard (vers 14h) et utiliser dans la soirée une salle de repos pour attendre notre départ.

Le petit déjeuner continental moyen (pas de jus de fruits ni de laitage) mais on peux le prendre sur le toit terrasse et y lire le journal que l'on trouve gracieusement offert, accroché à la porte de notre chambre chaque matin.

Évitez les chambres sur cours, pas de vue et bruyantes car le son monte très tard dans la nuit du fond de la cours. Évitez également celles près de l'ascenseur car la sonnerie de l’appel est très fréquente (le service de clef est au 5ème étage)..
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Clean; Safe; Good location; Customer service is excellent
text:
We stayed at the hotel for approximately 2 weeks. While our room didn’t have a view of the Arabian Sea it was large, well lit, very clean and air conditioned with 2 ceiling fans. There is an elevator and round the clock security. There is a large safe in the room. Our room did not have a mini fridge. WIFI is decent and can be accessed in all areas of the hotel.
The staff are excellent and extremely helpful. Management is onsite round the clock and oversee the cleaning of the rooms etc. The hotel offers laundry and ironing services (no do it yourself facilities).
Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace which has a view of the sea. The breakfast is basic but filling. There are eggs made to order served with toast, a banana and a choice of tea or coffee. One can order sandwiches and beverages from room service. There is no onsite restaurant but the hotel allows you to have food delivered to your room. There are a variety of restaurants at various price points near the hotel.
The location is excellent for sightseeing. Marine drive is just a few minutes walk. It took us approximately 45 minutes to walk/stroll down to the Gateway of India. The staff will help you flag down a taxi.
I will stay in this hotel on future visits to Mumbai as it ticks all the boxes in the mid range price point.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Buena ubicación
text:
Estuvimos 2 noches y lo recomiendo! Muy buena ubicación, cerca del centro pero en una zona bastante tranquila con comercios y restaurantes. 
Las habitaciones son amplias, cómodas y limpias. Sin lujos pero con lo que necesitas. Nos sorprendió la eficacia del personal, muy amable y muy rápido.  Sin duda, muy recomendable.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Mumbai tour
text: I had to take my parents to Siddhivinayak temple and also had my pet dog with me. Inspite of trying many good hotels in Juhu, I could not find a reasonable one that would allow my pet. After a lot of searching I found this hotel. I will not call it a fabulous hotel, but they offer the basics. The most important part is that it is a very well located hotel. Marine drive is 1 min from it. Thpugh the hotel does not have a separate restaurant, but it has a whole lot of restaurants on its list, whose menu card is kept in the rooms. You can order anything and they will get it delivered in your rooms. Hence, if you are looking for a good hotel to take your family and pet along, I would definitely recommend this one.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: good location, poor breakfast
text:
Good location – a few minutes away from Churchgate which is a major train station.  You are also a stone throw away from the Marine Drive promenade where you can have a walk in the evening if adjacent noisy traffic doesn’t bother you.

The one thing letting this hotel down is its breakfast in the room.  They take orders on the phone – the lady we spoke to the three morning we stayed there was quite abrupt and only offered omelette, boiled eggs or the spicy local choice.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Above Average Competance
text: Great location to start with.  The street it's on has lots of good restaurants to choose from.  It's convenient to see the sites in Mumbai from here, and it's also in a safe neighborhood to take some walks around(I think). They keep the place very clean but to include the room, it is quite dated.  Funky old style elevator to the fifth floor where my room and the front desk is.  All kinds of employees everywhere at all times ready to help.  Management at the front desk very helpful about getting train tickets.  Nice large balcony overlooking the street.  I'm good with this place, and I guess the price is ok for the area.  I don't know - something missing here.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A Perfect blend
text:
We were driving to Mumbai for a few days for both work and relaxation. The destination Hotel was a usual one we drive to, where we had been staying for over the last few years whenever we were in town. The reason was that we always travel with our four legged Son our darling Beagle of ten years. As we were entering the suburbs we called up the hotel to convey the time of arrival, only to be told that that they had recently revised their pet policy and that they no longer permit pets on their property. Other than the fact that it was highly unprofessional of them to inform us at the last moment considering that they knew we were on our way and that we had a prior booking and they knew us very well as we were regulars, but that is another story. However, Indian mythology says whatever happens, happens for a good reason and so it was. We immediately started searching the web for pet friendly hotels and lo behold Chateau Windsor came up in our search. To be doubly sure we called up the property and we pleasantly greeted by the person from the property and advised that Yes our Pet was more than welcome there... Having said that we were a little skeptical on the kind of property as often pet friendly properties have much to be desired. Well we drove down to the property, which is very easy to find and beautifully located. The initial welcome by the guards was very encouraging, very friendly and hospitable and so caring towards the Pet too. We went up to the reception, which is on a upper floor, the lift attendant to was very polite though the lift itself was vintage, which is fine as it was functional... The reception area is very basic but functional. The hotel itself at the outset gave a very homely feeling and positive vibes. The reception staff was very helpful and we were shown a few rooms for our selection and to say the least we were pleasantly surprised to see the clean airy and fresh rooms. The toilets too are clean with hot and cold water on demand and clean linen to use. The building is a little old but reasonably well maintained, it seems that it  is a building which houses several flats which have been very efficiently carved out to form the existing hotel. Most rooms have a small balcony attached to it. no great view form the hotel itself but the location is fabulous and just a two minutes walk to get you the best views of the town. 
The Property is a little different in its functionality which I think I should amplify, though they have a functional kitchen they don't serve any full meals, only tea, coffee and a basic breakfast. But the good part is that they have several menus, in the room, of good eateries which deliver to the room and the hotel provides decent clean crockery and cutlery to make your meal a perfect one. they even serve it to you in your room in serving dishes if you would rather, Accessories like glasses and ice cubes are also available for those of us which want to make it an evening to remember. 
The Property is located close to all the modes of transport, A local metro station, Church gate, bus stops, Taxi stands and in the mobile age nothing is too far. The local shopping district, Colaba is five minutes drive, most tourist places this side of town are just a few minutes away, For those of us who are addicted to long walks and runs in the morning or evenings well then some of the best places to do the same are right round the corner. There are even some good eating places next to the property in-case you would rather go down for a meal or a change.  
We have since stayed at this places on several occasions and in different rooms and always been delighted by the hospitality. One of the few properties offering great value for money and the hospitality which beckons you to come back for more. So if its Mumbai with our Pet it would always be this place. 
Great show guys, would love to meet the owners and compliment them in person. 
God Bless the Team.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Very clean hotel
text: I frequently visit this hotel since many years. It's very clean hotel with very cooperative staff. Manager Mr. Raja is very customer friendly. They give limited items in breakfast but it's  very good especially veg.cutlet. I have never tested this kind of cultlet. Also toilets are clean. Only thing they don't have restaurant  but they take food from outside hotels promptly. I love to stay again
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent location
text:
A simple yet lovely hotel. The location is phenomenal. Right next to Marine Drive. And 2 minute walk from Churchgate station.

Great service too.

One more great thing was their morning breakfast. Very good and filling.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: You're basically paying for location
text:
When you reach the location, a suspicious and depressed looking lift operator takes you up in a remarkably rickety lift to the 5th floor where another couple of depressed looking staff man a rudimentary reception. Records are kept in a dilapidated register which will probably fall apart before they get to the end.
The room was comfortable enough.
Room service options were rather rudimentary but they do allow selected nearby restaurants to deliver to the rooms.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Mumbai visit for Business
text:
Excellent Location, Very good staff, decent room. I have stayed in this Hotel a number of times, and it was always good experience. Location is too good. 
Unlike Mumbai, room size is also very good. May need a little improvement in decoration of room and toilet and can add a little more in breakfast.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good place for a short stay.
text:
This hotel is situated on the busy streets near the church gate station and is adjacent to the famous ambassador hotel!
The rooms are not very expensive (only if you plan a short stay). The hotel has a warm and trained staff with valet parking!
The rooms are great not the best! If you stay here you get to go to lot of eateries as this hotel is centrally located from lot of eateries!!
Overall a good buy!!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Budget Hotel in a Great Location.......Overall Satisfied!!!
text:
This property looks like a very old building. However, the management has taken care to meet the standards of a quaint hotel and it meets expectations. The staff is courteous and helpful.
Particular mention has to be made regarding the size of the rooms and the location. The rooms are spacious and there could not be a better location for a leisure stay that overlooks the Arabian sea.
This is an ideal place for backpackers looking for a budget place in an exotic location.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent location.
text: Location is excellent if you want to Enjoy marine drive, church gate and Kolaba area. Modest breakfast. Bathroom is separate from room and shared. But cleanliness is maintained. Reception and staff very friendly.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Dobry choć drogi
text: Staroświecki z postkolonialnym klimatem. Czysto i przestronie. Łatwy dojazd. Blisko głównych atrakcji oraz stacji metra Churchgate. Bardzo uprzejma i pomocna obsługa. Śniadania poprawne ale skromne z niewielkim wyborem. Dobre Wifi. Polecam na pobyt w Bombaju, choć dość drogo.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Friendly staff, old building
text:
Stayed here for one night. The staff was very prompt and helpful.

I have reduced 2 stars because of the loudly creaking bathroom door. Before a guest checks in, there should be an inspection done of the room's important aspects to ensure that the guest's stay is pleasant. There was sufficient time for this to be possible too. I checked in late at night.

Hopefully they will  read this review and ensure that the above process is institutionalised.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good value, great location
text: This was a good value hotel with a very good location. It's close to Churchgate train station with access to the western line, and many attractions are within walking distance. Evening strolling along Marine Drive also very accessible. It's not top notch luxury, but it's serviceable. AC a bit noisy, but kept the room cool. Fridge in room very welcome. Staff were extremely helpful at all times.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Old Charming Hotel at Churchgate
text: Hotel is old but very clean in India standard.  Location is good near to Churhgate Railway Station.  Staff are very helpful and friendly.  Simple breakfast at rooftop.  A bit pricey for an old hotel but will come back again
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good value hotel~ lovely staff
text: I stayed here with my sister and a friend for 3 nights; the hotel is in a great location, the rooms are clean and functional (don’t expect frills) and the staff are lovely. Worth a stay for a trip to Mumbai.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: last minute booking turned good!
text: We booked this hotel the morning we needed it after a disastrous night somewhere else the night before. Checking in took a bit of time as they didnt seem to have record of the booking made only a few hours earlier. However, staff were very helpful, and they gave us 2 rooms to choose between. The room we had had a separate bathroom which wasnt a problem and the room itself was beautiful. Breakfast was limited but sufficed, and it was lovely eating it on the roof terrace in the sunshine.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent location and great staff
text: Wonderfully charming hotel. Location is spot on - with easy access to both Marine Drive and Churchgate Railway Station. The room was impeccably clean and very comfortable and the staff were exceptional, always very helpful. Having breakfast on the roof terrace was a real plus too! Wouldn’t hesitate to book again.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Old world charm of South Bombay!
text: We have stayed at this lovely hotel twice now. Both were weekend trips from Pune to Mumbai. First time my wife booked this hotel was in 2017. I could not believe that we are getting a room in a hotel on Marine drive for about Rs 5000. I expected the hotel to be old and not well maintained. We were pleasantly surprised when we found that the hotel lobby and the rooms were in an excellent condition. The service was great. The staff is courteous, friendly and knowledgable. The hotel has an old world charm. We felt like we have been transported back to the 70s :) I highly recommend this hotel.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Mit Balkon
text: Wir hatten ein tolles, geräumiges Eckzimmer mit Balkon bekommen. Die Betten war groß und man schlief wirklich gut in ihnen. Die Einrichtung (Sofa, Stuhl, Schreibtisch, Schrank, Fernseher) schon beinahe üppig. Alles funktionierte tadellos (Dusche, WC, Fan, AC). Jeden Tag wurde sauber gemacht. Ein kleines Frühstück gab es auch, könnte man auf dem Fach einnehmen. Die Lage ist 1a. Einziger Minuspunkt - 90 Euro sind schon viel für Ein Hotel, das sich selber im Budgetbereich sieht
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Amazing location, clean and economical
text: I loved staying in this hotel. Super impressed with the cleanliness. Service is excellent. Location is so central near to restaurants. Price is very well worth it. I highly recommend it and this will be my home in Mumbai.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Random selection, not disappointed
text:
Hotel is undoubtedly at a great location. We were offered a family room on 5th floor. Many places of interest are nearby.......
Pros : Clean rooms, prompt response for service, good mannered staff
Cons : Water shortage, costly compared to what is provided, bare minimum breakfast. Most important, we stayed for 5 nights, but the linen was never changed (have reduced a rating for this particular aspect)
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good value for money
text: The hotel is simple, but clean and the rooms are spacious. Also the staff is nice and friendly and they don't expect gratuities. Sometimes the organisation is a bit chaotic. The rooftop is really nice,  you've got a good view towards Marine Drive from there. If you expect something really comfortable or special, this is not the place. But if you need to stay over for 1 or 2 days, it's ok.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great location, good price
text:
I chose Chateau Windsor as our first port of call on a two week holiday in India which began in Mumbai. We didn’t want anything too fancy - just somewhere clean and well located. It ticked the boxes. It doesn’t look much from the outside, and the common areas are pretty ramshackle, so it was a pleasant surprise to find the room clean and comfortable.

WiFi was quite poor and unstable, and we needed to get a different username and password every day for each device, which was a bit annoying.

Reception is on the 5th floor, which makes collecting/leaving the room key a pain if you’re staying on the 1st floor - as we were. 

Breakfast is very simple - eggs, toast, jam, OJ, tea/coffee - but enough to set you up for the day.

All in all, an acceptable place for a few days in an excellent location at a good price.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Simple and convenient in central Mumbai
text: Chateau Windsor is well located near the Arabic sea and the main attractions of south Mumbai. It is a good value hotel, although hotels in Mumbai are pretty costly. Having breakfast on the roof terrasse is a nice experience if you've just arrived in India.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Functional clean hotel in Mumbai Fort region
text: I stayed here for one night while on a business trip. The best are the location and the smiling faces of every person in the hotel! The minus is the bad design of a cement barrier near the side of the bed in the room I stayed. One can get hurt, if he / she does not remember its existence.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A mid-range hotel in a great location.
text: I, along with my wife and 2 children (aged 9 and 7), stayed at Chateau Windsor for 3 nights at the end of September.  We had a family room which was plenty big enough for us all.  The room was clean and simple, with a shower bathroom.  Not a hotel to pick if a hearty hotel breakfast is your thing, but tea/coffee, eggs, toast and fruit are on the menu.  This hotel does do well for affordability and location, and the staff were friendly and welcoming.  All the main attractions are within a 5-10 minute taxi ride, as are plenty of great places to eat and drink.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Basta che sia centrale!!!
text: Personale gentile. Colazione in terrazza, gratis ma molto basilare. Siamo ad un livello minimo di decenza. Al di sotto nonl ssi può. Due i pregi, il prezzo, in quattro abbiamo pagato circa 70€ al giorno e la centralità. A piedi si raggiungono gran parte delle cose da vedere.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: The boon and Bane
text: Well, it's quite an old hotel but rooms are very very well maintained. Yet to experience the age old things which perhaps, the frequent travellers or the ones looking for all-in-all won't appreciate too much. Let me talk about good things first. The location - near marine drive and pizza by the bay - our favorite places. A combination of old and middle age staff. That basic respect, safety - all ensured. Very nicely maintained rooms inspite of being very old hotel. The entrance is not grand at all though - if it makes a difference to you, to us it didn't. Just few recommendations - more stock of iron (we can't survive without it), a little more understanding for office going guests (you have to learn to deal and provide the requirements on time). The biggest flaw, inspite of good tariffs, is extremely poor breakfast. Buffet - don't dream of it. But even the options for in-room dining were almost negligible. This part really really needs to be catered to. If you are not a breakfast person, absolutely go for this place.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Don't go there,you will be ripped off
text: The hotel is poor.we booked 6 rooms and had  to upgrade these rooms at a higher rate as we had already paid so either upgrade or loose it all.Rooms were damp and terrible.upgraded rooms were decent .i am shocked that they call this place a hotel.thank you TripAdvisor for allowing me to share my opinion.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Lovely Hotel
text: My family have stayed at Chateau Windsor for many years & still do. Now it's tradition for my husband & myself when visiting India to stay here a few nights as well. Lovely hotel. It's clean & neat. Staff & office personnel are very accommodating. We always book a room here & the price always includes breakfast but honestly we've never had the breakfast here. They even have the newspaper for you in English. Most of their staff have been with them for many years. Remember the place is not 5*. It does not have a pool or a gym. It's comfortable & clean & neat. Location is perfect with a pizza place opposite then you have a fine dining indian restaurant diagonally opposite. You have a Burger King round the corner. Then you have ice cream places next to you. You could walk on marine drive at nite & feel safe. With lots of locals enjoying their morning or evening walks with families.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Near Marathon starting point. Stayed twice.
text: My husband has stayed here each time he goes to run SCMM. And we joined him last year. The room was small. But Neat. Breakfast took a long time to arrive, but they served my husband his hot coffee at 3 am before he went for his run!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Comfortable Stya
text:
Stay at hotel Kohinoor Continental near the airport and was thoroughly impressed. From check-in to check-out, everything was seamless. The staff were friendly, efficient, and always ready to help. Anjali (GRE) was very helpful. The location is perfect—just minutes from the airport with a reliable, complimentary shuttle service.

My room was clean, quiet, and very comfortable. The bed was cozy which ensured a restful sleep.

One of the highlights for me was the fitness center. It was clean, well-maintained, and equipped with everything I needed for a good workout—cardio machines and free weights. It’s great to have a quality gym available, especially when traveling.

The free high-speed Wi-Fi, early breakfast, and thoughtful in-room amenities made my stay even better. Whether you're staying overnight or for a few days, this hotel is a fantastic choice. I’ll definitely be back and highly recommend it to my friends and colleagues.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Your recommendation means a lot to us, and we can't wait to welcome you back in the future!

title: Poor Star Hotel
text:
This hotel doesn’t quite live up to the “star hotel” label. Just outside the property, there was a pile of garbage that resembled a dumping site, which seriously impacted the impression. Being close to the railway station, the hotel also lacked any pleasant views.
We stayed here during our trip to Mumbai. One positive aspect was the security checking system at the entrance, which seemed well-organized. The check-in and check-out processes at the reception were also smooth and efficient.
However, there was no real sense of guest hospitality or welcoming culture. The rooms and in-room amenities were basic and not up to the standards expected from a star-rated hotel.
On a better note, the restaurant area was pleasant. Although the breakfast spread wasn’t very diverse, the food served was quite tasty.
To truly uphold the reputation of a star hotel, the management needs to make significant improvements — a sentiment echoed by many other guests in their reviews. Instead of offering scripted or generic responses, focusing on genuine service improvement would make a meaningful difference.

Thank You.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Pitambar,
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your stay at Hotel Kohinoor Continental. We genuinely appreciate your observations regarding the cleanliness and the hospitality aspects as they guide us in our efforts to improve. 

It's good to hear that you found the security and check-in processes efficient, as well as enjoyed the restaurant ambiance and food quality. Your input about the room amenities and overall guest experience is invaluable, and we will certainly take it into consideration for further enhancements. 

We are committed to providing a better experience for our guests in the future. Thank you once again for your thoughtful review.

Regards,
Hotel Kohinoor Continental team
placeInfo/address: Andheri Kurla Road Andheri E, Mumbai 400059 India
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Andheri E

title: OMG!!!
text:
Good day everyone! I’ve been in this “beautiful” hotel on July 2025 and what I would like share to you is listed below:
1. Rooms condition- all of us (4 persons) have got identical rooms and all we have got the same problem- dirty room. So bath space corners are black because of mold. Bed sheet was with a black spot. Walls are cracked on corners.
2. Personnel- they are not as kind as they should be. 
3. Dining room- I’ve been surprised that the offered water was taken from faucet and there is nothing to drink else. So if you want to drink something like juice or Cola you have to pay extra money for that option. And you might be liked it but I am not, concerning food. So if you think that you will get different kind of food.. your thinks will be vanished by first breakfast. You have two options: hot and real hot. When I eat that food, I feel like my stomach is too infected and I really need to kill all infections inside.. say: “good bye” to your infections and enjoy visiting toilet on the next morning. Too hot for such morning…
4. When I open my window I have a real perfect option to see how all people on railway station (around of 15 meters distance) are looking to my naked body (leaving a part about other interesting things that they could see) after a shower… it’s so incredible! 
Now we are coming out of this “beautiful” hotel and we meet garbage station with plenty of garbage trucks around on hotel right side. It's making this hotel unbelievable. You can find a nice garbage river close to left side of hotel apartment as well. So I’ve only one question… Why it’s 4 stars? Who assigned it? My opinion is that it is necessary to remove all stars and put it back to usual hotels.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Danila,
Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback. It's concerning to hear about the room conditions and the cleanliness issues you've encountered. Please rest assured that your insights regarding the staff service and dining options will be taken into consideration as we strive to improve.

We understand that the location and views were not to your satisfaction, and we appreciate your perspective on how this affects your overall experience. Your comments about the food quality and options will also be addressed to ensure better offerings in the future.

We value your feedback and it helps us work towards enhancing our guests' experiences. Thank you for bringing these matters to our attention.

Regards,
Hotel Kohinoor Continental team
placeInfo/address: Andheri Kurla Road Andheri E, Mumbai 400059 India
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Andheri E

title: Pleasant Stay
text:
We stayed at the hotel for a night. We availed the airport pick up and drop service as well. The hotel is very convenient to reach Mumbai International Airport. The staff is polite and helpful. We had dinner and breakfast at solitaire restaurant. The buffet spread was generous and starters were served at the table. The food quality was good. The dinner and breakfast both had live counters.

However it took a while and few reminders for our luggage to reach to our room. Also swimming pool was not operational. 

Later we got a call from hotel and we were pleasantly surprised that one of our chargers were found by them. We had already left Mumbai by then so we asked them to courier the same to relatives and so they did! Much appreciated.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Harshada,
Thank you for sharing your experience! We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay, the convenient location, and the dining options at Solitaire Restaurant. It's wonderful to know that our staff could assist with your charger after your departure—your appreciation means a lot to us. 

We apologize for the delays with your luggage and the pool situation and will certainly look into these matters to enhance our service. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back to Hotel Kohinoor Continental in the future!

Regards,
Hotel Kohinoor Continental team

title: Try and find another property at the same cost.
text: I booked an Executive room on Agoda for 28th Aug. I had asked for one big bed and also a room in the main building. I called them up on the 28th aug to confirm both of these and they said yes. On arriving there at 3.30pm, the lady sitting at the Duty Managers desk, said they dont have any room on the main building but they can give me a room with two beds if I am ok. I said I had specifically asked for a big bed and I can wait if she wants to check. She then said that she will upgrade me a higher category room but on the other building. I said fine and got my room. The room that they gave me was surely not an upgrade. I have stayed in this property many times but not in the last 5 years and hence I know their kind of rooms. I did not have the strength to haggle. I went for a shower and the entire bathroom got flooded inspite of me having a shower in the shower cubicle. I had to call atleast 5 times to get them to send someone for housekeeping. The housekeeping guy said he has been telling them for long that he will need cement to seal up the place from where the water leaks. He cleaned the bathroom and left. Even the toilet seat was stained and spoilt inspite of them having put a sticker of 'sanitized'. The food I ordered was bad too. I ordered triple schezwan and they sent me some random noodles. Overall a very bad experience.

title: Best Hotel To Stay At Budgeted Price
text:

Our room was incredibly spacious and filled with luxurious touches that made our stay comfortable and enjoyable. The hotel’s location is perfect—just a short distance from the airport and only a 5-minute walk to Vile Parle station, making it convenient for travelers.

We highly recommend Parle International for anyone looking for a comfortable and delightful stay in Mumbai!

title: Хорошее местораположение
text: Второй отель, в котором я остановился в Мумбае с учетом прошлых ошибок, произвел лучшее впечатление, чем предыдущее, но всегда есть своя ложка дегтя. Итак номер большой просторный чистый это большой плюс. Проблем с обслуживанием, постельным и прочим не было. Вроде бы все как в хорошей европейской 3ке, но ... до первого завтрака. Итак. Поднимаемся на крышу отеля и ... после полумрака отеля на раскаленном идийском солнце просто от боли жмурим глаза со всей силы. Возвращаемся в номер за очень темными очками. Ок так уже лучше. Для нас раскрывают зонтик и протирают пластиковый столик после чего официант готов принять заказ ... просто омлет или омлет масала (тоже но со специями и каплей овощей.) Выбираем второй вариант в надежде что он будет хоть не много сытнее. После этого вы получаете 2 тоста, масло джем, банан и чай/кофе на выбор. Поели прекрасно, готовьтесь через пару часов искать место для обеда. Зато каждое утро на ручке дверей в тканевом мешочке вас будет ждать свежая газета (на английском) И еще маленький штрих ресепшен расположен на последнем этаже так что с чемодан придется несколько раз придется прокатиться туда сюда в маленьком неуютном старом лифте. Бонусы рядом прекрасная набережная с великолепным закатом и на углу прекрасный "итальянский ресторан", где ризотто падают в тарелке из которой мы обычно едим суп/борщ :). Так что останавливаться можно смело, для осмотра достопримечательностей место отличное, а поесть можно совсем рядом.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great Location, but a bit too old school
text: The hotel is located close to all the important areas in south mumbai, marine drive is right there, churchgate, fort, etc you can move around in the city conveniently from the hotel which is a great plus. But next time when I am there will probably spend a little extra and stay at the ambassador only.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Decent Hotel beware the Taxis outside
text:
The hotel is budget but that's not a bad thing. It is decent, rooms are clean, well equipped (electronic safe, shower, table, TV, plugpoints) with (noisy but effective) AC. Good value for money, but I would not spend any more.  

Having no lobby can be a deal breaker for some, as it keeps you from meeting others and makes the corridors noisy. Chunky room keys that must be deposited with reception is burdensome and very old fashioned. Free internet has to be renewed by reception every day or so.

Biggest negative as a nervous traveller is the taxis that wait outside the hotel. Most taxis flagged down in Mumbai are fine, but these parked ones overcharge, refuse to go short distances, don't use their meters and apply pressure. The fact that hotel staff direct you to them makes me think they work with the hotel (or its staff). You will find yourself avoiding the hotel staff at the door in order to avoid taking their favoured taxis!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: 2 nights in Mumbai
text: First hotel we stayed in after arriving in India. Very comfortable after a long flight and reasonably priced for Mumbai. However, compared to the rest of India, Mumbai is expensive! Nice breakfast on the terrace each morning, eggs, toast and tea. Great location, within walking distance of everything you need to see in Mumbai.  Overall a great start to our time in India
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good location, great staff
text: The hotel location is great: v close to Marine Drive. The staff are friendly and service is excellent. We stayed in the deluxe rooms, which were clean and comfortable. We needed more space and a cot was added. You can order food from any of several restaurants in the area.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good on location
text:
I visited Mumbai last week with my parents and grandparents. The location of the hotel is quite good and probably the best deal for a budget hotel in the area. It's a predominantly a budgeted old school hotel with spacious and neat n clean rooms. I hv done a lot of travelling in the last few yrs and this hotel comes nowhere near to the modern resorts in terms of luxury and amenities. 
One drawback of the hotel is that it doesnt have its own restaurant. One needs to order food from the nearby restaurants and the hotel pantry staff is pleased to serve the food in the room. They are offering complementary b/fast, but that however is limited to either eggs (boiled/scrambled/poached/omlette) or veg cutlet (any one) along with only 2 slices of bread and a cup of tea/coffee. Even a kid aged 10 eats more than 2 slices of bread for his bfast. I wanted to order some sandwiches mentioned in the menu, but i was told that those would be available only aftr 11AM. 
The staff was very cooperating and well behaved. We headed for Shirdi from Mumbai and all the arrangements pertaining to traveling and lodging were all done by the hotel staff without any hassles.
To sum it up..a nice hotel to spend few days in Mumbai.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent place to stay

title: Very pleasant stay

title: Would definitely come back to this hotel!
text:
My decision to book in advance 4 nights at Chateau Windsor hotel was not much better than a shot in the dark. However, it quickly turned out after check-in that the choice was a good one, so I extended my stay after 2 nights until my departure from Mumbai 10 days later.

By Mumbai standards, the hotel is reasonably priced, and has an excellent location for sightseeing and exploration of South Mumbai.

It's only a stone's throw from Marine Drive running along the bay which can be seen from the hotel's rooftop terrace used for serving breakfasts.

Churchgate train station is a short walking distance (approx. 5 minutes) away from the hotel, and the famous Gateway of India monument is about 25-30 minutes on foot.

Chateau Windsor does not have its own restaurant, but there are two excellent restaurants in the same street nearby- Kamling (Chinese) and Gaylord (Indian).

My room on the 4th floor of the hotel was delightful, tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean.

The hotel staff is generally courteous and helpful. However, if some special assistance is needed, I suggest that you approach directly Mr Ramesh in reception- he is most knowledgeable and obliging.

Stayed at Chateau Windsor hotel in February 2017.

My tip for travellers to India: If you really want to have hassle-free travel in this country, be always alert, but go with the flow- regardless of your circumstances.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Clean, helpful staff, convenient location
text:
We stayed here for twelve nights in February during the Kala Ghoda Festival.  Our third floor room was very spacious and spotlessly clean.  The private bathroom was not an ensuite but separate from the bedroom, and accessed with a key.  Although this was a slight inconvenience at night, the decent water pressure and reliable hot shower compensated.  Again, the bathroom was always clean.  
Breakfast on the roof terrace was basic eggs and toast, a banana, and tea or coffee.  This was perfectly fine though rather monotonous by the twelfth morning😊
All staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay.  I was able to print documents in the office for a modest fee.  
Another plus was the laundry service.  Our clothes were returned ironed with knife-edge creases and white paper folded into shirts and dresses to keep them perfect.  What a pleasure! 
The only downside to the stay was that smokers often occupied adjacent rooms.  Perhaps smokers could be restricted to one floor and non-smokers to another?
We chose the hotel for price and location.  Very close to Marine Parade, Churchgate station, several good restaurants, and right across the street from Rustoms ice cream shop, Chateau Windsor is also extremely handy for anyone wanting to access Colaba, Kala Ghoda, Fort, Marine Lines, or Kemp's Corner.  Would definitely stay here again!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Hotel sympathique mais sans plus
text:
L'hotel est sympathique avec un petit déjeuner en terrasse ou dans la chambre. Le personnel est à vos petits soins. L'hôtel est en rénovation est certains étages/ chambres sont joliment refaits. D'autres étages sont encore anciens. Il y a une réception mais pas très conviviale. 

Nous avons eu quelques problèmes dans notre chambre (coffre fort qui ne marchait pas bien et la clim qui gouttait) et les problèmes n'ont été réglés que superficiellement, ce qui n'est pas top pour le prix élevé des chambres (grande chambre pour 100€).
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Average hotel in a decent location.
text:
The staff in uniforms are great and very helpful. The staff in normal clothes are a bit dismissive, they probably own the place. They ignored simple requests like for additional sheets and could have been more polite.

The room was quite functional. Hot water on demand, good selection of TV channels and the aircon worked well.

Perhaps it was because my room was opposite the kitchen but it was very noisy. I could hear the clattering of dishes constantly from about 6.30am every morning.

Overall I wouldn't stay here again as I'd take my chances to find something better next time.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Bonne localisation

title: Great place to stay in Mumbai!
text: Excellent and friendly staff from the minuet you arrive. Rooms are clean and nice with no frills. Air conditioning, ceiling fan and shower were all in good working order and a small privet balcony to let the fresh air in. Great location right near the sea walk (good for a run or walk), Church street station and a few restaurants. Also a good ice cream sandwich shop straight across the street. The price feels just a bit high when coming to Mumbai form other parts of India where costs are so low.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Hospitality
text:
This hotel is right next to the once famous Ambassador Hotel. Location is fantastic if you have have business in south mumbai. We travelled for leisure - every thing was at a very short distance... and taxi is available all the time. At a stones throw are marine drive, churchgate Station. Lots of famous eateries around.
Or just a stroll on the marine drive is excellent.
The hotel is simple and clean. Rooms are fairly large for the size of the hotel. No view from rooms. There's a tiny manual lift to get to the reception at the 5th floor or to the rooms.
I liked this place because of the location and also the general friendliness of the entire staff.
I would recommend this for business travellers or when you have a full itinerary where you don't need to spend too much time in the hotel.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great Location, Functional & Clean Rooms
text: We stayed overnight at this property at the start of our cycling expedition from Mumbai to Goa.The hotel is located just off the Marine Drive and close to everything on that side of the town. The location is perfect and the pricing sweet. The rooms are functional and clean and the linen was clean and crisp. The staff at the front desk as well as the security staff were extremely helpful and cheerful. The access to the rooms and the reception is either though the staircase or an old styled lift with collapsible doors.

title: Highly recommend and value for money
text:
Hotel Parle International stands out for its good standards of cleanliness. 
Front office staff are very nice and friendly.
They pay attention to your needs and respond spontaneously.
Faizal Sir, the duty manager has a pleasant personality. He gladly sorted for our two rooms to be close by. From front office Rohit Sir and Sachin Sir are also very helpful. 
The transfer from and to the airport has been perfectly arranged. Grateful to the staff who waited to pick us as it takes over an hour to clear immigration and collect lugguage from the airport. 
Ashok Das and Mithun from housekeeping did a great job to uphold the cleanliness of the room. Towels and sheets were changed daily. Got fresh flowers and fruits in room.
The rooms are spacious and well-maintained, promising a comfortable stay. 
Antony Sir and Madhuri Ma'am from the restaurant have been very attentive to our needs. Mansoor Musafir makes the best best best dosa in the world. 
The gym is great with the basic amenities allowing a good workout during the stay. However,  access to a phone would be great since the gym is in the basement.
With its commitment to exceptional service and attention to detail, Hotel Parle International guarantees a delightful and rejuvenating stay for travelers.
Nestled in the centre of Vile Parle, all amenities are walking distance from the Hotel. 
Highly recommended to stay.

title: Poor Stay
text: Landed in Mumbai, India for the first time as a family trip last spring of May 2022. Im reposting this review as I noticed my last years post was not cut an didn't include the full detail of our stay.  To make everything short I will share the good side and the bad side of our stay. My reviews is about this hotel that we stayed in. Starting from the good side, wifi  was pretty much stable and no interruption in internet connection you can surf with ease. Distance from the airport by rental car was 15 minutes and if you opted for a  public transportation (toktok or autorickshaw) it’ll take you  about 30 minutes to reached it. However, the bad side of our stay is far beyond our expectations. We pre arrange everything to the hotel and as they mentioned and as what normally hotel would do is to provide a driver with signage board with names of the passengers at the arrival area. We then reached the airport at 00:10 hrs midnight and took us around few minutes to finally passed the immigration and yes we finally  made it out to the arrival area. Following scenarios are really unexpected.We waited long time for the driver after we came out from the airport. Frustrated and devastated because no one was there for us. Needless to say but I have to let you know that we are tired and exhausted from travel and all we want is to get to the hotel to take rest. Despite of the humid weather outside the airport we still look and searched for our names and still we didn’t lose hope looking for the driver. We were indeed desperate and started to lose our patience until someone step-in to helped us contact the hotel. Someone answered the phone and to our surprised he was not  aware that we’ve been waiting for long time already at the airport and what’s confusing is they sent the driver early that night. Instead of waiting at the airport, the driver  spent his time sleeping at the parking area only with no sense of responsibility and almost forgot that we are already waiting for him for 2 hours. Imagine? The driver then came and showed up after 2 hours in an irritable mood with no greetings as he just asked our name. No apologies made and was obviously bothered as we saw his face from from sleep. He didn’t picked up our bags and told us only to follow him to the parking area.  We then reached the hotel around 02:30 hrs and there was one guy outside the hotel simply standing with no initiative that he got work to do. No signs of customer service and effort to greet the guest and worst didn’t helped carry our bags while it was very obvious that we need helped so we  ended up dragging our bags towards the reception.The receptionist on-duty that night  was not customer service as well  and was not accommodated. We asked him why we weren’t picked early from the airport? Instead he makes a lot of  excuses and lies on why were picked late.  He told us that the driver came at 23:55 hrs but why he let us waited for 2 hours?  Illogical reason.While at the reception, we  didn’t feel we are welcome as no greetings made and the receptionist guy is not really in a position to deal with guest. As we were escorted to our rooms, we noticed the passage way/lobby was very smelly and it was really strong like it emanated from the sewage and lots of bed mattresses  kept along the sides of  the hallway near to the doors. I have so much to say regarding our room hygiene. The phone was visibly dirty and dusty, pillow covers (picture attached) with obvious stained as it looks like it was flipped down  and was not changed for long time and was not washed.  Bathroom was dirty and the toilet sit bowls was obviously messy.  Without any disposable tissues as well. Really frustrating. We then called the reception and It took long time to attend for our needs and waited  to get our beds to get ready and making sure its clean  before we lie down to rest. Took really long time to wait in getting rid of the dirty beddings, we also asked to change our bath towels as it has yellowish stained. We then only sleep at around 03:30 in the morning we only started sleeping. Finally, at the time of our check out, our bags are ready and 2 helper guys were just simply standing at the lobby and no one dared to help us to  bring our bags outside the hotel. This is such an awful experience and frustrating hotel service. This is the first time and  the last time we will be staying in this hotel. Not recommendable. You better see it by yourself and try for this once in a last time experience.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Esteemed Guest, Warm Greetings! 
Customer satisfaction is something that we take very seriously and would never compromise under any circumstances. We apologies for the inconvenience caused to you. Your comfort and satisfaction are of the utmost importance to us, and we deeply regret that we fell short of meeting your expectations. Please know that we are taking your feedback seriously and are actively working to address the issue that you encountered. We are reviewing our procedures to ensure that such incidents do not happen again in the future. Your experience matters to us, and we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with the exceptional service that you deserve. We are committed to learning from this situation and improving our services based on your insights. Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention, and we hope to welcome you back to our hotel in the future for a much-improved stay.

title: Perfect Stay :  Comfortable & Convenient
text:
I had a fantastic stay at this airport-side hotel. The location couldn’t be more convenient — just minutes from the terminal with a reliable, free shuttle service that runs on time. Check-in was smooth and efficient, even during late hours.

The room was clean, quiet, and well-appointed, with a very comfortable bed and curtains that made it easy to rest after a long flight. I especially appreciated the soundproofing — I barely heard any noise.

Staff were friendly, professional, and helpful with recommendations and arranging transportation. The on-site restaurant had a solid menu with good quality food, perfect if you’re too tired to venture out.

Highly recommend this hotel for anyone with an early flight, layover, or business trip. I’ll definitely stay here again.

title: Convenient for airport
text: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights on arrival in Mumbai. It is really convenient for the airport which was great. The other positives are the Solitaire Restaurant where the staff were very friendly and helpful and the food absolutley delicious if slightly on the pricey side for India but we expect this in an hotel. Our room was spacious and well equipped with a fridge, kettle with plenty of tea and coffee and air con. There is also a safe and a hairdryer. On a less positive note it is tired looking and really could do with a lick of paint. The pool looked really lovely and there is a shower room with towels provided but sadly no place to sit around the pool which was disappointing as we had a free afternoon  on arrival and would have loved to relax around the pool but couldn't. There was a lack of information in the room about where things are, timings etc which could be improved. We tried to go for a pre dinner drink in the bar but were told we couldn't and needed to go to the restaurant. This may have been because there was an engagement one day and a wedding the next so perhaps the bar is reserved for those guests but not great. Finally my biggest gripe was that breakfast was included but we slept in and just had time for a coffee before our tour began. There was only milky coffee available, when I asked for a black coffee I was told I would have to pay extra. I didn't want an espresso just a cup of coffee without milk. I spoke to the front desk and they said they should have brought me one from the kitchen so possibly the person I asked was unaware but I was really annoyed and didn't get a coffee as didn't have time to go back. All in all a great hotel for a short stay in Mumbai.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Moira,
Thank you for your wonderful feedback! We're delighted to hear that you found Hotel Kohinoor Continental convenient for the airport and enjoyed the hospitality at Solitaire Restaurant. It's great to know you appreciated the spacious room and amenities. 

Your comments regarding the pool area and the lack of information in the room are truly valued and will be looked into for improvements. We're sorry for the inconvenience you faced regarding your coffee request and appreciate your understanding during the busy days of events. 

Thank you again for sharing your experience, and we hope to welcome you back for another stay in the future!

Regards,
Hotel Kohinoor Continental team
placeInfo/address: Andheri Kurla Road Andheri E, Mumbai 400059 India
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Andheri E

title: A Comfortable Stay
text:
During my recent business trip, I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel, and I must say it met my expectations. The hotel offers a welcoming ambiance that truly feels like home, making it a great place to unwind after long workdays.

One of the highlights was the buffet breakfast, which provided a wide variety of delicious options to start the day right. The dinner buffet was equally amazing, offering an impressive selection of dishes that cater to different tastes.

The rooms were spotlessly clean and well-maintained, which added to the overall comfort of my stay. I must also commend the courteous and attentive staff, especially Namrata and Ameya, who went out of their way to ensure that I had everything I needed. Their hospitality made a significant difference in my experience.

I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting for business or leisure. It offers great service, comfort, and a sense of home away from home.
