title: Hotel Experience
text: Landed in Mumbai, India for the first time as a family trip. To make everything short I will share the good side and the bad side of our stay. My reviews is about this hotel that we stayed in. Starting from the good side, wifi  was pretty much stable and no interruption in internet connection you can surf with ease. Distance from the airport by rental car was 15 minutes and if you opted for a  public transportation (toktok or autorickshaw) it’ll take you  about 30 minutes to reached it. However, the bad side of our stay is far beyond our expectations. We pre arrange everything to the hotel and as they mentioned and as what normally hotel would do is to provide a driver with signage board with names of the passengers at the arrival area. We then reached the airport at 00:10 hrs midnight and took us around few minutes to finally passed the immigration and yes we finally  made it out to the arrival area.Following scenarios are really unexpected.We waited long time for the driver after we came out from the airport. Frustrated and devastated because no one was there for us. Needless to say but I have to let you know that we are tired and exhausted from travel and all we want is to get to the hotel to take rest. Despite of the humid weather outside the airport we still look and searched for our names and still we didn’t lose hope looking for the driver. We were indeed desperate and started to lose our patience until someone step-in to helped us contact the hotel. Someone answered the phone and to our surprised he was not  aware that we’ve been waiting for long time already at the airport and what’s confusing is they sent the driver early that night. Instead of waiting at the airport, the driver  spent his time sleeping at the parking area only with no sense of responsibility and almost forgot that we are already waiting for him for 2 hours. Imagine? The driver then came and showed up after 2 hours in an irritable mood with no greetings as he just asked our name. No apologies made and was obviously bothered as we saw his face from from sleep. He didn’t picked up our bags and told us only to follow him to the parking area.  We then reached the hotel around 02:30 hrs and there was one guy outside the hotel simply standing with no initiative that he got work to do. No signs of customer service and effort to greet the guest and worst didn’t helped carry our bags while it was very obvious that we need helped so we  ended up dragging our bags towards the reception.The receptionist on-duty that night  was not customer service as well  and was not accommodated. We asked him why we weren’t picked early from the airport? Instead he makes a lot of  excuses and lies on why were picked late.  He told us that the driver came at 23:55 hrs but why he let us waited for 2 hours?  Illogical reason.While at the reception, we  didn’t feel we are welcome as no greetings made and the receptionist guy is not really in a position to deal with guest. As we were escorted to our rooms, we noticed the passage way/lobby was very smelly and it was really strong like it emanated from the sewage and lots of bed mattresses  kept along the sides of  the hallway near to the doors. I have so much to say regarding our room hygiene. The phone was visibly dirty and dusty, pillow covers with obvious stained as it looks like it was flipped down  and was not changed for long time and was not washed.  Bathroom was dirty and the toilet sit bowls was obviously messy.  Without any disposable tissues as well. Really frustrating. We then called the reception and It took long time to attend for our needs and waited  to get our beds to get ready and making sure its clean  before we lie down to rest. Took really long time to wait in getting rid of the dirty beddings, we also asked to change our bath towels as it has yellowish stained. We then only sleep at around 03:30 in the morning we only started sleeping. Finally, at the time of our check out, our bags are ready and 2 helper guys were just simply standing at the lobby and no one dared to help us to  bring our bags outside the hotel. This is such an awful experience and frustrating hotel service. This is the first time and  the last time we will be staying in this hotel. Not recommendable. You better see it by yourself and try for this once in a last time experience.
placeInfo/address: B.N. Agarwal Commercial Complex Vile Parle East, next to Dinanath Mangeshkar Hall, Mumbai 400057 India
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Vile Parle East, next to Dinanath Mangeshkar Hall

title: PATHETIC HOTEL AND EQUALLY RUDE STAFF
text:
We checked into the hotel on the 1st of December’21.
Had booked a club room(a higher catogory room) but was checked into an executive room(the regular basic room).
On asking for it was shown to another room.
The lock wasn’t working in it.
Each time we moved out and came back to our room…the lick would get stuck and we would have to call the hotel staff for help.
To which they would say that we don’t  know how to operate the lock!!!to be noted that even the hotel staff would struggle to open it each  time.
The staff at the reception was so so rude towards us in front of so many other guests.
The rooms are unhygienic…even in covid times(omnicom strain times),there are no safety protocols that are being followed.
Not even a basic sanitizer is being provided in the room!
The staff is with  their masks under their chins.
The food being served in the dining  is cold and unhygienic.
Overall a very very disappointing experience and not worth a single star!
I wish there was a negative rating as well!!!

title: High price & low service
text: I was staying in the hotel for the quarantine for 7 days. I selected this hotel because it's near to my house. Category on Google is 4 star but service is like 2 star. Firstly bad smell in rooms & corridor. No refrigerator in the room. Room was smelling really bed when I entered. No hot water switch for the bathing. Toilet cammod very dirty. 2nd day when I took bath all water bloged in the bathtub. When I told the below reception area they are like it will go automatically but it didn't. I had to call twice then they send some technical team. They don't have room service that's fine. But when I am ordering from swiggy or zomato they are telling me come down & take it. Atleast hotel people can do that. When I keeping dustbin out to clean they are just taking trash and they were not changing the bean bag also. No cleaning rooms until 7 days of stay. Only good thing about this hotel is food. Not that good but then it's fine. 1st & 2nd day I got food on time otherwise 1/2 hour - 1hour late always. Please as per the rates you need to upgrade your services. Hotel stinks a lot.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Greetings from Hotel Parle International!!

We are disappointed to hear that your experience was less than impressive. We greatly appreciate your feedback, as we use it as a means to improve. 
I request you to accept our sincerest apologies for the discomfort you have experienced. This is not indicative of the level of service to which we strive to achieve.
With regards to your feedback, we have discussed it in detail with the concerned Department Heads for immediate corrective action.We would be personally addressing and correcting all such quality related defects and we ensure that such errors are never repeated.
It is also our sincere request to forgive us and bestow upon us another opportunity to serve you in the near future with an assurance of better and improved services.

We remain at your service and look forward to welcome you back at Hotel Parle International.

title: Rude and unhelpful and overpriced
text: Was a stopover in Mumbai and so chose this hotel. Had arrived in early hours of the morning. Went and had breakfast and decided to get some sleep. All of a sudden there was drilling and hammering. Was not told on arrival  or when booking that they were going to carry out refurbishment. Didn't get any rest till night. How terrible !!! The next day the breakfast area was moved and no one to guide you. The AC was very old with half of the flaps damaged or missing. The bedsheets were roughly stitched over were the big tears had occurred. Cleaners have there own temperament. None of the staff from reception to cleaners ever smile. No one wishes good morning or bye. Do they think that we don't have other options??? They must be kidding themselves as Mumbai has many hotels and some budget hotels I found were much nicer in everything from staff behaviour, ambience to helpfulness. Would not recommend this hotel unless none of the above makes no difference. I have my pride and respect which no one has right to insult.

title: Excellent location, good service
text:
For a visitor to Mumbai this hotel is exceptionally located for easy walking to major sights, plus access to a nearby train station for travelling further afield.

Rooms are spacious and well furnished. Breakfast on the roof is decent. Service is good.

The only complaint we have is that the WiFi constantly was failing and it is pedantic requiring entry of a unique login and password per user (can't share devices). That is disappointing.

We would stay again because the location is excellent.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Awesome Experience
text: One of the excellent hotel with awesome support experience. This hotel indeed knows how to manage their guests well and are committed to enhancing rich customer experience with wonderful memories to cherish.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Pleasant and peaceful
text: I had a very restful and comfortable stay here - I found the staff to be pleasant and helpful, and the location is good - walking distance to everything but not in the thick of it. Rooms are very clean and breakfast on the roof.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good stay, still standard required
text: Place is good and clean, you can enjoy sunset in the evening on near beach road. Service is good, morning complimentary breakfast they may add few more items. They need to focus on window screen and spring bed,bring into standard like other 3,4 star hotels.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Sehr entgegenkommend
text:
Als wir nach einer Flugverspätung nachts um 23h im Hotel ankamen, wurden wir begrüßt mit: Sie waren für gestern gebucht! Ein Schock für uns, aber es wurde schnell noch ein Zimmer für uns fertig gemacht und wir sollten am nächsten Tag erfahren, ob wir die weiteren 3 Tage dort bleiben könnten. Unser Zimmer hatte alles was nötig ist ist: AC, Kühlschrank, Safe, funktionierendes Bad: wir waren glücklich, dass wir nicht noch ein anderes Hotel suchen mussten. Am nächsten Tag erfuhren wir, dass wir in unserem Zimmer bleiben können und so konnten wir das Frühstück auf der Dachterrasse genießen. Dies wurde von einem ausgesprochen netten Kellner serviert. Wir sind dem Personal an der Rezeption sehr dankbar, dass sie unseren Aufenthalt trotz der Fehlbuchung möglich machen konnten.
Unser Zimmer im 3. Stock war gemütlich, aber es scheint sehr unterschiedliche Kategorien zu geben, die sich natürlich auch auf den Preis auswirken.  Wir würden jederzeit gern wieder dort wohnen, vor allem auch wegen der sehr günstigen Lage.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Sehr empfehlenswert
text: Das Chateau Windsor besticht mit seiner guten Lage. In der Nähe des Hotels gibt es einige gute Restaurants, Cafés und Bars. Alle wichtigen Sehenswürdigkeiten sind zu Fuß zu erreichen. Unser Zimmer war top, das Personal stets freundlich und hilfsbereit. Waren 6 Nächte dort, würde jederzeit sofort wieder dort nächtigen.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Bestens geeignet zur Erkundung von Colaba
text:
Das Hotel liegt leicht erreichbar in der Nariman Road neben dem Churchgate terminal, etwa 150 Meter entfernt vom Marine Drive,  dem Boulevard der Stadt an der Westküste zum Indischen Ozean. Sowohl das Hotel als auch die nähere Umgebung sind sicher. Restaurants und Cafes befinden sich in der Straße.
Ein Fahrstuhl bringt die Gäste in die Rezeption in der 5. Etage. Die Zimmer in der ersten Etage sind geräumig und sehr sauber. Hand- und Badetücher werden täglich gewechselt.
Safe, Air-Cond, Kühlschrank sind vorhanden.
Im Zimmerpreis ist das Frühstück enthalten, das entweder auf dem Dach oder wenn es zu heiß wird am Morgen, auch am Zimmer serviert wird. Lobby oder Frühstücksraum sind nicht vorhanden.
Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilft bei Fragen oder Problemen.
Experte  in Handyangelegenheiten ist Mr Xavier Jacob.
Taxifahrer vor dem Hotel sind vertrauenswürdig und halten sich an vorher vereinbarte  Abmachungen zu einem guten Preis.  
Der Check out wurde um 3 Stunden ohne Aufpreis verlängert.
Man fühlt sich im Hotel gut aufgehoben.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: a bit disappointing
text: service wasn't quite as good as the reviews suggest:  we found them pretty curt, and VERY keen to throw us out before checkout time.  Also pretty expensive - try visiting the hotel's own website for cheaper deals
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Where to stay at Marine Drive???
text: I was searching for the good location and hotel to stay for few months until I came across Chateau Windsor. The way the manage their customers, their staff I must say they are good, extremely good. Although they don't have restaurant but they do provide daily breakfast which is quite standard for Vege and Non Vege. All the restaurant looked next to this hotel is walking distances. Marine Drive is 10 minutes walk from this hotel. Church gate Railway station 15-20 minutes walk from this hotel. Chatrappati Sivaji Terminal located 20-25 minutes walking from this hotel. Same goes to Gateway of India. Other facilities hot water 24 hours, Cable TV, and yes you could order food from nearby restaurant from hotel staffs. They have WIFI connection too.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good budget option
text: This is a good budget option when staying in Mumbai. The rooms seem quite new; they are clean and well-equipped. Staff are very friendly and keen to be of service. The surrounding area is just OK, albeit better than average for Mumbai, which sadly is not a terribly pleasant city to visit.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Central Location
text:
The hotel is ideally located near Church gate Station and within stones throw from the Nariman Point.
Rooms are a bit small but comfortable. Two double beds rooms for 4 are quite big enough for a family.
Need an improvement in Breakfast Menu.
Otherwise it's worth it's value.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Comfortable and good location
text: On arrival, 7 hours before checkin, I was given a small single room to freshen up and grab some sleep. I was offered complimentary tea, coffee, or beer! This was something they did not have to do, but did none the less. Very kind of them. Although the room was a bit rough, it had air con and was very welcome. When I got my room, it was just what I needed. Clean, nice comfortable bet, good air con and fan. The bathroom was a wet room, though the showers temperature control was a bit hit and miss it was fine. The room was also large, I felt very comfortable for my week. The hotel is old fashioned in look, but has lots of character. I especially liked the old lift, always atttended and quite a piece of machinery. It was not loud at all, and my room was near it. Breakfast was limited, but fine for me with eggs or veg cutlet toast, jam, banana, tea or coffee. What made it great was having it on the roof terrace watching the sunrise. A really lovely spot to start the day. I really loved looking at the various plants being grown, including Produce such as Okra, spinach, courgettes, and figs! No restaurant, but room service does good snacks e.g. Sandwiches, omelettes etc. You can order food from local restaurants and have them delivered. It's good to have these on the terrace, with a beer. The hotel will sell you beer, even though it's not on the menu. The hotel is surprisingly quiet, being so central. I had not one bad nights sleep. The staff were all lovely, especially the door staff who were such a laugh! They were very keen to help with taxis etc. The 'management' could be a bit abrasive, but this did not ruin anything. It bacame a bit of a joke how they like to throw their weight about a bit. My room was cleaned each day, and the hotel is indeed nice and clean. I had no bouts of upset stomach all week. Not many negatives, but the hotel could have perhaps been a bit more helpful when we were having trouble getting cash, due to the 500 and 1000 rupee withdrawals and the chaos thereafter. Price was good considering the fine location near marine drive and the comfort of the rooms. I would recommend you pay a little extra for the deluxe rooms, saw an older room and the was not as good. Myself and the people I travelled with would definitely reccommend this hotel.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Pleasant .. Good service and value
text: Following a nightmare first night in Mumbai we stumbled across the Chateau Windsor who were glad to accommodate us.  Location is really good, close to Marine Drive and many good bars and restaurants.  Breakfast is a seriously pleasant experience on the roof with good service and a pleasant outlook.  All in all, great value with clean rooms and really good staff throughout.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent value for money in Mumbai & great service
text: After an awful experience at Fabhotel Crawford Market/New Bengal Hotel (whatever you do, do not book that hotel!) we found the Chateau Windsor had rooms available and quickly moved. The staff were incredibly welcoming from the front door, to reception, to the cleaning team: always saying hello, always smiling and always happy to help. We had to wait for our room to be cleaned on arrival and so we were offered complementary tea, coffee and water. The interior of this hotel is in great condition...I saw some comments about the lift but I loved it and thought it added to the character between new and old world. The rooms were very much new world: good quality furniture, comfy beds, excellent shower (although took a while for hot water to works its way down to the 1st floor room), modern safe, good air con, working wifi, everything you'd hope for. The location of this hotel right next to Marine Drive is also excellent. The breakfast is basic but the view over the city from the rooftop is fantastic. I cannot recommend this hotel enough to mid-range travellers, book it!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good service
text: Its an excellent located hotel with good staff. Spacious & clean rooms however with no restaurant but a small kitchen. They offer delivery from nearby hotels which is good. The staff is very good & provides best in class service.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Best Affordable Hotel
text: Great location. Don't be deceived by the look of the hotel exterior. It has clean room, very nice and helpful staff. Good WiFi. Nice breakfast at rooftop. I would recommend this hotel to any budget travellers.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good for the Stay... Not good for the food !!
text:
Happen to stay in this hotel for a day. Nice and clean rooms. However the entrance and lifts are not at par with the hotel. Its a converted hotel from a Flats.

Limited offering for breakfast and all other foods are from outside.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Prawdziwych przyjaciół poznajemy w biedzie
text: Do hotelu trafiliśmy w momencie wymiany banknotów w Indiach. Stare banknoty przestały być ważne, nowych jeszcze nie było. Bankomaty nie działały. Dyrekcja hotelu ułatwiła nam wymianę starych na nowe banknoty. Pracownicy zadzwonili do biura podróży, abyśmy mogli wymienić Euro na rupie. Załatwiona przez recepcję taksówka zawiozła nas na lotnisko ze resztę wymienianych przez nas rupii, czyli ze zniżką 50%. Gorąco polecamy.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Nice place in south Mumbai
text:
We have stayed here few days back. The location of this hotel is amazing. It is very close to the sea (by walking 1-2 minutes) as well as form Churchgate Station. You can get view of Brabourne Stadium from your balcony. There are plenty of eating / shopping option nearby and you can go to nearby tourist spots like colaba, Gateway of India, marine drive etc by walking. 

Hotel stuffs are very helpful and breakfast buffet was good. They also provide godrej vault for safeguarding your valuables.

Overall a nice experience.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: good midrange at great location
text:
a stone's throw from Marine Drive, this small hotel proved to be a good base for a few days in south Mumbai.

Deluxe room was nice and clean enough, the mattress seemed a bit old, the aircon has seen better days; bathroom was ok and clean

Reception was a bit odd, a lot of different faces over the few days I stayed here, but always helpful, if not overly friendly, but that may just be Mumbai briskness

Breakfast in-room only, basic yet sufficient, to be enjoyed by, what I regard as a nice, complimentary daily Indian newspaper

Location, as said before, is good; there's a few restaurants nearby, among which a terrific veg restaurant, Shiv Sagar; look for the crowd of people waiting to get seated, it is popular, for a reason; a (rather bland) Chinese one (Kamling) if you got Mumbai-belly problems and a more upmarket one (Gaylord, across the street and over the fence) if you want to play safe or splurge a bit; Churchgate station is just a few minutes walk

Colaba is a stiff 10-minute walk, through some rather nice and interesting streets, but outside there're lots of taxis that will take you there for a dime

WIR: I would.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good place, calm
text: Near all shops by walk, in the center of the town, appreciated this rooms wich was very clean, staffs all are very sympa, they take care of you, only problem when you return during the night time all auto walls avoid you, so we wlked few kms.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Very nice hotel and smiley staff
text:
This place is in an amazing location just around marine drive. The staff is super super smiley and friendly and are willing to help out in everything! 
The only downside is the cost is a little overprice. We had a little misunderstanding , we decided to stay 2 more nights without asking the price (never ever do this in India!!) assuming it will be the same, at checkout we discovered that the new price was 1200 extra rupees! So sad, this hotel was almost perfect and at the end that!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Not our kind of place
text: The rain was pouring down and we found ourselves in a hotel with no common areas at all. The hotel was most likely built in the 50's and I guess nothing has been done since it was new. We had breakfast included, but even that was brought to our not so pleasant room. The mattress was the thinnest we have ever seen in a hotel og b&b before and after to nights my back complained. I am surprised to see how high rating this hotel has got in some web pages, but after being there I guess it fits local male business people well. If the hotel want to attract more western people my advise would be to give the hotel a "female touch", and at least change the mattresses. On the positive side the staff was nice and helpful.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: My home in Mumbai
text: I come here yearly and feel that I really know the staff. They treat me like a returning friend or relative.  There are some fun features like breakfast on the roof, a view of the sea and a chance to have a daily walk along Marine Drive- the promenade by the ocean. Great restaurants all around. Twenty-four hour service and kindness, many staff ready to bring water, food, tea, coffee, sewing, laundry, ironing or any other needs. Really super when you are far away from home.  I am so grateful. This is my 4th stay in this lovely hotel- I have brought many friends with me.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Perfect Hideout Near Marine Drive
text:
I have stayed here in past and stayed here with my wife again. this hotel is closest to Marine Drive and churchgate station.
Oberoi Hotel & Pizza by the bay is walking distance, lot of eateries right next to the Hotel as well.
It is a boutique hotel which offers only bed & breakfast no other meal.
Do not expect any view from the hotel.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Sehr gute Mittelklasse im touristischen Zentrum
text:
Waren eine Woche im Hotel. Gern kommen wir wieder. 
Superfreundliches Personal, hilfsbereit, aufmerksam. Zimmer und Duschbad sauber. Täglich! Morgens die Zeitung an der Tür. Funktionierender Zimmerservice. Aber auch eigener Kühlschrank im Zimmer. Super Wäscheservice - bis 10:00 abgegeben, um 17:00 fertig! Gebügelt!
Was fehlt: Ein Frühstücksraum und mehr Auswahl beim Frühstück. Die Dachterrasse ist sehr dem Wind von der Küste ausgesetzt, aber Blick bis Marine-Drive.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Naja
text:
Preis/Leistung nicht gerechtfertigt. Wir zahlten zu dritt 90 Euro für ein Zimmer, welches renovierungsbedürftig war. Das Hotel selbst ist optisch nicht ansprechend und auch die Sauberkeit lässt zu wünschen übrig.
Auch die Dachterrasse könnte ein paar neuere und schönere Möbel vertragen. Personal allerdings sehr zuvorkommend und hilfsbereit ohne Trinkgeld zu erwarten. 
Die Lage ist natürlich fast nicht zu übertreffen.
Insgesamt nicht weiterzuempfehlen, lieber ein bisschen mehr Geld in die Hand nehmen und eines der 5 Sterne Hotels wählen, welche bei dem aufgerufen Preis des Chateau Windsor geradezu günstig erscheinen.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Expensive stay.
text: The place is too expensive ( the guys next door at Ambassador which was a bigger place were ready to match the price for better service).The room we stayed had a good view.Breakfast was ok and served in the room, no buffet. The location is great as it is bang on the marine drive. But restaurants outside are expensive if you go out for food. Be prepared for that.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Family holiday near Marine drive
text: Excellent location for this price had to upgrade the room to deluxe room which are good. Best option available at Marine drive . Must be for budget people 6K other hotels are expensive and not so great location as well
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A home away from home
text:
I just walked in into this hotel n enquire about rates for a triple. The Manager Mr Raja showed us the various available rooms and made me most welcomed and feel like home. 
The rooms are spacious and very clean with a balcony. 
Location is ideal, just a short walk to Churchgate train station and the sea side is also a few minutes walk
Breakfast in the room was convenient for me due to my condition and was also tasty. 
Security is excellent with guards at front entrance n lift attendant 
Overall Chateau Windsor Hotel is an excellent hotel to stay at a reasonable price.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Memorable stay
text: Superb. Great. Memorable. We were planning a visit to mumbai to celebrate my birthday but the thought of keeping my pet away was troubling us. We found this hotel which was pet friendly and we booked a room and it was so pleasing. God bless them
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: voyage de groupe
text: Hôtel simple mais très bien placé (gare entre autre). Belle terrasse pour le petit déjeuner (basique mais correct). Cet établissement est idéal pour les pour les groupes. Le personnel est sympa et le service correct.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good Value Hotel
text: Great Location - Marina Bay around the corner and a short taxi ride or longish but doable walk to India Gate and the Taj Palace, train station around the corner. Lovely friendly staff. Room was fab Comfortable beds and nice en suite, small balcony which looked out onto a side street. Breakfast on the roof terrace, no lounge at this hotel but weather was hot so we sat up on roof terrace.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Quaint Budget Hotel in Fantastic Location
text:
You can walk down to Marine Drive from this hotel, that should be enough of a sell. But at budget rates? Unbelievable!! With clean rooms and linens?? Even better!! Friendly staff to top it all?? Super!!

The Chateau Windsor is a quaint budget hotel with a set of appartments having been converted to rooms. However the rooms are well maintained and the staff is super helpful. A stone's throw from Colaba and the rest of SoBo.

Great place at budget rates. Highly recommend.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great Location
text:
The Chateau Windsor, where I stayed for 2 nights on a sudden business trip last week, is not a conventional hotel. As the photographs clearly show, it is a block of apartments converted to a guest house. There's a liftman to greet you as you step off the road, and whisk you up to the 5th floor where you check in at a quaint little reception room, and can almost expect to see an old epabx board with wires:-) You sign in to a large register and are given a heavy key.

I was shown in to a room on the 2nd floor which was very clean, with a nice little balcony overlooking the road outside. The toilet was very clean too, and the airconditioning worked alright. 

The amenities are minimal, which can perhaps be expected because this is very much a budget hotel. This means you will need to carry your own soap, shampoo etc. Instead of a bath mat there is a little piece of astroturf to absorb the water. However clean towels are provided.

The Chateau Windsor has no restaurants but will bring the complimentary breakfast to your room in around 15 minutes. They will also bring you any food you may order from the variety of menu cards of nearby hotels, placed in your room. The comlimentary wi fi did not work on my laptop or mobile and a call to the recepton yielded nothing more than 'I will call you back,' and no such call came.

The staff were courteous until my son accidentally stepped out with the room key and I had to request a master key to let myself in. They made their displeasure visible, and opened my room but refused to leave the duplicate key so the room remained in darkness and I could only manage to see anything by leaving the door wide open. Fortunately I only needed 2 minutes to pick up something and leave. I cannot blame them really because they may have been worried I will walk off with the duplicate too!

In terms of security, it may feel a little scary for single women, although I did not see anything to support that view. Just that it does not have the usual trappings of a hotel, with a door man/ reception/ security which can stop non-residents from entering, and which we, perhaps foolishly, imagine is security enough:-) If my adult son was not staying with me I may have considered moving out after seeing the place.

The best feature of the hotel and what makes it a great place of course is its location. Barely 2/3 minutes away from the Marine Drive, where you can take long leisurely walks and take in the sea breeze, after a hectic day at work. It is also within 15 minutes walking distance of the Churchgate train station.

Al in all the stay was not bad. Would I stay there again, perhaps if I had to!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Ok value for money but grim hotel
text:
Stayed a few nights here, location is good only few miles from the sights of south mumbai and no issues with noise, the price is why we chose the hotel it is good value for the location

Taxi drivers cant find if you have to say the ambassador hotel which is next door

Rooms were clean, breakfast ok and delivered to the room as no eating area.  However the hotel is worn down, small and depressing place to come back to at the end of the day, but ok for a night or two just to sleep.  No restaurent/bar or area to chill and lift is manually operated.  Staff were friendly 

However i would personally recommend spending a few extra rupees and staying somewhere nicer, would not stay again
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: God hotel and in good area
text:
The hotel is good, and getting a bit worn out, so management needs to start some improvement works as some items have reached their end of life. But it is situated in a very good area, so at walking distances from the beach, Churchgate and even the gateway to India. 
And, very important: management will make facilities available in the afternoon/evening for those wanting to take a shower or go to toilet before going to the Airport - a very appreciated service. Breakfast is relatively simpel, although the roof terrace might needs some improvement (now it's a plain terrace with some tables and some chairs, not very inviting to have a bit longer stay). Good value for money. WiFi is free, but not that easy to use.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: charming hotel
text:
Chateau Windsor Hotel is at 86 Veer Nariman Road, Churchgate, Mumbai which is walking distance from Churchgate metro train station. We three member family stay there 2 nights. Third day after check out hotel management allow us to keep our luggage inside room so that when we return back from very not weather we can fresh, change dress if necessary and depart to our next destination.  Hotel surrounding is very good. You can see Arabian sea from the hotel and cricket stadium is adjacent to the hotel. Gate of India and Taj are only 5 minutes auto ride from Hotel. Hotel also can organise taxi for tourist.

This hotel provide morning breakfast in our room. Reception and security in the hotel gate available 24 hours.  Though the hotel is adjacent to a 5 stars hotel known as Ambassdor hotel and you may feel that Chateau Windsor is not so good, but inside hotel you will feel homely and I would like to recommend it for family.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Beautiful Bombay
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights. There were 3 of us. There was a sofa in the room which they made up with sheets. There is a lovely rooftop area where you can sit and have breakfast or just sit. 
The hotel is very close to the waterfront and only a short walk away from Churchgate Railway station. We stayed in this area because we were attending a cricket match at Wankhede Stadium which is also within easy walking distance.
Hotels in this area are quite a way from the Airport which can be a nuisance when the traffic is bad.
Breakfasts are free, fairly basic but the coffee is excellent. My only complaint was the safe in our room was not working and even though we asked several times, it was not fixed the entire time.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Vibes of Great Management/Courteous Staff at Premium Location
text:
Great place to stay in Southern Mumbai. BIG rooms with subtle interiors. Food is superb- Veg Cutlets are must to have in your breakfast.

Located at Marine Drive gives you an edge to visit Mumbai's favorite restaurants and hangouts.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: High Price Low maintenance- Big Name but false Fame
text:
This was the last minute booking that was made on 22nd August this year. However one thing was satisfactory that they had the rooms available. 
However, just to realise the rooms would be available anyhow as the location of the hotel is not very much in demand, hence rooms should be available in the last minute as well. It states itself as a 3star hotel, however I would rate it as a 2star only.

Few Pros and Cons about the hotel:
Pros:
The room service is 24/7 and is very responsive : 5/5
House Keeping: 5/5
Hotel Maintenance :4/5
Most of the staff are courteous and they listen to you.
Near the local market, where everything is accessible.

Cons:
Hotel is too old: 3/5
The furniture, the walls and the interiors need a repair or get renovated: 3/5
Buffet breakfast doesn't have good options : 2/5
I could see the same breakfast buffet everyday in my 4days of stay: 1/5
Seating area near the buffet section is very small, it can hardly accommodate 30-35 if you share your table with others : 2/5
Walls inside need to be painted: 3/5
The head rest and the sofas need to be changed as someone can feel the springs when you sit on the sofa: 1/5
No Hot water inside the rooms(We had to call the technician to get it fixed for oneday, the other days, we managed with the luke warm water): 2/5
No proper toiletries placed: 3/5
Hairdryer doesn't get fixed on the stand: 3/5
No Minifridge inside the room as shown in the amenities: 0/5
Wifi is literally very slow, it is equal to having a no WiFi; 1/5
No Safe provided: 0/5
Cost paid as per the room is not worth
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from Hotel Parle International!!

Firstly, I wish to thank you for taking out the time to write a constructive feedback to us.

I request you to accept our sincerest apologies for the discomfort you have experienced. This is not indicative of the level of service to which we strive to achieve.

At Hotel Parle International, It is our endeavor to provide our guests, services that are friendly, attentive and timely. With these endeavor in pursuit, we would love to see all our guests depart with only a positive memory of their stay.

Once again, I request you to accept our sincerest apologies for the discomfort you have experienced at the hotel and we wish to serve you with authentic hospitality, upon your next visit.
Sincerely,
Sunny Vanmali, Rooms Division Manager.

title: Old but comfortable Hotel
text:
Stayed at the Villa Parle International for one night in January 2019 as part of a stop over - The hotel is centrally located nearby the markets and arcades with stores, which was convenient, and is also not far from the Mumbai airport. 

We were given a room at first in a building opposite the main hotel but due to the building being isolated (Nothing was wrong with the room - If anything, it was more spacious) but as 2 ladies travelling together, there was nobody else occupying a room in the building, with only the security guard on the ground floor, so we asked for a room in the main hotel where there was more activity. 

The main hotel seems to be beautifully decorated but old, and it seems like they are in the process of undergoing repairs. We were provided with a simple, clean room. If you require a hot shower, I suggest ensuring that the geyser is switched on. Breakfast was a simple affair, but tasty. Wifi was very good. It's a nice hotel to stay at for a stop over.

Highly recommend that you eat the Thali at the hotel's restaurant. Quite an experience!

text:
Went on a short trip to Mumbai with family for two days . Stayed at Parle Residency . Reception desk was helpful and warm . Room upgraded at no extra charge , which was a nice gesture . Stayed in the old building which was slightly musty to say the least . Another irritant was the menace of mosquitoes which needs attending to .
Room was cozy and spacious .
Bathroom was clean .
Housekeeping needs to be more attentive to guest's needs . We had asked for a pair of scissors to cut the zip lock on our baggage , but none arrived .
Food (Snacks from room service) tasty and delicious .
Overall apart from a few irritants stay was comfortable and pleasant .

title: Avoidable
text:
The hotel has 3 buildings connected to each other. One is new rest of the two are old. On the website, pictures of new portion are shown, while old rooms are allotted with the charges of new rooms. 

The good: 
1. Rooms are clean. 
2. Close to Vile Parle station 

The bad: 
1. Small rooms. 
2. Badly maintained 
3. No window in the room. 
4. Exorbitantly priced 
5. Old fixtures, door handles wooden parts are not clean. 
6. Rubber grommets in the lift door are gone. The protruding screws scratch the passenger. 
7. The ambience doesn’t feel fresh. 
8. Commode is small and not of good quality. 
9. Kettle needs to be clean from outside and inside with clean water 

Conclusion: 
Stay only if you get a tariff below 3000 INR per night. This hotel is not worth more than that. 

The pictures posted on website are from the newly constructed portion. The new rooms are allotted only when old building is full. 

So insist on getting new room, better don’t make an advance payment for this property coz u may get stuck with old rooms like me. 

Housekeeping staff is good and supportive. The front desk seemed aloof. 

I am NEVER booking this property again in the rest of my life.
placeInfo/address: B.N. Agarwal Commercial Complex Vile Parle East, next to Dinanath Mangeshkar Hall, Mumbai 400057 India

title: Fantastic location
text: Small rooms and a very old hotel. The location though is fantastic. Close to Churchgate station and some fantastic dining options in the vicinity. Walking distance to Marine drive make the place worthwhile.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great Location
text: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel during our tour of Mumbai. The hotel is located only a 5 minute walk from the Churchgate railway station and less than 5 minute walk to the scenic Marine Drive. The area around the hotel is pedestrian friendly, lots of shops and restaurants nearby. At night one can walk on the marine drive and it is safe. This is a modest hotel, the reception is on the 5th floor, there is no lobby. We had the only room available on the top floor at the roof top terrace. With the room you get a private sitting area surrounded by garden of potted plants. Marine drive can be seen from the terrace and on a good day catch beautiful sunset. The rest of the terrace has beautiful plants/flowers as well and is used to serve breakfast to the hotel guests. There is no restaurant, there is limited menu including eggs/toast/tea which is served in the room or on the veranda. The room is compact, the bathroom is tight but manageable, we did not spend much time in the room as we were out sightseeing until late at night. The free wifi worked well in the room.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Outstanding service
text: We have been travelling for 10 weeks around the world and stayed in no less than 30 hotels and Chateau Windsor has by far the best customer service. The hotel is clean and efficient and we were made welcome by everyone. We booked a triple room and were given a choice of different rooms on arrival. Each night when we came back the staff at reception would be waiting with our key and the room had been thoroughly cleaned. I can recommend this hotel highly enough.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent Hotel
text: This is the second time we have stayed at the Chateau Windsor Hotel whilst visiting friends in India. The rooms have been refurbished and upgraded to a high standard. Comfortable beds, large bathroom, air conditioned. Very friendly staff. Great value for money.
user/userLocation/name: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
user/userLocation/shortName: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Very Comfortable and cozy Experience
text: This is a very old property and I stayed here in a small single room in year 2000. Again I stayed here for 2 days with family. The rooms were very spacious, very neat and clean and very decent. We stayed in a superior room on 5th Floor. The room was very good and all the staff were very supportive. The Hotel has a canteen with breakfast and limited menu but they have tie up with all the closeby eateries and can arrange a delivery in room. The best part is that hotel is few meters from Marine Drive and all major attractions of South Mumbai including Nariman Point , Gateway of India, Fort, Colaba , Girgaum Chowpaty, CST are all closeby. You can easily explore Mumbai from here. Very Nice experience
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Clean hotel in excellent location
text:
Stopping off in Mumbai after traveling for 4 months this hotel was an oasis in a crazy city. The friendly staff keep the hotel clean and the rooftop terrace is an added plus. Breakfast is served there every morning.
The room we had was modern with flat screen TV, the wifi was good, especially compared to some other places we stayed, and the download speed was fine.
The location makes visiting the museums and art galleries easy and because it is near Churchgate station it is simple to visit other areas of Mumbai by local train. There are a number of good restaurants for all budgets close by or you can order a take away of snacks in the hotel.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Old timer basic hotel
text: Its a basic hotel with well-kept clean rooms. It's has the feeling of being in the 70's, room and furniture are quite outdated. Staff service was efficient and knowledgable. The room itself was large and had a balcony overlooking the alley.  The location is ideal for exploring south Mumbai.  Pricing is decent compare to how expensive the city is. Wi-fi was ok to decent. Complimentary breakfast was basic but really all you needed.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Very good location, comfortable
text:
I have been 3 times in Mumbai and tried several hotels around 80 euros per night.

This one is my preferred one : good location, comfortable and quiet rooms, very good service. 

Only breakfast could improve : toasts, tea and very average marmelade every day.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Perfect Location but overall not a good Hotel
text:
The only plus point of the Hotel is Location. 

Otherwise rooms are not well equiped. 
They are still using CRTs, 
Beds are very uncomfortable. 
Bathrooms are too small. 
There is only one option for Breakfast one for veg and One for Non Veg. (that too one of the worst omelette)  

So at the price they are offering it looks like a very expensive option.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Clean hotel, perfect location, excellent staff
text:
We booked a room for 3 for one week.  The room was basic, but large and very clean.  The price was great and we were not expecting anything fancy.  The location was ideal for us, a very short walk to Churchgate station, a stones throw from Marine drive and a short taxi ride to Colaba or Crawford Market ways. 
The wifi was perfect and strong, never cut out once and automatically connected as soon as we stepped into the lift.
The one thing that stood out about this hotel was the staff, they were absolutely wonderful.  We were going to stay in another hotel the next week, but instead decided to re-book here for another week.  If you are looking for luxury then this is not a luxury hotel, but then that is reflected in the price. I would most definitely recommend this hotel, and would most happy stay here again.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent location, good experience
text: The best part of the hotel is that is next to Marine Drive, Churchgate, Fashion Street, Flora Fountain, and many other locations. We got the only room on the terrace, which provided us lot of privacy and almost exclusive access to the terrace. We got terrific views from there, including Brabourne Stadium. It is a budget hotel, so don't expect many amenities like tea/coffee maker, on-premises restaurant (you can order food from nearby restaurants), expansive lobby, etc. The rooms and washrooms are clean and reasonably spacious, staff is courteous, and overall a very safe and comfortable environment. I would recommend it to everybody who wants a good stay at a low cos.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
Stayed at Chateau Windsor for 3 nights in January located next to  Marine Drive
this is a very good location and a easy to walk to the attractions with good 
restaurants nearby. The management and staff are excellent the room was
spacious and very clean breakfast is served in room or on roof terrace by friendly
staff. I would Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning to stay in Mumbai
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Hotel OVERVIEW
text:
5.1 km from Mumbai Central Railway Station, 2.5 km from Marine Drive, 2.2 km from Gateway of India, Wi-Fi internet

Chateau Windsor Hotel is located on Veer Nariman Road in Churchgate, Mumbai, within walking distance from Nariman Point and Gateway of India. Just 10 minutes drive from Mumbai's main railway station, this 2 star hotel features 50 spacious Deluxe Rooms. Cable TV, telephone, Wi-Fi internet and electronic safe are fitted in all rooms.

Those who want to explore the best of what Mumbai has on offer can avail sightseeing assistance from the on-site travel desk. Laundry, doctor-on-call, car parking, airport transfer and 24-hour room service are other services offered at the hotel.

Guests are served with delicious food at their respective rooms during their stay. The hotel features a kitchen with modern appliances, where guests can prepare food of their choice.

Do not miss to visit the nearby Gateway of India- a prominent historical monument, which was built during the British era.
less
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A great stay in Chateau Windsor !!!
text: Chateau Windsor is amazingly located, along Marine Drive. The rooms are spacious ans very clean. The service is perfect: the staff will do anything to accomodate you and make you feel good. They are also very smily and are available 24 hours a day. You can have breakfast on a very nice terrasse on the top floor, offering a beautiful view on Marine Drive. I definitely recommend it!! You'll enjoy jour stay !
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: a very pleasant surprise
text: We opted for a 2-night stay when our 1st choice was sold out.  Reviews were not great, but in this case the reviews were misleading.  We checked in early (flight from LHR) & had no problem getting to our deluxe room on the 4th.  It came c/w large walk in shower, two twin beds, satellite TV and WIFI access.  Location is ideal - 2 blocks from Churchgate rail stn.  The staff were incredible - friendly, many spoke English, and the place was unbelievably clean.  Some of the staff have been with the hotel for 20 years.  Breakast was included and it was full English breakfast served on the 6th floor open air roof of the hotel from 7 am.  We were very impressed by the quality and value of this 2-star hotel and cannot recommend it enough.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Outstanding service greatly compensates for dated amenities
text:
- Main reason to stay at Chateau Windsor would be the staff and management who are extremely friendly and helpful. They'll bend over backwards to help customers. It was our first trip in India and we were having problems with our train reservations being wait-listed. They told us exactly were to go (up to even the ticket reservation counter number where tourist quotas are handled) and what to ask for at the nearby Churchgate Station to get our train tickets confirmed and, when our Mumbai-Goa train journey could not be confirmed, arranged to book plane tickets for us at a very reason able fare.
- Price is a bit stiff for India and amenities rather dated, however the rooms are clean and location in Churchgate, close to Marine Drive, is ideal.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Business Hotel but Not Recommended for single female travellers
text:
The best thing I liked about this hotel was the location(its located very near to the sea).
The staff was polite.
Very average breakfast. In my four days stay - I had it only once.
The hotel does has its only restaurant to serve lunch or dinner; they have kept brochures of restaurant around which you can order from.
I booked this hotel as it was near to the exhibition place where I had to go. On arriving I was shocked seeing the room(I had booked a standard room); but definitely it was not worth paying more than Rs500. I thought of leaving but the money was given before and they would not refund. The staff pitched in and offered a better room but with extra cost - To which I agreed. This room was much better(at-least) matching to what is shown in the pictures). 
I have travelled a lot alone, but this Hotel did not give me a confidence that I will come back to stay back here as a solo female traveller.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Rip off - I do not recommend
text:
This hotel was a combination of the worst and most expensive we stayed at in India.
The nicer rooms they show you online do not have ensuite bathrooms, you have to cross the public hall to use your bathroom. The rooms with ensuite bathrooms are terrible. They are loud. The bathroom windows do not close (slats) and the room windows are fogged out. Felt like a prison. We still chose that room because we preferred ensuite bathroom but it was a terrible room.
The breakfast was very lame, worst out of all the hotels we stayed at in India (we stayed in 15) and the only one that did not provide bottled water with the room.
Further more, they did not provide top sheets for the bed.
To top it off, the showers were luke warm at their hottest.
I do not recommend it unless you can pay $40 a night or less for a room (I paid $150). It was in a good location and it was not dirty, so for a low price I would consider it, but In retrospect I should have paid a little bit more for one of the nicer hotels nearby, as this hotel had the worst bang for the buck of any hotel I have stayed at world wide.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Stopover in Mumbai
text: Apart from being in close proximity to the airport and shopping area there is very little this hotel can offer. It is dated and dirty, when we checked in we were given a twin room when we had paid for a double, they called it an upgrade I dread to think what other rooms would be like if this was an upgrade. Upon inspection of the room we found stale food in the fridge obviously left behind by previous occupants and bed sheet was crumbled with hair on it,  a/c remote was dirty with battery cover missing and remote not working, whilst a/c did work it made hell of a noise all night, it felt like I was still on plane with engine noise, toilet flush did work but water flow would still carry on wasting water until two handy men came and supposedly repair it I found that hitting the flush button a few time did the trick.  Breakfast room is so small it is congested in the morning with hardly any room to move, staff some were ok whilst others felt they were doing you a favour. when I complained about the room and left over food I was told come back tomorrow and we will find you a better room however when I went to the reception the next day I was told they do not have any spare rooms so there is nothing they could do.

title: VERY HUMILIATING, AGRESSIVE AND UNEDUCATED DUTY MANAGERS. GO HERE IF YOU ARE OK TO GET EMBARASSED. READ IT AND BE SAFE
text: Worst in terms of guest reception. zero value in terms of Hospitality. Rohit, the third category receptionist and Sandip Telang is the worst Duty Manager. I had visited this hotel for a board meeting along with my wife who had only accompanied me. the meeting got prolonged and since my wife had medical condition, i went to book the room for two hours for her so that she could rest. Inspite of medical condition, these two person at first rudely denied giving room to us just coz my wife dint have adhar card but pan card. Then when we arranged the proof through mail, they straightaway informed of regular rooms unavailable (which was available just 15 mins back) and made us pay extra for Suite category. Being in desperate need i had to book it. once booked, debited with money and room checked in, Sandip Telang pops up a new issue of proof not being clear in printout ( Which was perfectly readable on screen) and rudely informed us to checkout and come back again. i have never seen luxury hotel staff to have such a pathetic, unaccountable and uneducated staff. These both are a blot on the company's chain. a luxury hotel with undergrade staff is not luxurious. NOT RECOMMENDED AT ALL.

title: I am sure you will find far better place in Mumbai at the same cost
text:
I have stayed here for over 12 times in the last 3 years. We have been using their conference rooms to conduct training programmes every single month for over 6 years now and yet they absolutely unprofessional. 

Earlier, they used to offer airport pick up and drop facility for free. Recently they have started charging for the same. Inspite of an email reminder of my pickup time from the airport, the cab hadn't come. I had to wait for 25 minutes at the airport for the cab to arrive.

The rooms in the new building are quite nice but the bathroom is not clean. The rooms in the old building is really horrible. And mind you, they both cost the same and they could dump you in any of the building based on their decision. 

The bell boys are the only guys who smile in the property. People in the reception, particularly a senior gentleman wearing spectacles talks to you as if he is doing a favour to you.

I think I am done with this place and would like to move out of this place.

title: A 3* Deluxe Property at Vile Parle! Too confused to recommend others!
text:
(+)
1. Located at Vile Parle, 15 minutes ride from airport , next to Vile Parle railway station. Surrounded by a huge retail market- ideal for shopping for middle and upper middle class. 
2. Good Breakfast. 
3. Good and supportive staff members 
4. Good Food. Prompt room service. 
5. Big LCD TV, very good standalone window ACs.
6. Toilet and Room amenities are OK. 
7. Wi fi connectivity is good.

(-)
1. comparatively tiny rooms.
2. Bed is not comfortable- thinner mattress.
3. Wooden furniture and fixtures are old and need to be changed - the shine has lost.
4. the room floor has carpet - old style - unhygenic as the same is not cleaned by vacuum cleaner daily. 
5. Lobby level Coffee shop - where breakfast is given is too small to cater the in-house hotel guests.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Saurabh,

Thank you for taking the time to share your review about your recent stay at Hotel Parle International. 

We are glad to know that you like the location of our hotel which is very close to the International and Domestic airport and just next to the Vile Parle Railway station, along with that we are also happy to know that you like the breakfast and our staff members. Our team at Hotel Parle International tries to be as helpful and cooperative as possible, and we are glad we could be of service to you.

We are also extremely sorry to know that you did not like the room that was provided to you, we have taken all your suggestions into consideration.

title: Ideal location but best avoided if possible
text:
Real mixed feelings about this place, family have stayed before and came highly recommended. Ideally located in the city which is its best feature. 

I’ll avoid giving you war and peace so here’s a rundown of the reasons for the poor rating:

1. Complimentary Transfers - although the website says airport pickup and drop off is free as did one of my booking confirmations I was told policy had changed making it chargeable yet some of our family travelling with us on their own booking were able to use the complimentary service.. 

2. Noise - A/C seems to make a lot of noise even when switched off, sounded much like the ducts to an open service room as lots of echo’s of people at work. Secondly, hotel staff arrived for work very early, dropping things on the floor and talking across the hallway. All this equals uncomfortable nights sleep.. 

3. Reservation and Payment - during both of our stops here we were asked to settle the balance on check in rather than check out. Whilst this doesn’t bother us, the issue was how the staff manage expectations.  Whilst travelling and before we arrived for the second stay at the hotel I received several emails asking me to contact the hotel as there was a problem with my payment card. When I called I was told everything was fine... Interestingly I booked and settled both stays on the same debit card!

To summarise, not a devastating stay but evidence that guests are treated differently on an individual basis. There is clearly some favouritism towards regular visitors.

title: Location is the only thing going for this place
text: Stayed 4 nights. We were upgraded to a suite in the main building where reception is but the room was very tired. You could not open the blinds without them coming down altogether so no natural light in the room. Bathroom was ok, Aircon was very loud. Tip - always carry earplugs.  Only room mirror was on the bathroom door and only 1 socket worked in the ‘suite’ making very hard to use curlers, own hairdryer etc even remotely close to the mirror. Checking in was looong, would not let us bring our bags in until after checking in! We found breakfast to be ok. The only thing going for this place is the location. Close to good restaurants, shops, railway station. However, if they don’t improve the couldn’t care less attitude and the standard of the rooms, most people I know would prefer to pay a little more and travel to where they need to go.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear sir, 

I want to thank you for your feedback. While I wish, you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and we are very sorry that in your case we fell short. This level of service is certainly not acceptable and will be addressed with the concerned party. 

We will be in contact to discuss this further with you. Again, please accept my apology and I hope that this hasn’t put you off a return stay with us.

Best Regards,

text:
i have went to Parle International for 2 days Corporate event. It was an embarrassing event both for the host and participants. It was in monsoon season of Mumbai, the hotel was having a stale smell and was not properly cleaned. Breakfast and Buffet served was an average. No proper parking facility available, its based on customer priority. One of the guest car was bashed, on road parking as Hotel doesn't allow a parking, instead of parking availability

Hotel staff is rude and unfriendly, non co-operative. They didn't care for their guest at all. None of their issue has been addressed. Manager had mentioned clearly, "This is how we function."

In all, 2 days corporate event was good, but we will never select or suggest Hotel Parle International as location. 

I think office based events would be much better than this..:P

title: Great location , pathetic service.
text:
Considering that they have marked themselves a 3 star hotel , I was not expecting a vintage WINDOW AC in their "CLUB ROOM"(room 428). 
The TV had some picture issues. 
Out of the 4 power points that I could find , only 2 worked for mobile charger , & 3 for laptop.
Light fixtures are not at par with the standard.
geyser stopped working everyday after night 10. (Dunno the issue with this , but this happened on all 3 days of my stay, it worked during the day, stopped during the night)
The room service is below standard as well, asked for  extra tea & coffee sachets , got reply that they don't provide extra , even after asking to pay extra for extra sachets.  Finally received some after 15 mins of asking.
The buffet dinner menu is sure to disappoint.

title: Authentic food
text:
It's a classic place with decent ambience and live screening and music. Food is authentic in taste. Service is good. Portion is perfect for 2. In coolers we had Rose Lemonade & Pear Sparkler. Both coolers were unique especially the Rose Lemonade. 
For starters we had Cheese Jalapeno Stuffed Paneer Gulnar & Paneer Multani. It was soft, fresh and creamy. For the main course we had Paneer tikka with chura naan. It tasted good. The gravy was rich and creamy. For dessert we had baked Madhuram. It's a chef's special dish. It had layers of Gulab jamun and Rasgulla at the bottom and tiny fried gram flour balls on top all together dipped in hot sweet rabdi.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ujjwal,
We are glad that the portion sizes were perfect for you and that you enjoyed the coolers, especially the unique Rose Lemonade. It's fantastic to hear that you found the starters, Cheese Jalapeno Stuffed Paneer Gulnar and Paneer Multani, to be soft, fresh, and creamy. We are delighted that you enjoyed the Paneer tikka with chura naan for your main course, and that the rich and creamy gravy satisfied your taste buds.

Lastly, we are thrilled that you tried our chef's special dessert, the baked Madhuram. We designed this dish to be a delightful combination of flavors and textures, and we're glad it met your expectations. The layers of Gulab jamun and Rasgulla at the bottom, topped with tiny fried gram flour balls and dipped in hot sweet rabdi, provide a unique and indulgent dessert experience.

Thank you for choosing our restaurant, and we hope to welcome you back soon for another memorable dining experience!

Warm Regards,
General Manager
Hotel Kohinoor Continental
placeInfo/address: Andheri Kurla Road Andheri E, Mumbai 400059 India
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Andheri E

title: Best Authentic North Indian food
text:
Looking Out For Candle Light Date Place?
Solitaire - Kohinoor Continental serves delicious North Indian food with modern touch to it.

This place is in JB Nagar, Near Metro Chakala Station, Andheri East. Their seating area is super comfortable. Their hospitality is top notch and service is also fast. The food is totally worth it and damn delicious. I will surely visit here again.

What I Tried?
1) Galouti Kebab with Ulte Tawe ki Paratha - ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
2) Murgh Zaffrani Tagdi - ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
3) Mutton Nihari with Naan - ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
4) Lucknowi Chicken Shawarma Biryani - ⭐⭐⭐⭐
5) Rasmalai Tiramisu - ⭐⭐
6) Long Island Ice Tea - ⭐⭐⭐⭐
7) Martini - ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Taste: 5/5
Ambiance: 5/5
Cost: ₹2500 for 2 people
Recommended Dish: Galouti Kebab & Mutton Nihari

Thank you for recommending our restaurant and we look forward to welcoming you back for more delightful experiences.

Warm Regards,

title: Great visit
text:
This restaurant is located at Kohinoor hotel, Jb nagar in Andheri .
It was a beautiful place truly and they had North Indian cuisines.
I loved the entrance of the restaurant and the entire decor which gave a very beautiful vibe.
We had some signature cocktails like the virgin mojito which was like a classic beverage option.
Then in appetisers we had the hara bara kebab with hummus and pita.
It was presented so very well and it was truly delicious.
We also tried the jalapeño cheese stuffed paneer gulnar.
It was something unique and tasty at the same time.
In main course, we tried the paneer butter masala with naan and the veg biryani.
The quantity of the food was awesome and even the quality of the food was very well maintained.
We ended our meal on a sweet note with chocolate eclair and with fresh fruits on the side.
We truly had a wonderful time and got the best of service out here.
Best wishes to Team Solitare - Kohinoor  hotel.
ownerResponse/text:

text:
Hello FoodieTherapy55 here
      “Solitaire Kohinoor”
It’s a restaurant located inside continental hotel in Andheri near Chakala. 
The staff is very attentive and friendly too. The very well explained the menu and also give nice suggestion. 
The service was also quick and the bar section was also lit. Comfy seating area and also a perfect place for date as well.

Mushy Bushy: it was a great drink to try out for sure. I loved it.

Virgin Mojito : It was perfect 

Chessy Tawa Prawns: it was superb and great quantity was served n nicely presented.

Koyla Murgh Tikka: It’s like a charcoal color chicken tikka and it taste super cool. I loved it .

Chicken Tikka Butter Masala With Chur Chur Naan : it was a bit spicy as suggested and it was in good quantity and very tummy. The naan was also nice.

Ending the meal with delicious desert 
Rasmalai Tiramisu 

Kudos to the team of Solitaire kohinoor
