title: good stay
text: the staff were courteous and helpful. there was a prompt response to requests for supplies even at night. the rooms were cleaned regularly. the mattresses were too soft for my taste and gave me a backache. maybe the hotel should consider having a few hard mattresses available for those who prefer them.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: It's a good value if you want to stay in South Mumbai but...
text:
....the hotel was lacking on a few dimensions.

First, and most importantly, the Hotels.com description and photos are slightly deceiving at best, dishonest at worst. The photos are all very nice, modern, and updated. Upon arrival, however, they showed us the options -- either a room that hasn't been updated or an updated room without an attached bath. We felt like we were duped to a certain degree. That said, the rooms themselves are clean, which we certainly appreciated. And the location is quite convenient if you want to be in South Mumbai.

In general, the service was nice enough, but we had issues along the way. On three occasions we ordered breakfast or tea / coffee and it never came. The management also arranged a car to drive us to the airport. Not only was the car 20 minutes late, it's because the front desk had told the driver the wrong time. Finally, when checking out the total of expenses were jotted haphazardly on a piece of paper. It took 40 minutes to sort out the final bill because they were trying to charge us for a taxi ride that we hadn't taken. These were all frustrating encounters with the management. That said, all of our interactions with the other staff -- guards, elevator operators, and cleaners -- were incredibly positive.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: The good and the bad
text:
My first visit was a very good one. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. Staff were friendly and gave good service. I would have rated it higher if only they were consistent.
When i returned from my tour I called a day before. Spoke to reservation who said that a room would be vacated the next day at noon and they would call and confirm and I could come and sit in the lobby while it was cleaned. Never called. When I reached there with family I called again. They told me to roam around while they confirmed. Hello! I was with family had children luggage and in taxi. What did he mean roam around ?
I told him they had not called earlier and had even suggested i wait at the lobby. At that the person quite rudely answered There are no rooms. And cut the phone.
I would have wished to go there or recommend it to my friends but i am so put off by that silly attitude - its like we dont need you. We are doing you a favour by renting you a room. 
No problem. Sometimes its high season sometimes its low season. Bad business strategy.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Comfortable and great service
text:
We had initially booked a superior room which was upgraded to Delux room on chargeable basis. The deluxe room was spacious and comfortable and also had a balcony. The best thing about the hotel was the politeness of the staff. The breakfast had limited choice but was served in a proper way. 
The location of the hotel near marine drive and near churchgate station make it easy to commute and also for sightseeing. It is well maintained and clean hotel. 
On the flip side, they have a ticket system for wifi which was not easy to operate and required frequent input of the ticket number.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Quaint hotel in charming South Mumbai
text: Chose this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and it did not disappoint us at all. All the good that we had read about the hotel was true - great location (off Marine Drive), clean and comfortable rooms, courteous and helpful staff, good food, and value for money. Definitely recommend this to anyone planning to stay in South Mumbai and close to the famous sights of Mumbai
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Location, rooms, service- All A 1
text: As the title goes, as per me, it is A-1. No restaurant facility of its own. But from your room, you can order even tandoori crab or lobster from Mahesh Lunch Home or even from any other good restaurants of your choice. Isn't it a good choice? This is a  hidden pearl annex to Hotel Ambassador. Best location, very good service. Spacious rooms. Not a single adverse observation. It has become our favourite place to stay in Bombay. Highly recommended for single as well as family visit. Stayed there in 2011 and 2012. Planning to visit Bombay soon and, of course, stay in Chateau Windsor.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great place and great location!
text: The chateau Windsor Hotel has really big and clean rooms! We stayed there in Dicember and we found it much more better than other 5 stars hotel where we stayed around India. The location is perfect 5 min walking from the Marine Drive and 15-20 min from Victoria Trainstation. The staff was really helpful and they give us even the possibility to take a shower in the evening before to leave for the airport! We highly recommend this place!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Super Lage
text: Dieses Hotel das von Aussen eher wie ein Wohnhaus aussieht ist ideal gelegen. Alle interessanten Sehenswürdigkeiten sind zu Fuss erreichbar. Die Strandpromenade ist in 2 Minuten erreichbar. Die Zimmer sind Grosszügig und das Personal sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Das Frühstück kann auf dem Dach genossen werden wo man einen schönen Blick aus Meer und Mumbai hat.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great Location Disappointing Hotel
text:
The website of the hotel states "Chateau Windsor Hotel is South Mumbai's leading budget hotel catering to the needs of the corporate and visiting guests from India and around the world. The hotel is located in the down-town of the city (city center) and is walking distance from major Commercial / Business, Entertainment and Shopping centers. Some of the cities best restaurants are located right next to us. The hotel provides a comfortable accommodation facility with its well furnished 50 rooms that caters to every individual's budget."

I must mention here that indeed the hotel boasts of an excellent location, but every other claim is highly exaggerated. I was misled by some of the glowing reviews that this hotel has received on Trip Advisor, and I cannot fathom how they managed to do so. This is my experience.

I needed to stay close to a project site in downtown Mumbai and being taken in by the claims on the website and the reviews, I booked a room for 5 days at a price that I have got rooms at some of the best 5 Star properties in Mumbai earlier. The Superior Room that they offered me for a pricey Rs. 5250 was like my Engineering College Hostel Room with an added Air Conditioning! The Toilet was Humble to say the least and Awful at worst. Shockingly, the Superior Room did not even have a window. 

When I refused to accept that room, they upgraded me to a better room that was shown in the website photographs, but this was not provided with an attached bathroom, which was located across the corridor. Which as you can imagine is very inconvenient. 

The much touted Family Managed Hotel is just a smokescreen for poorly managed staff and unprofessional service. I used to work nights on my project and sleep during the day till noon, when I had the Do Not Disturb sign on. When I woke I put the Please Clean My Room sign, but nobody turned up to clean the room, despite my personal request to a passing Housekeeper. The next evening the room was cleaned after I called Reception and complained.

Finally, the hotel has no real kitchen and cannot serve anything more than a coffee and sandwiches. The Complimentary Breakfast was 1 omelette and 2 slices of toast, 1 banana and a cup of tea everyday! This is in comparison to the awesome multi cuisine buffet spreads as all other hotels I have stayed at. With a little investigation, I understood that the management allocates a measly Rs. 60 per day for breakfast, or about 1% of the room tariff - nowhere near the industry norm, and hence the humble offering was not surprising.

I have requested my Friend and Agent to please not offer this hotel to anyone in future, as there is no value for money for the high tariff they demand as the place is run like an old lodge, hiding behind a facade of a Heritage property. I think that the hotel room is worth no more than Rs. 1,500 per day. The tariff they demand is just unjustified.

Kindly make more detailed inquiries before agreeing to stay here at any higher tariff.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Chateau Windsor makes you feel at home
text: Stayed 3 nights there in October and after the initial unease at being a single woman traveler in Mumbai, I really began to love this place. The staff could not have been more accommodating; they brought my breakfast (included in rates) up to my PH terrace each morning with the daily Bollywood newspaper. Very clean and compact room, good if small shower, A/C and WiFi worked, ceiling fan, quiet.  Provided cheap and excellent laundry service, and even delivered my dinner by giving me takeout menus from local restaurants, then sending someone on staff to fetch my order.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Brilliant Stay in a Hotel older than our Independence.
text:
Centrally located at a stone's throw from Marine Drive. Very good veg and non-veg restaurants nearby and the hotel connects you directly to those and allows you to enjoy good food from the comfort of your room. Gaylord Restaurant and Shiv Sagar ( the most famous pav-bhaji of Mumbai is available here ) restaurant are again at a stone's throw distance from this hotel. Very well-maintained premises. Colaba and all other lively places are walkable or 7-8 mins by cab from the hotel.

Staff were very polite, helpful, friendly and professional in their simple yet effective "CWH" attire. 

Hotel was worth the money as per Mumbai Standards where real estate is very expensive. Our room was quite large. Breakfast was very basic - 2 bread pieces toast, jam, omlette/potato culet, a banana and tea. However, good to get you started and tasty. I went to the kitchen was so very impressed by the cleanliness there. I wish I would have taken the snap. Basic tea/coffee and very tasty Mumbai Grilled Veg sandwiches are available from the in-hotel kitchen which is very good for quick bites. 

Overall, our stay was excellent in every way.

What helps the hotel is the ease with which a cab can be taken to places nearby for very short distances. The cab drivers in Mumbai were a revelation for the Bangalorean in me. They do not want to fleece you. Even if you leave your cell phone or bag with them, they will return it to you. You can travel safely at any time of the night with them. They rarely decline or ask for more money.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Outstanding service
text: Stayed here for two nights in November 2015 and there were lots of great things about the Chateau Windsor: great service, AC, tasty Indian breakfast, perfect location between Marine Drive and Churchgate station, surrounded by nice restaurants with their menu available in the room, and satellite tv with some channels from home! (that’s luxury for us).  Yes it was more expensive than the rest of India, but everything is in Mumbai.  The best thing was the service.  The reception desk booked an overnight bus to Aurangabad for us, then after we had checked out there was a waiting room and bathroom for us to use before we left.  Finally, when it was time for us to leave, a man was sent down to get us a taxi and had a long conversation with the driver so as to be 100% certain we were dropped off in the right place.  For me, that’s outstanding service.  One last thing – taxi drivers may not understand the name of the hotel if you say it the French way!  Pronounce it Cha-tee-oh instead.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Bien pour un court sejour
text:
Il ne paye pas de mine mais l'hôtel est  bien situé près de Marine Drive et Churchgate et pour 50 Roupies pas plus en taxi de Colaba. (Ne pas hésiter à marchander sinon vous en aurez pour le double voire triple !!!!)
Réserver une chambre Deluxe dans la partie rénovée de l'hôtel. Confortable, propre, pas trop bruyant. 
Un peu cher pour ce que c'est mais c'est comme ça pour tous les hôtels à Mumbai à moins d'y mettre le paquet.....
Personnel sympa, bref pour un court séjour ( pour nous c'était 4 nuits) ça passe !
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent location; good price
text: The hotel is located in a very good location easy to walk to the attractions if you are a walker or to take the train from Churchgate. Certain rooms have a view to the Ocean which is really nice. Breakfast is decent and personnel is helpful. Free WI FI.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Value for money hotel for a business traveller
text: Chateau Windsor may not have a great lobby or a number of chandeliers - but what it lacks in terms of glitz and glamour, it makes up with a good sized neat and clean room, attentive staff, tasty food serviced through a fast room service and a great location. There are very few hotels that could give better value for money in the heart of the city.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent Staff and Location
text: I showed up about 2 hours early and my room was available and they let me check in.  Dropped my bags in my room and had some coffee.  I asked about getting a SIM card and they directed me to where I could get one.  Overtime I asked about something or for something they were very helpful.  Even the water and beer was not over priced compared to most hotels.  It is with in walking distances to a lot of the major attractions and walked around most of this area of Mumbai.  The hotel rooms are a little dated but clean.  The rooftop terrace has a great view of the city.  Overall a really great stay.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Very Good Hotel with Amazing Location Advantage
text: Very Good Hotel with qualified and supportive staff. We visit this Hotel in last week of July-2015. This hotel have amazing location advantage of Nariman Point, Chaupati, India Gate etc. in just 2-3 km radius.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Not really recommended
text:
This is quite a basic place but the management and staff were almost first class. The wifi was poor and on my last night and day turned off/ broken completely so I negotiated a later stay without charge. However they turned off the A/ c so I was forced to decamp to the airport to wait 8 hours for my plane.Centrally  located, although beyong the architecture, the Gateway to India and the the Taj Mahal hotel where the terrorist attack happened I fail to see why one would stay in Mumbai except for business. I would not return considering the many other options available. I paid 650 rupees for my taxi from the set fee place at the airport ( I recommend this , especially for a first time visitor) and 500 rupees ( negotiated before getting in!) in an a/c less cab on the way back to the airport...I gave  a 50 rupee note as tip which was hugely appreciated.
All in all it was not a negative experience but my sense of Mumbai is that the hotels and taxis are not to be trusted. Breakfast was poor too. I think I overpaid on another website.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Chateau Windsor Hotel
text: To the left of this hotel is Churchgate Railway station and to its right is famous Marinelines view. The hotel rate is very reasonable compared to other hotels in Mumbai. It may not be very luxurious, but is very clean and neat and within the budget of a family. The hotel provides breakfast as part of package. The major advantage of this hotel is it is nearer to all eateries and shopping centres. The staff of this hotel is very pleasant and the manager is very friendly and helpful. The lift opeators always come running to take you in the lift, the security guards take extra care to catch you a taxi for your outings and kitchen staff get you the items you need.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Śniadanie na dachu w Bombaju
text: Jeśli chcesz zobaczyć windy i recepcję polecamy ten hotel. Pierwszy raz w życiu jechałam windą z kratą i bojem hotelowym, poczułam się jak na planie filmu. Recepcja na 5 piętrze przypomina dobre kolonialne brytyjskie biuro. Natomiast pokoje są bardzo luksusowe, wygodne i czyste. Odbiegają od klimatu kolonialnego w pozytywnym tego słowa znaczeniu. Śniadanie jest serwowane na dachu z którego widać zatokę z promenadą. Usytuowany jest blisko zatoki gdzie można spotkać wieczorami mnóstwo par na romantycznych spacerach. Obsługa hotelu bardzo miła i pomocna. Zaoferowali nam mały pokoik gdy wyjeżdzaliśmy późnym wieczorem bez dodatkowych opłat. Polecamy te urokliwe miejsce.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Clean room and nice location
text:
Stayed for 4 nights. 
Breakfast is poor.... no variety  can get boring.very basic! need improvement
Location is nice.. 
Value for Money 7/10
Was bit disappointed on an incident, it was heavily raining asked an umbrella to (borrow) and they didn't provide, just said sorry they don't have any. It is normal (not something extraordinary) to provide an umbrella to guest when required as Bombay can get really wet in Monsoon 
Keeping this particular issue aside i don't have any other complaints... Lift is pretty old but it does the job well.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great location, average stay
text: I stayed here for two nights. Room didn't face the main road and promised balcony wasn't there. Window looked into the shaft. Room was dark. Mobile phone didn't work properly- connectivity was very very poor;  hotel needs to invest in some boosters. Wifi provided by hotel was very slow - I couldn't make any use of it. Room was okay, so was bathroom. Service was prompt. Breakfast choice was in poor - two eggs + Banana + two toast + tea/coffee served in room and cutlet instead of eggs for veg. Reception is on 5th floor, one old lift. Location is great - two minutes from Churchgate station and Marine Drive.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Affordable option in the city center
text:
Location of the hotel (down town Mumbai) and cleanliness are comparatively good value for 3 star hotel

no real reception, rather an office at the top floor no breakfast space poor breakfast, though included in the room rate appeared that we have to pay extra tax no control over car services provided by the hotel - the company the hotel works with tried to cheat by adding extra mileage noisy, no proper isolation of rooms, quite some mosquitoes. Wi-fi comes at surcharge - not typical for 3-star hotels
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Well located, friendly staff and very clean
text: The hotel is well located near Marine Drive and Churchgate station. The rooms are well maintained and very clean. Wifi is free and adequate if somewhat uneven in speed. Complementary breakfast is served in the room and adequate. Staff are friendly, helpful and not judgemental. Given the cost of much inferior places in the area this is highly recommended.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Maybe you have to be pushy
text: There is nothing essentially wrong with this hotel, and in Mumbai terms it is reasonably priced. The area is good and there are good little restaurants not far away, as well as the station. I found it disappointing that we had to ask for our room to be cleaned, although fresh towels were freely offered every morning. I was also disappointed that after a long-ish stay there, we were moved the night before we left. I suspect that we were not strong enough in making our desires and expectations known.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Really not so goog value.
text: Very Helpful staff. Good location. My room was spacious and simple with a fridge. That s all this hotel  has. The rest are: strange smell in the room, the pillow and mattress smell terrible. Internet is a joke, very slow, it is disconnecting every 5 min et you must enter a complex 16 digit code + password everytime, and each guest has a different one. Too inconvenient and restrictive  in the nowaday digital age.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Value for money
text:
The best part of this hotel is the location. 
It is very clean, staffs are polite and very understanding to personal needs.
The only draw back is: the AC is a bit noisy- dont get me wrong, the cooling effect is excellent
With the kind of tariff and the location, this place is the best bet.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Budget Hotel - Good location and value for money
text:
Hotel has old small serviced lift and lobby is located on 5th floor. Fairly good sized rooms with hot & cold showers. Empty mini fridge for you to fill up with your own items.
Rooms comes with settee & bed side table, writing table, LCD TV, water flask, cupboard with hangers, clock, window with balcony. Rooms comes with both air condition and ceiling fan. Rooms are clean.
Excellant Ala Carte breakfast is served on the rooftop. 
Best thing going for it is its location - 2 min walk to Marine Drive and five min walk to Churgegate Station. You can walk along Manrin Drive to reach Chowpathy Beach.
Few local restaurants along the hotel & also on the lobby of Churgegate Station. 
Taxi's are easily available outside the hotel. Friendly service at reception and rooftop restaurant.

Excellant stay and value for money. Highly recommended.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Неплохой отель
text: Жила здесь моя подруга, помогала ей заезжать, бюджетный отель, скажу сразу, без претензий, в номере чисто достаточно, убирают хорошо. Ванная удобная, большая. Завтрак для девушки достаточный, а вообще порции небольшие. Рядом супермаркет и ресторанчики, Вообще расположение отличное, до всего рукой подать.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Mid-range property in a good location
text: This is a mid-range property, not nearly as nice as the luxury places along the water and a huge step up from the budget locations scattered around the city.  The lobby and halls are a bit small but the room was large and comfortable.  Decent in-room amenities like a water kettle, toiletries, good selection of TV channels and a tiny balcony with not much view but a good place to dry laundry.  Breakfast was good if a little small--served on the nice rooftop with views of the city and harbor.  The location is very convenient to anything around Churchgate.  You can walk to Churchgate station in a few minutes one way, or to Marine Drive the other way.  Lots of restaurants and food shops nearby.  There is a small supermarket on the corner next to the train station.  it is easy to get a taxi to anywhere, and you can be at VT easily in half an hour by taxi.  Walking is straightforward in Mumbai, unlike most of India, and sidewalks will take you all the way to India Gate and beyond if you feel like strolling.  This isn't a luxury property so don't expect excellent decor or things like that but this is a very good value in Mumbai and I would stay here again.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Chateau Windsor Hotel - Very Good Experience
text: Very good Experience of staying at this property, I stayed for more than 2 weeks at this property for official Visit . Very Clean and Neat Rooms, much better than any five star property. All the Staff are very friendly and supportive. Location wise it is very convenient as it is located next to Churchgate station. Also lots of good food joints near by. Just one suggestion that they should add more options for complementary breakfast.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Budget place
text:
Cheuteau Windsor 
Situated in a very prime location ,it appears to be a nice budget place to stay if you have work this side of the town .Its a homely place.The room size is okay.
It's neat ,clean,quite and decent.The linen is clean &fine.They serve a very fixed menu for breakfast (eggs , bread,cutlets & sandwiches ). The service is pretty fast.In some rooms the washrooms are situated outside the room....that's slightly awkward though! Most of the rooms have a balcony  & you have lovely breeze through this.The attenders are really cooperative and helpful .You can order food from outside, get your laundry done, call a cab, they help with all of this.Its more like a guest house.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Very nice hotel
text:
Very nice and clean. Staff are only too kind. Location of the hotel is good, not very far from the main attractions. Also plenty of variety in eating places around. 

Their reception is always open, even in the wee hours of the night which makes checking in convenient.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good value for the area, safe / clean hotel, would stay again but we just had one issue
text:
I recently stayed at this hotel. I was worried how good it would be, as I was on a budget and wanting to stay in a well located area. This fitted the bill, so with the good reviews in hand I went for it. 

The hotel is situated in a good location, right next to Marine Drive, Pizza by the Bay (restaurant) and some small shops / chemists (nothing fancy). The hotel always has at least one or two doormen, which may be quite common for the area (I don't know), but it was a nice touch I thought and they were always friendly, helpful and welcoming. For example one time they helped lend me some cash for the taxi by going to reception, as taxi's in Bombay often don't accept large bills and a large bill could be 500 rupees.

To get to the rooms or reception, you can either take the steep-ish stairs, or take their old style lift, with a cage door and a guy who takes you up and down. Once again, another touch I liked.

Check in at reception were not too helpful. I wanted a double room, but they could only offer a twin. They said I could switch later, but in such a way that I knew it wasn't really going to happen, and it didn't, we had the twin with beds pushed together. Not a big problem at all, I'm just noting it.

The room was spacious, had a good aircon system and ceiling fan, satellite TV with some US programming along with the local stuff, the bathroom was quite small but had a large mirror inside and on the door.

I had no problems with any noise, the breakfast was served in the room and I can't complain about the food itself, it was OK. One time they did mess up and not give us any breakfast, we had to call back on a couple of occasions and it took 45 mins to an hour in the end. Which was a shame, as it was a waste of time.

The hotel said they wanted to replace our sink, as it had a crack in it. They said it would take a couple of hours, so we agreed they could come in for a couple of hours while we were out. We came back and our bathroom and hotel floor was like a building site. The work was not complete, there was like cement dust on the floor and workmans tools left. Our possessions and everything were all safe and OK, it is just we did not expect this. We checked with reception and after 15 mins or so of messing around we managed to get a temporary room for an hour, so we could freshen up before going out in the evening.

Therefore it was not a perfect stay, but I would quite happily stay here again, knowing that it is well located, cheap and I know the rooms are perfectly OK. I would say this is a good choice on a budget, but if you want absolutely no issues then look elsewhere.

By the way the WiFi was free for us to use, but there was an annoying system where by you have to get reception to issue coupons, and they only issue a few at a time. These coupons can only be used on one device. The Wifi was good, except it is a bit of a faff to sort out getting the voucher and applying the voucher.

text:

Our room was big compared to other hotels i have stayed in Mumbai, few places in Mumbai where a family can share a single room having a double bed, a single bed, and a sofa cum bed. the only drawback i feel is the English breakfast, it is something which we Indians wouldn't like to have day in and day out, some variety like Dosas or Rotis would be appreciated.
overall a great family holiday, and easy accessibility to all the major locations in Mumbai, best of all marine drive is just round the corner for after dinner walks.

title: Average hotel
text:
I trained for a client for 6 days at Parle International. While certain aspects are great, some others need to be improved.

The good: The service is good. There is a housekeeping and tech person in our hall at all times. Projectors/speakers are taken care of by the staff. The food has good variety and there is enough staff to take care of your needs. We had variety for breakfast and lunch and were well taken care of. The loos are clean and well maintained. Special requests were promptly fulfilled - I needed some bowls and spoons for an activity and hot water for my tea bag.

The Bad: They have no cappuccino, which I thought was quite tragic!!! Weak, sweet coffee is really not my thing but I had to make do with that through 8 hours of training a day. The banquet halls have a damp and smelly air to it, maybe due to monsoons, which feels better once the ACs are on. It's not classy, it's more massy. Also, wires are taped to the carpet from the plug point all the way to the projector, which I think is a hazard since people can trip and fall. The speakers can be of better quality. They put us in a hall in a different building on the last day of the program, which was quite inconvenient. The loos were on a different floor and we had to walk back to the hotel for our lunch. With pouring rains, it wasn't exactly fun and we wasted a lot of time going back and forth. 

The property in general needs to be spruced up - at least the banquets. You'll find seat covers of chairs torn and paint peeling at places. The tissue dispensers in loos are help together with double sided tapes. My client booked me into this place although I'd choose something definitely better for my own training programs.

title: Irresponsible and rude staff
text:
I used to book frequently in this hotel (sort of blindly trusted them). Turns out that these people are the same. 

I was charged for Room Service which I never ordered in the first place. On raising a complain about the same, everyone from the servers to the reception staff to the accountants back tracked. They insisted that I had ordered room service and that the bill had my signature. (It's not possible that I would lie about what I ate for lunch unless I am stoned out of my mind!! :P ) Not someone to take things lying down, I chased them. I had hoped that they would at least agree to the fact that they had made a mistake and that their management had made me pay someone else's bill. But no to avail. 

All the staff practically ganged up and bullied me into agreeing that I had ordered room service. Relentlessly. The receptionist Rohit said, "Oh please ask your parents if they ordered or not." Like if they ate something, they wouldn't tell me? Bhai, rishte itne bhi kharab nahi hai humare. 

Nor am I that much of a looser to lie for a free meal. Trust me I have better ways of doing that.

Avoid at all costs. Terrible people! 

Needless to say, you have lost a long time costumer just because of some goddamn 'Paneer Butter Masala, two tandoori roti and one ice cream'. Hope you don't repeat the same with other people. 

PS : During our stay, the Hotel's owner had walked upto us and asked us how about the hotel. At that time, I had said that it's okay, the hotel is nice. I really take back my words now. It's really not about the money. It's about the ethics. And it's the basis of any hospitality industry. You make a mistake, you admit it instead of playing passing the pass.

title: They dont give good rooms initially until you complain about it
text:
I visited this hotel during my recent mumbai trip.

Front Desk officer (Name: Vijayan) was carrying some strange attitude. When you check in to the hotel you expect the hotel staff to greet you well.  Unfortunately they failed!

when I was allotted the room, it was stinking, the AC was making terrible noise and the telephone in the room was not working. The bathroom had ages old salutatory fittings. I felt cheated. I called up the hotel through my mobile (As telephone in my room wasn't functional) when I explained the issues the person said: "Sir your's is Deluxe room, and our Deluxe rooms are like that only!" After arguing too much over the phone, he sent a technician for namesake who came and saw the AC and went back! 

I went downstairs, and asked for room change immediately, after resisting a little they offered me another room which was slightly better. AC was still making noise.
I had to turn off the AC and had to sleep under the fan in hot sultry Mumbai weather.It was a nightmare for me. I'd never stay at this hotel again.

We personally make sure that food ingredients of highest standards are used across all our kitchens and we would love to take you on a kitchen tour the next time you are with us at the Hotel.

Hoping that you would allow us an opportunity to serve you again.

title: Excellent Stay as well as good service....
text:
Hotel is very close to the airport as well as the vile parle railway station.
Hotel is situated in the market area so that you do not feel lonely and away from your family.
Rooms are clean and well equipped with the room amenities like Tea coffee maker, 2 bottles of  500 ml Mineral water on daily basis, English newspaper, Hair dryer, slippers, iron and iron board on request and many more....
Staff is very courteous also they provide complimentary Airport transfers.
Wi-fi works fine for basic needs.
Breakfast was part of the package with great delicious varieties, area was small but was manageable by the quick service.
Reception staff is excellent as my flight landed early was offered free early check in as well as the free up-gradation which is off course on subject to availability.
I booked deluxe room as it was cheap online but was upgraded to  Executive room which was decent and comfortable.
My overall experience was excellent with good professional staff and cleaned and neat rooms.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Saarsha0712,

Thank you very much for sharing your experience of the stay at Hotel Parle International  with others here on TripAdvisor. We are glad that you love the location of our property and you mentioned about the host of amenities provided to all our guests at the hotel. While the complimentary Wi-Fi service can definately take care of your basic needs we are working to make sure that on your next trip you would have a stronger connection. We always make sure that our guests start the day with a delicious breakfast buffet as mentioned by you in the above review. We at Hotel Parle International try our best to upgrade rooms for guests whenever we have availability of the best rooms.

We hope you will give us the opportunity of welcoming you again at Hotel Parle International.

Best Regards,
Customer Relationship Manager.

title: Very Disappointed Experince.
text:
I have stayed there for two nights- 21.02.17 & 22.02.17.

The experience of mine staying there was very poor. I was given twin bed room though I was alone to stay there. The room was not clean, the bathroom was  very untidy. All of the bathroom fittings were leaking badly.No ventilation in the room. Will not recommend others to stay in the hotel.

title: Good, Clean, Family Budget Hotel near Airport
text: Stayed for a night... Pros - 1. Airport is just a 15 minute drive 2. Neat and clean rooms 3. The hotel is walking distance from Vile Parle Railway station and in a thick commercial area 4. A Gujarati restaurant inside hotel which is very good...enjoyed my unlimited thali for just 300 bucks. 5. Wifi is super fast...as fast as it can get 6. Breakfast spread is decent Cons - 1. Mosquitos are repellent resistant...did not vanish till morning 2. Noisy AC. Overall a decent family hotel.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ankit,

We would like to take this opportunity to firstly thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule and sharing details of your experience at Hotel Parle International.

We are glad you enjoyed the very famous Gujarati Thali at Nimantran which is our Thali Restaurant, we would also suggest you come back to have the same in April once we have the famous Alphonso Mango Juice to accompany the thali. We are happy that guests have recognised the fact that we have doubled the reach of our Wi-Fi connections and we make sure guests get to enjoy free wi-fi in every corner of the hotel. 

We had recognised the problem of the increase in mosquitos in the vicinity in the past and you will be happy to know that we have addressed the same and we already see a big improvement in the same. The Air conditioners in a few rooms were still being replaced and we apologise for the inconvenience caused because of the noise.

We hope we will welcome you soon with our renovated property free of noisy air conditioners and mosquitos.

Best Regards,
Customer Relationship Manager 
Hotel Parle International.

title: Good airport hotel
text: This is a closeby airport hotel and good for busines meetings or just on international travels.Naturally as in Mumbai you cannot avoid street crowd but it is bit inside from main road,so no noise or disturbances.Its ideal for sleeping at night after having your day job outside hotel.It is close to local station.Reception,breakfast very nice.Spaceous lobby with comfort to relax.Airport drop off was provided immediately free of cost.Wify is a bit problem.It does not work in room and code expires if you go out and return.A Gujrathi thali just attached to corridors of hotel is a plus point.Its a market area,so all shops,big bazzar,jevellery,restaurants around hotel.

title: Quite, Professional Business Hotel
text:
4/5Service Quality
4Amenities
4Food & Drinks
4Value for Money
4Location
4 Cleanliness
4This is a standard business hotel, value for money. The location is a but inside from the main road and crowded as it is the station road. But if you plan to use Mumbai suburb trains then it is a great location. The hotel is inside a market area. But you won't feel it as it is a separate entry altogether. The hotel us pretty big property. Has good reception area and other services like travel desk. Tbe reception services are good and warm. There is a restaurant and bar which I have not tried. You have many food options just outside. I was given a pretty big room in the new annexe building just adjacent to the main htel. But this is integral part of the hotel in terms of all te amenities and design. The buffet breakfast is good. Looks like professional. You get quite good choice including various Indian options, bread, eggs etc. They serve hot breakfast which you will like. Other services are good too. The airport to and fro is there but you have to check their timing. It was my third stay here. I first stayed in 2010 May. They have maintained the quality since then.

title: Average hotel. Didn't feel very safe
text:
We stayed at Parle International for a week in January 2016.
This is a very average hotel in a very crowded part of Vile Parle East, not too far from the Domestic airport and a little distance from the International airport. The area around the gate to the hotel is quite dirty.
They offer free airport pickup/drop off and free wifi and our rate included breakfast. A kettle with tea/coffee, hair dryer and a safe are available in the room. An iron/iron board provided on request. 
Rooms are quite modern except for the horrid, cheap floral curtains.  The rooms are clean and housekeeping was very responsive & prompt with any requests. Special mention to our housekeeper Moin who was extremely polite & efficient. 
The hotel has 2 buildings. We were in the Annax, across the driveway from the main building which houses the reception , bar and restaurant. Though this was preferable as it was quieter, as a woman I didn't feel very safe walking through the Annex as there was no security around. There is security at the gate, around the driveway and at the entrance of the main building, but none inside the Annex. One evening, coming back after dinner, there was a large group of very drunk men in the Annex. Another evening whilst coming back, there was a huge, noisy, fists-flying, fight going on in the main building which spilled out onto the driveway.
The wifi has a strong signal and is pretty quick except every couple of hours, you need to log back in as it cuts out. You also have to log back on every time you leave the room which can get annoying when you are staying for a week.
Room key cards was another annoying factor of our stay. As a couple, anywhere we stay, as a couple we've been given 2 key cards. Here we were given 2 key cards but only 1 worked at any given time. The moment 1 key card worked, the other stopped working. Weird!
All in all, this seems like a hotel used by domestic businessmen who need a place to shower and sleep.
placeInfo/address: B.N. Agarwal Commercial Complex Vile Parle East, next to Dinanath Mangeshkar Hall, Mumbai 400057 India
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Vile Parle East, next to Dinanath Mangeshkar Hall

title: Key card system, maintenance of in-room facilities sucks big time!
text:
This is a very basic hotel for those who expect just a room, shower and breakfast. 
Their key card doesn't work most times and you need to keep visiting the reception to fix it. We did this several times over just a 3 night stay and we have 2 nights more to go. Maintenance support for in-room facilities such as safes, Cable TV and remote, supply of tea/coffee sachets etc isn't programmed. You need to keep calling housekeeping or maintenance for replenishments or fixing things. Wifi codes expire in 24 hours even if you are staying longer. So you need to keep calling for fresh codes. 
Guest service staff have rudimentary skills and can do better. 
The only saving grace was Vilas, the night bellman who had the grace to offer me a cup of ginger tea at 5 am. 
I had arrived at 4 am on 27th Jan morning and my check in time was after 12 noon. 
Stay here ONLY if you can't afford a good 3 star.

title: Most pathetic service ever
text:
Was supposed to check in today; i received a call yesterday to reconfirm the booking and was even asked the expected time of arrival. I informed them that I will be arriving around 9 am to which they said yes, its ok no problem. When i reached the hotel the front desk denied a room and said check in time in 12. When we told them that we received a call from the hotel yesterday and they said its ok to come at 9; the person at the reception got very rude and said "read your booking confirmation and read what it says in black and white. It says check in time is 12 pm". We told them that this was a very very rude remark and asked for the manager and he said I myself am the manager (when he obviously was not). When we again asked him why did you not tell us we cannot check in at 9 when you asked us on the phone what time we are arriving and when we said 9 am, why did you say its ok. He said i don't know, i will give you a room at 12, not before that and if you want you can leave. 

The reply of the person at the reception, combined with the attitude shown to us was pathetic!!!!!! Never would advise anyone to ever stay at this hotel!

Housekeeping is bad and unclean - the curtains full of dust the bedsheet with marks and stains and they used a mattress protector between two flat white sheets as a blanket.  The bathroom was unclean - the taps not working, a bathtub which did not drain while taking a shower and broken tiles around the bathtub.  The bathrobe had turned brownish and was left behind the bathroom door in a hanger. The wash basin taps bad and unclean.   The breakfast spread was okay till i noticed  the person preparing dosas.  He would clean with a cloth the dosa maker and would either put the cloth on the window sill or it would fall off.  He would then again use the same cloth for the next dosa.  I stopped having their breakfast after i saw this.  Even with the hotel being close to the railway station and other amenities i would not use it again.  There are far more better hotels around at the same price.

title: Très bonne adresse
text:
Hôtel parfait par sa position et son prix. Après avoir fait le tour des hôtels du sud de mumbai, il s'est avéré que c'était le moins cher. Aucun autre hôtel ne nous proposait une chambre pour quatre. Le cadre n'est pas luxueux mais simplement très correct. Le staff est très serviable et efficace, le petit déjeuner très bien et la terrasse pour le repas très appréciable. Il y a de plus une boulangerie en face qui propose des baguettes ;) 
L'hôtel est situé entre la gare de churchgate et marine lines (quoi demander de mieux ?). La vue le soir est magnifique, la gare à une minute, un excellent glacier la rue derrière, une supérette et la poste au bout. 
Je recommande fortement cet hôtel à tous les voyageurs en famille, entre amis ou même ceux qui viennent pour le travail. C'est le meilleurs endroit pour allier confort et indépendance à moindre frais.

title: Beautiful room
text:
The Chateau Windsor is a lovely three-storey hotel with a friendly and welcoming staff. It is located in an extremely central location in the center of South Mumbai, close to many restaurants, historic sites, and the ocean-front promenade. It is an ideal place to be based for any stay in Mumbai.

Our room was spacious, had a comfortable bedding and included a private bathroom in the corridor and a balcony. Some bedrooms don’t have any windows, but ours had two large ones that brought us the sunlight but also the noise from the busy boulevard which fortunately becomes more quiet at night! In the morning, Chateau Windsor serves a delicious and extensive breakfast in the rooms until 11am and sometimes later.

All in all, the Chateau Windsor is a great option for any trip to Mumbai.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

Otherwise, safe was broken (requested a fix, they came took a look with no follow-up), AC was missing remote control (they brought a new remote), cover blanket was unwashed with traces of hair so requested a new clean sheet (they said OK, but never sent one), and reception didn't have a map. placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good place for its money in the very heart of Mumbai
text: Its a really good place for average tourists as prices are too high in Mumbai. Very rarely you can find triple rooms in good hotels in Mumbai - so you have to take 2 rooms. For budget tourists its too costly. Here you will get a good triple room for best cost. Better ask for triple room with extra bed not sofa as it is more comfortable. All day rounf hot water is available. Breakfasts are included in the room cost and you can take as per your choice continental breakfast or Indian breakfast (which contains more solid food like veg cutlets, banana, tea/coffee with jam and butter toast and omlette). Breakfast can be delivered either to your room or you can take it on the terrace located on the roof of the building with nice view. You can leave your bags in lock room just for 100Rs after check-out and it is really safe there. Staff is polite, helpful but a bit slow as almost everywhere in India. I recommend this hotel. Its very close to Churchgate station, food shop Syrodya near station, Marine Drive, Main attractions like Bombay University (within walkable distance), Colaba and Gateway of India are easily reachable by cab (tell it should be by meter - dont agree for costly price) - it will take max 5 min.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good value for money in South Mumbai, Ideal location!
text:
It was my second stay in the Chateau Windsor in Churchgate, and I definitely recommend this accommodation as it is one of the best value for money in South Mumbai: it is hard to find a good and clean place with decent rates there. The staff is also very courteous and helpful.

Of course, the first impression can be a little surprising, the building organisation is very peculiar (reception desk looking like out of a 50s' movie and located in the top floor) but be patient and you will not be disappointed. Rooms are clean and large. Bathrooms are smaller and can smell of mothballs but they are clean so this won't be an issue. If you are three people, you can easily be accommodated in one room without feeling cramped. Depending on the room, you will have no view (darker but quieter rooms) or a view on the front street (more light but more noise as well). 

Regarding the breakfast, you can ask for it to be delivered to your room (they are also very flexible with early morning breakfast in case you have a flight/train to catch) or you can eat it on the rooftop. Breakfast is simple (nothing like a 5* hotel buffet) but you will have eaten well and enough to start your visits. The rooftop is not well done, it is an empty space with plastic chairs and tables, where you can take some sun and admire the view on the nearby stadium and on the street below.

The location is without doubt the main advantage of this hotel. It is in Churchgate, very close to Marine Drive, and Kala Ghoda. You can easily take a taxi and reach all the major touristic attractions of South Mumbai. If you love to walk, you can even do most of the things by walk itself (Victoria Station, Gateway of India, ...).

My advice: get past your first impression and you will enjoy your stay!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A hotel that gets it right!
text: In my visits to Mumbai, I have stayed at 1 star hotels and 5 star places like the Taj Mahal Palace & Tower.  But after experiencing the true hospitality of the Chateau Windsor, I don't want to stay any place else on my visits.  Everyone speaks of the location to the landmarks and yes, that is a plus.  As is the price, the shopping and restaurants near the hotel, and the free internet and paper.  But the thing that keeps me coming back is the staff.  Everyone I came in contact with was very friendly and helpful.  But even more important than everything, I feel safe and comfortable there.  To me, that is priceless as a solo traveler.

title: Best ever prices for your stay  Save your money now by making a reservation today
text:
Hotel Parle International is one of the leading budget Business Hotels since the past 2 decades. Equipped with quality amenities, Hotel Parle International is the perfect blend of pragmatism with comfort which leads it to its most common synonym - The Business Abode just for one to feel at home while on business.

Humbly possessing 100 spacious well-equipped rooms and 5 banquets, this hotel is capable of hosting individuals, small and large families, and magnanimous groups of people as well. A round-the-clock coffee shop and room service along with a bar and authentic Gujarati Thali Restaurant, we serve cuisines to cater to all your palettes and moods.

Complimentary WiFi connectivity throughout the hotel is also available for one to always be up to date and in touch with the world wide web and more for all business and social needs. Hotel also provides private multi-functional spaces designed for all types of business needs.

Hotel Parle International offers everything from an extravagant ballroom to an intimate boardroom, all technically equipped and perfectly versatile. Strategically located in an enviable location, one will be only 2 kms and 10 minutes away from the Domestic Airport Terminal 1, 0.5 kms and 2 minutes away from the nearest mainline railway station, 4 kms and 15 minutes from the Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport Terminal 2 and 20 minutes from Mumbais commercial hubs Bandra Kurla Complex and Bombay Exhibition Center. Good experience i had stayed there for 4 Night and 5 Days with family. It was a great experience value for money should say ... rooms are spacious and housekeeping is good , staff found polite, food in gujrati restaurant was awesome, Bar prices and happy hour deal is wonderful.... Will visit again shortly.

title: Poor service, pathetic experience
text:
We stayed in this hotel for one night last week and it was indeed a nightmare. Here's the summary of my experience:

1. The room which was allotted to us was under maintenance. In fact the entire building was being repaired, full with dust and smell of paints. 
2. They gave us another room which was again not anything great. It has though two separate beds. We called reception to change the room but they responded very unprofessionally saying that there is no other room available and we accept the allotted room with whatever condition it was in.
3. Since midnight the toilet flush stopped working. Till morning no one cared to bring it to a working condition. With our multiple follow-ups with house keeping and front desk a guy came only to inform us that someone closed the water connection due to maintenance work. It was really frustrating to know that it took them entire night and several hours in the morning only to figure out that the water supply was closed. They said it might take another one hour to restore the water supply. The room was changed later on when we escalated the issue.
3. The responses we got from house keeping and front desk staff was very discouraging and unprofessional. 
4. Food is over priced and less in quantity. Taste is average.
5. Complimentary breakfast was decent.

The hotel has got comparatively larger rooms (at least the ones we saw) and that's probably the only thing I liked about this hotel.

I had been to other neighboring hotels and find them much better than this one. Overall a very bad experience with extremely bad service and poor complaint management. Would never recommend to anyone and/or like to visit again.

title: Amazing visit, amazing stay.
text:
Wonderful rooms. The staff is incredibly polite and well trained. They have their own parking space. And the breakfast was simply spectacular.
Couldn't find a single point to complain about except perhaps lack of a continental breakfast, but then again I would be nitpicking and searching for a flaw.
The complimentary airport drop is a huge bonus, really added lustre to our trip.
If it seems like I am showering nothing but praises, trust me I'm a harsh critic. But this place truly deserves the rating and review.
Special mention: the restaurant in the hotel called Nimantran serves excellent Gujarati thali.

title: Don’t stay here if you want to sleep.
text:
Don’t stay here. Second floor room 228. Non smoking room. Stunk of tobacco, damp, and smelly. 

Noise from solitaire restaurant/bar in hotel was heard clearly audible in hotel room. 

Complained as little sleep on the first evening after a long journey.  Quickly Moved to the 3rd floor. Still a continual ‘thuMp thump’ of music at 10,40 in the evening. Rooms not smelly and damp  on the 3rd floor but still can’t sleep as so noisy from the function room/bar. If you want to sleep them I suggest you stay elsewhere.

text:
I am staying in Kohinoor continental. I had a confirmed reservation for past 15 days with this hotel. I specifically called in the morning today and requested manager Azad to block a quiet room for me coz m a single lady traveller and I have a very hectic schedule. So I need a peaceful sleep in the night. I called twice to request the same. During check in I again requested them for a quiet room he said yes I am giving u a quiet room. He has given me a road facing room which is highly noisy and there is disturbance of constant trucks outside. I called front desk and spoke to dhawal requesting him to change my room as it's noisy. He directly refused that it's not my mistake n I can't do anything. I cannot change ur room and u cannot even check out because u have a non refundable booking. He says that hotel is sold out and my senior has made a mistake so can't do anything. He said if u wish to call Mr. Manohar out owner, u r free to call. 

Staff is not at all empathetic. Inspire of requesting 3 times to provide quieter room I was allocated noisy room. Dey are not at all sensitive towards single lady traveller. Staff is highly unprofessional and say v cannot do anything because of our colleagues mistake. 

Highly non recommended hotel
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Menka,

Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We would like to express our apologies for your poor experince at our property. Kindly be adviced that our team is working on the issue & would help train the concerned staff. We would like to let you know that safety and security of all the guests has always been our top priority. 

We would be grateful if you give us a chance to turn your experience around. Looking forward to welcoming you again. 

Kind Regards,
General Manager
Hotel Kohinoor Continental
placeInfo/address: Andheri Kurla Road Andheri E, Mumbai 400059 India
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Andheri E

title: Slightly upgraded version of a Oyo room
text:
Torn sofa, broken door stopper, worn out tea table, stained doors, dirty shower curtain, lack of cupboard for clothes, non availability of utility items greet you when you step into this supposedly 4 star hotel.  The bathroom  is  tiny with just a shower curtain separating the bath area.  The only thing just reminds us this is 4 star hotel is the food items prices. Otherwise it can be given one star. The rating of 2 stars given for Room service and Housekeeping boys. 
Tonight found tiny insects crawling everywhere. Scared to sleep out of fear of these insects creeping into my ears or nose. The hotel is in a worn out condition. Had no choice than to stay here as its prepaid. Go for better hotels in the vicinity at the same price. Not at all recommended
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Kavitha,

Greetings from Hotel Kohinoor Continental!

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We sincerily apologise for the inconvenience caused during your stay. Our number one priority is to make sure our guests leave happy and satisfied. Please let us know when you plan to visit Kohinoor Continental and we will make sure that your stay not only meets, but exceeds your expectations.

Warm Regards,
General Manager
Hotel Kohinoor Continental

title: Wonderful night life experience
text:
Had visited to one of my favorite restaurant in Andheri Kohinoor continental ❤️. We went out to try some lip-smacking dishes from Solitaire restaurant😇. Must say the property is just wonderful 😍 and so does is food.

The ambience is really good in the evening so would suggest to go in the evening time itself. They also have nice decors, Live music 🎶, bar section and lovely romantic candle lights setup which will make your evening wow😍

The staff is really good ❤️. We did received amazing hospitality. Coming to the food part we had some amazing dishes like Thai basil chicken tikka, Chicken tikka butter masala, Naan, Lucknowi chicken biryani and Gulab jamun cheesecake

The cheesecake dessert is highly recommended! Loved the taste.. They also have rasmalai tiramisu! 🤤. Overall a great joy to visit this place. Looking forward to visit this place again.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from Hotel Kohinoor Continental!

Thank you for the feedback and the kind commendations. We endeavour to go above and beyond to ensure our guests have memorable and top-notch experiences.  We are glad you liked our live music facilities, variety of food and decors. It was indeed our pleasure to serve you as our valuable patron.

We are looking forward to serving you again soon!

Best Regards,
General Manager

title: Terrible Setvice
text: I visited the cafe/restataunt today. As it was past 1100 hrs. They advise me that I could only order burger and French fries as they are busy with the lunch buffet. I order for burger which would come with French fries and a black coffee to Mr Rutikesh. I told him since burgers come with French fries so I don't want French fries. After waiting for over 15 minutes one Mr Tyren comes with French fries telling me the burger will come shortly. Thinking that they give burgers and French fries separately at this restraunt, I have my French fries. Once I finish that I ask for my burger but it's still not ready. After waiting 30 minutes I call the incharge and he says it will come in another 5 minutes. Then my burger arrives after another 10 minutes with French fries again. Now I realise these guys have tricked me by taking a burger order and then quietly giving me French fries first. Rightly they have billed me for the burger and French fries separately. To make matters worse, when I ask for my coffee, they have forgotten my order of the coffee. I reorder for it and wait for another 5 minutes for it.  The staff seems least interested which shows in their way of taking orders and forgetting orders. Also 30 to 40 minutes for a chicken burger is an all time record in my books.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from Hotel Kohinoor Continental! 

Thank you for taking the time to write this review.

We always strive to deliver the best service to our guests, and we apologize that we did not match up in certain areas on this occasion. We genuinely value the information you have shared with us in your feedback. Please be rest assured that we will look into it in great detail. We seek to improve on feedback like this, and we genuinely wish to welcome you again to our property and make you experience nothing but the very best.

We are hoping to serve you soon.

Best Regards,
General Manager

title: Cousins Wedding
text:
We had organised a 3 day lavish wedding at kohinoor...every day was with unique theme, the service provided for the entire stay was very exemplary

The decorations thatbwere provided by Anil and team were top notch, he was so particular to provide the best, he gave lot of ideas, suggestions. He knows his work so well, client servicing was of the highest order. His whole team worked very hard to out different sets in record time and everything was seamless. Loved every theme. Thanks Anil and team

Sandeep Mirinda never slept for last 4 days, every small aspect and he and his team took care, the housekeeping folks, the folls who served food had only objective in mind. To keep the entire wedding group happy. Everyone in our group mentioned about the best servuce they got.

Dhaval, Azaad, Harsh thank you for being very patient with us and you took very nice care
Thank you kohinoor team, your professinalism and flexible approach makes you a wonderful host.

Loved it ....keep rocking kohinoor team

Lot of shopping can be done in and around hotel

title: Good hotel with worst services
text: I stayed in this hotel during my business trip to mumbai. As this is adjacent to Vile parle station and near to domestic airport so i choose this hotel. As the location of the hotel is just near to Vile parle station  so area is crowded. Rooms were clean and nicely maintained though i missed the charging point near bed. Sleep quality was good. Breakfast was ok but services were pathetic. I could not understand why all staff was busy with nothing. They all tends to stand between buffet table and kitchen way so no one can call them. Drinking water i got after finishing of my breakfast that too after lots of reminders. Tea i finally succeeded in getting after so much wait and reminders. So overall this hotel recommended only if you need a hotel near to vile parle station.

title: Third stay in Parle International
text:
Despite being inside a marketing complex, this hotel exudes a semblance of class and a bit of old Mumbai hotel charm. I've stayed here thrice, and whenever there's a good deal around online sites, my ensure that folks visiting from my office in Delhi stay here. It's a stone's throw away from the Ville Parle station, and about a kilometer from the Western Expressway - 15 mins from the airport.
The beds are excellent, the staff well-trained and courteous, the rooms are quite large and spacious, the bed quality is excellent. Minus a pool, it's pretty much 3-star. 
The overall ambience is such that after a hard day in Mumbai, you actually look forward to getting back to this hotel, call up friends, and open a couple of beers over some very good snacks that they do. The tension just seeps our of you.
