title: Excellent
text: This is a budget hotel, but the rooms are comfortable and in good decorative order. Breakfast is simple but tasty. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of many tourist attractions. The thing that really makes this hotel outstanding though is the service. We were greeted with a smile and check-in was fast and efficient. Room service and housekeeping were also great. My boyfriend was ill while we were staying here and they called a doctor for us who arrived promptly and whose charges were reasonable. When I then asked where I could find a pharmacy to get his prescription filled, the receptionist offered to send one of the porters to go for me, which is thought was a great touch. The door staff were always willing to help with hailing a taxi or giving directions. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers who don't want to pay a fortune for a hotel in Mumbai.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great
text: I agree with all the positive comments of others. Great location. Friendly. Basic. Clean and a good stay experience. The price is good. Certainly would stay there again. They provided an early checkin as we got off an early train. Paul and Paul from Adelaide South Australia.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Clean rooms, great location, very good service
text: Chateau Windsor is a great option in busy Mumbai. A short walk from the city's beautiful promenade, Colaba Causeway shopping and the Gateway to India site. The room was very clean, renovated and up-to-date with modern features. The service was also extremely professional and breakfast was delicious. Great view of the city from the rooftop breakfast area! Wi-Fi was free, fast.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Had a quite good stay here
text:
Many reasons why one should stay here if Marine Drive or Nariman point is the area.
Located next to Hotel Ambassador and opposite to "Pizza by the bay" and half a km from Flora fountain. Hardly 20 steps from Marine drive so enjoyed leisure walking in Marine Drive till late 2 o'clock in the night.
Rooms are very spacious. Staff is ever helping and greeting with smile. Great value for money especially at such a good location. 
We reached one hour before the check in time (12 in the noon)...as rooms were not ready, we were given a small but good room to stay for an hour. It was quite courteous on their part.
Deluxe rooms are rejuvenated one and hence better than Superior rooms at INR 600-700 extra but only difference is in interiors and nothing else. Having said that please remember that you won't have any problem in superior rooms also and they are quite good.
Limited hot water timing is an issue...please ask management while checking in.
Wi-fi doesn't work everywhere at least didn't work in my room. Service was simply great.
Ask for quiet rooms as it's very near to Marine drive.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Pretty Good!
text:
Decent hotel at a perfect location.
Value for money,  neat and clean
Cooperative staff.
This hotel came to my rescue when there was almost no other hotel available in the area.

Recommended.
(Don't expect it to be lavish)
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great Room - AWESOME price
text:
You cannot beat the location and the price... it is a steal. The breakfast is not that great, but other than that it is a no fuss, clean, efficient hotel.
There are many restaurants close by, next to the local train station.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Value for money...
text:
The staff was very friendly & helpful. It is located near marine drive. You have boating near Chowpaty, multiple options for food etc. Best place to relax with your loved ones.
Hotel provides lockers within the room & hot water facillity 24 hrs. Breakfast is complimentary - served within the room.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A gem of a small hotel
text: This is the second time I have stayed at the Chateau Windsor within the last year and the excellent standard I found on my first visit has been maintained perfectly.  Extremely clean, well appointed, within easy reach of the city centre and coastline.  The reception staff are very attentive and are anxious to please, it would seem, every guest and they certainly succeed. The rooms are cleaned to a high standard every day, security is first class, the rooms well appointed and really good showers.  Room service is excellent too with an abundance of air conditioning facilities.  Why look elsewhere, the room prices are a steal!!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Superb location and friendly hotel
text: A very decent and clean hotel near Churchgate. Location is one of the best in Mumbai at a reasonable cost. Staff is very friendly. We stayed there for participating in Mumbai Marathon on 18th January and turned out to be the most convenient place. We were served Tea / Coffee at 345 am before leaving for the marathon with a smile. Just brilliant.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: decent hotel in Mumbai
text:
very nice and friendly staff, basic breakfast very reasonably priced. You can order from close by restaurent and they will deliver to the room.
after a full day of walking and shopping, it is a nice place to relax.
You can go for a walk in the morning on the ocean front which is very nice.Many of the nice hotels and many nice restaurents within walking distance to this hotel
the bell boys are very helpful.
We were about 10 women travellers and felt very safe there.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good Budget Hotel in a great location
text: The hotel is located in an excellent location near the chuchgate station.   Since the hotels in this area are very expensive, the Chateau Windsor is a good choice for medium budget hotel.  Rooms are clean.  The breakfast is just basic.  Taxis available in front of the hotel anytime.  The hotel does not have a restaurante but there are few restaurants nearby and Colaba is just 10 minutes away.  Would certainly recommend.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A Quite and comfortable place in Mumbai
text: The place is extremely clean, the location is great, the stuff is nice and helpful. We took a room in the renovated first floor. It costs a little more, but it is much nicer than the old rooms. The room itself felt like in a good european hotel.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good place
text:
We stayed 2 nights at the Windsor in Deluxe Room accommodation. The rooms were clean and spacious, the bathroom as well. The bed is really soft and comfortable. Staff are friendly and accommodating.

The hotel is a few km walk to the main Colaba sights, but metered taxis are cheap so not too far to get to the taj hotel or gateway and will only cost you around 50rupees.

Breakfast is served on the roof top overlooking the cricket stadium, you can watch the crows trying to steal left overs which is fairly entertaining.

Wifi is free but they give you this 30 digit pass code that you have to enter every time you connect which is annoying. The TV has cable and lots of free movie channels which is good if you want to relax in the room.

Overall decent stay and for just over $100 a night was good value for money, considering it was peak season and other places we stayed in india for this rate were atrocious.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Finally a decent night's sleep in India!
text:
Really nice hotel, despite first appearances and the lift shaft. Rooms are actually great!
We'd been in four other places in India and had decided to splash out a bit to get a good night's sleep - this place didn't disappoint.
Everything was great, and the staff were really friendly. Would definitely recommend - especially the veg breakfast in the morning!
Only two negatives were the wifi wouldn't reach the room, and that the price on booking.com didn't include taxes, so ended up paying more than expected.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent choice for our budget
text:
This was a great hotel for our first stay in Mumbai. At first we were unsure because of the old elevator and lobby on the 5th floor but our room was very nice for the cost. We reserved the double and single bed room and they were even able to fit another rollaway in our room when a fourth person was added to the booking last minute (for a price). Our room had a balcony that overlooked Veer Nariman Rd, it was very nice but also loud, honking until 1 am...but that might be anywhere you stay in Mumbai haha. The breakfast on the rooftop was very beautiful as we were there early most mornings and watching the sun rise over the city was very nice. The food itself was nothing special, although my husband loved the potato pancakes they served (I can't remember what they called them but they were just like latkes). We could also order bottled water and beer to our room at all hours and that was very convenient as well. There was free wifi but the code changed every day and you could only use it on one device per person. 

The hotel is very close to Marine Drive, so that provided nice sunset viewings and walks along the Queen's Necklace at night. We also were able to walk to Gateway of India, Prince of Wales Museum and Colaba Markets from there (warning: we are walkers so it was probably a good 20 min walk).
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
Probably the best value for money hotel in the Mumbai (Churchgate, Fort, Colaba area) if you a reading these reviews to find the best bang for your buck look no further you have just found it. 
We are an Australian family travelling around India for 3 weeks with our kids age 10&13. We arrived at the hotel hours before check in but this was no problem at all, check in was super efficient and we were quickly shown to our family room with queen bed, single and bed settee, spotlessly clean ensuite, massive TV with satellite and balcony overlooking Veer Nariman and Marine Drive, just perfect. Mumbai hotel prices are significantly higher than most Indian cities as you will aware of if you are checking them out and with this in mind we were a little concerned that Chateau Windsor may not deliver but it was excellent. There are staff everywhere, all smiling and chatting and really eager to assist with luggage, sightseeing suggestions, taxis etc.
Breakfast though basic (included in room rate) was hot and delicious with the option of room service or alfresco dining on the roof terrace, which we chose to do. There is no dinner menu though meals can be ordered in and the hotel is surrounded by high quality restaurants, there are lower budget Indian restaurants and some fantastic mid and high range options, we ate at Saltwater and Gaylords which both worked out approx $50 for family of 4 which is expensive for India but in the real world superb value. 
I would highly recomend this hotel, the service and clenliness are excellent.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good Location but expensive
text: The location of the hotel is excellent and the hotel is neat and clean, the good part ends here.The hotel is expensive and room I was given was really small. I have never lived in a small room like this  even for a day so this was a new experience for me.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Basic homely hotel, great location
text:
We stayed as a family of four here for one night. The hotel facilities are rather basic, more like that of a budget hotel, though clean and with hospitable staff. 

We were given one family room with three beds for the price of a double room, and another double room. The family room on the 5th floor was rather noisy as it was next to the kitchen which got busy early in the morning. However, it also meant that we could dip in to request for extra cups or spoons from an obliging kitchen staff! No complaints, except that the hotel somehow felt rather like a government guest house in a remote location in decor and ambience. Basic furniture, no toiletries in the bathroom, no kettle or coffee maker, and no top sheets on the beds to cover yourself or to line the blankets. 

Breakfast on the terrace too was a very basic affair - egg, toast, banana and coffee, which one had to wait for 20 minutes to be got ready and brought. The roof top could be made more colourful with more flowering plant pots and greenery or cane chairs, but the management seem to have decided to keep everything at the most basic, functional level. Certainly everything functions adequately. So whatever we requested was promptly done, the big garden umbrellas in the roof top restaurant did help to keep the glaring sun out, and the breakfast was quite edible and the coffee hot and plentiful. Not a luxurious or memorable stay, but comforable enough in a homely sort of way.

Of the several pluses is the courteous Mr Raja who arranged on the usual taxi rates his own car and driver for us to go out of Bombay on an excursion, and the cheerful and non obstrusive staff.  But the best part is the access to the beautiful Marine Drive at night, which keeps busy with walkers, hawkers, couples and families till the small hours of the morning, and where we walked around till after mid night. We were grateful to have a reasonably comfortable hotel to come back to, safely, and so closeby.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Average hotel
text:
The hotel is housed in a building that includes other businesses as well. The reception is located on the fifth floor, while the rooms are on the 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th floors. We were given a room on the 2nd floor and every time we left the hotel, someone would have to go up to the 5th floor first to drop off the room keys, and then go down again. It was quite inconvenient!

Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace. It is a very basic affair of toast, omelet, banana and tea/coffee. The terrace is also devoid of any decor and the tables are simple wooden ones, with plastic chairs.

The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were very clean.

The location of the hotel is excellent, right next to the Ambassador hotel, and a stone's throw from Marine Drive. There are numerous eating outlets nearby. Churchgate station is also very close by.

All in all, an average hotel. Quite expensive, but that is to be expected in Mumbai where cost does not necessarily match the quality!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good Location, decent hotel.
text: A good place to stay if you want stay around Marine drive, slightly over priced with not so good dining services but a very nice location, clean room and an average bathroom. Can be recommended for Business travellers to  Mumbai.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Comfortable n satisfying Kohinoor
text: It was a visit to Kohinoor after quite some time. Pleased to confirm same standard maintained rather improved. They have nice  cozy lobby where you will find some guests waiting. Now restaurant also shifted to ground floor it is always crowdy. Room is same old with slightly older facilities may  be in wing B only where I was staying. Overall a nice stay, must mention about their nice art gallery. Which is wonderful. Breakfast is good would have been better with more choice. Now they run a spa also that is also good and soothing.
ownerResponse/text:

Best Regards,

mr. salik ahmed is good with his services.  great service

text: Kohinoor Continental/Elite own(ed) another Hotel in Chennai in the name of the Grand Elite. We had reserved the banquet hall in this hotel last year and due to the pandemic, everything closed. They are yet to return our reservation deposit for this and when contacted, nobody responds - neither from Chennai nor from Mumbai headquarters. I request the management to take note of this and respond.

Our team members will be reaching out to you personally. We hope to resolve this to your benefit and earn you back as a guest.

title: Looks like 3 stars, works like 1 star
text:
Kindly avoid at all cost!

I have never had such a horrid experience before, even after travelling all over the world. Very unfriendly, unhelpful staff, unclean rooms and to top it all, there was a blast in the room middle of the night because of some bell set-up cracking. Whole room was smelling like a furnace thereafter, and we had to go down twice to get electricians and keys for another room (because no staff was available to come up) and there was utter disregard for our safety as well of fellow customers in the hotel, as the staff took the incident very lightly and asked us to go back to the same room and wait for electricians, instead of asking us to wait in the lobby, while examining the seriousness of the issue, which any decent hotel would have. The next room given to us was equally bad, bed was small, dirt below the bed, smelly, stained shower curtains and so on. We also paid for all meals, which was again, tribble, and tea/coffee was additionally chargeable in breakfast (that’s new!) and so were the toiletries like tooth brush/dental kit etc.

Sigh, what a hole in wall.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from Hotel Kohinoor Continental!

Heartfelt thanks to you for leaving you valuable feedback on your experience with us!
At the outset, we apologize for the unfortunate experience of your stay at Hotel Kohinoor Continental. We take complete accountability for our inadequate services and thank you for bringing them to our attention.

We always endeavour to serve our guests with exemplary hospitality while promptly resolving the shortcomings at our end.
With the sincere assurance of flawless and refined services, we look forward to hosting you again soon.

Best Regards,
Mukund Kamat, Vice President – Hotels Division

title: Excellent hotel
text: It was really very comfortable and clean, I stay there for almost three days and staff behaviour is really pleasing,Excellent Hotel, Value For Money, Secured, Nice Surrounding. Food was also great and hygienic.
ownerResponse/text:

3) Poor wi-if connectivity.

title: Barely Makes it to the mark
text:
Having stayed in the hotel for multiple occassions for my business trips I can very well list the pore n cons of the property.
Pros
1. Decently sized rooms.
2. Housekeeping is quite decent
3. The Beds are comfortable.

Cons.
1. The breakfast spread lacks in variety and is often tight in options and efficiency
2. The pool they have is for pool parties and has a fountain in it so no swimming.
3. The television barely has a channel that's not free to air and you need some decent channels it takes quite a lot of pestering.
4. The restaurant and room service staff are very slow.
5. Menu is overpriced compared to taste.
6. No views either the rooms open up to the Mumbai Metro platform or to a residential complex.
7. The tower B has an idiotic control box for the lights with half the buttons need to be jumped upon to turn off the lights.

All in all not worth if you are spending from your own pockets.
ownerResponse/connectionToSubject: Mukund Kamat, Vice President – Hotels Division

title: Good hotel food was nice and they had a variety. Rooms were great
text: We stayed here after arriving from Uthra Pradesh (North India) via domestic flight. Town is crowded and we didnt want to get out of the our tourist bus. We saw the houses of famous actors. Beach too. but the city is not so clean. Hotel was compact and the rooms are small. can say it's clean but we had to change rooms as there was a leak in the bath room. their food was excellent. I should say amazing spread of various Cuisine. had nice dumplings, Chinese, Mongolian, South Eastern, Western as well as food from various parts of India. Very helpful staff. lot of lobbies where we can spend time chatting and playing your board games or card games. Coffee shop looked attractive too.

title: Best Hotel In Andheri
text:
🏨Kohinoor continental is one of the best and popular hotel in andheri which will take care of your travel overall experience and make your tour memorable.Solitaire restaurant of kohinoor continental will served you best food from all over india. They have different kind of food festival to showcase you rich taste of India from each state. We recently got chance to go for DAAWAT -E -WAZWAN kashmiri food festival and it was one of the best experience i ever had with kashmiri food. In this festival you will came across to one of the best dishes from kashmir and  service which they provide is top class. Food was awesome right form starters to mouthwatering dessert. So book your calendar for DAAWAT -E -WAZWAN kashmiri food festival at Kohinoor continental from 22Jan-2Feb and enjoy delecious food from kashmir. 

😋Taste - 5/5
👨🏻‍🍳Service - 5/5
🏡Ambiance - 5/5
💲Value for money - 5/5
🌍Place -  Kohinoor continental 
📍Location - Kohinoor

title: STAYED 2 NIGHTS
text:
WHY
Mid-segment business hotel located at Vile Parle, Mumbai
100 well equipped rooms categorised as 24 hour Room Service
In-room amenities include AC, TV and private refrigerator
F&B areas include a multi cuisine restaurant, a coffee shop and a Gujarati restaurant
Recreational facilities include health club and massage
Well equipped conference and banquet hall available
Internet connectivity and WiFi available
Other facilities include laundry
Recommended for business travellers
Located 4 kms from Mumbai airport and 2 kms from Vile Parle railway station

ravellers who want easy access to the beach will want to stay at the Hotel Parle International Mumbai (formerly Quality Inn Parle International Hotel). Once checked in, one can easily reach the beach after a 15-minute drive. Those who are mixing business with pleasure can also handle their transactions at the hotel's business centre. The Hotel Parle International Mumbai also features an exercise room for those who do not want to miss their workout.

Overall, a decent stay @ Hotel Parle International.
Will I go back? May be :)

title: Nice Hospitality at Parle International
text:
Located just opp of Vile Parle East Railway station and near to Airport. They provide free pickup drop service for Airport.

Check in process is smooth. Property is Old but well maintained. Rooms are also specious compare to other hotels of same range in Mumbai.

All rooms contain LED TV, fridge, tea/coffee maker, Shaving kit, Tooth brush along with bathroom accessories .

Buffet breakfast served  at their coffee shop at reception area, contain good quality of all Veg, South Indian, North Indian Items and Eggs preparations. Live counter for Dosa and Uttapa is also there and staff is also very helpful.

This property also have Gujarati Thali restaurant, Bar and Health club but I had not availed the same.

Overall I enjoyed my stay at this Hotel.

title: 白を基調とした部屋

国際線やフルキャリアの国内線をメインとした空港第二ターミナルからは車で10分ぐらい、LCCの国内線ターミナルからも30分かからないぐらい、メトロの駅のそばでもあつりとても便利です。
建物自体は新しくないようで、エレベーターなど古さを感じます。ただ、全部かわかりませんが部屋も改装されている部屋があるようです、白を基調とした明るい部屋でした。
観光でホテルを楽しむというよりは、ビジネスホテルとして、もしくはトランジットでの宿泊として利用するには良いホテルと思います。

title: Best hotel at prime location
text: I checked in at 4pm on 30th Nov & stayed here for 3days.For first I booked superior room but for 3rd day upgraded it to premium.The premium was a bit spacious than superior but facility wise there was not much different,to be honest neither room felt to spacious but both were equipped with all the facilities.The staff was very courteous & helpful.The in-house food & drinks rven bottled water was expensive,But thankfully I got the complimentary breakfast all the three days.But there are many options for food if you want to save some money on food.The breakfast was tasty & have variety,Last but not the least, TripAdvisor helped me in finding a better deal,I booked this for as low as 4k per night,so thanks TripAdvisor & agoda.com for that.So,you must consider this hotel if you don't want to waste your time in traffic & don't want to stay away from the airport.So, thumbs up for Kohinoor Continental & a big thank you TripAdvisor,agoda.com & Kohinoor Continental for a pleasant stay.

title: Would not go again
text:
I picked this hotel for a few nights stay while travelling back from Jaipur to home on the back of previous reviews. All I can say is I don’t know where they were staying. The room was not good with dirty marks over the walls, pealing wall paper, noisy air conditioning although the shower was very good. 
The food here was repetitive and for some reason it was always cold. I think they put it cold in the serving heaters and rely on this to heat it through. The meat dishes were in my view awful and was full of bones which put me off straight away. The plates were often dirty and I had to go through the rack to pick a clean plate. 
The hotel itself was clean and the lobby area was well presented along with the corridors. I do think this hotel needs a make over to bring it up to a higher standard. 
It is down as a hotel near the airport but this is wrong it is a good 20 to 30 minute ride through the busy streets.

title: Excellent hotel to stay with very low rates...
text:
I stayed there for 3 days as i was on my business trip.the experience was really like a five star hotel competitively it was not a five star but i have rated this hotel five star.
I called personally to make reservation the guy there at reservation desk made me understand of the different categories of the room that they had and made my reservation for an executive room which was affordable the great thing was that he explained me so well  that he visualised the property to me within few minutes.
Again the airport pick up was complimentary and the driver was there at the airport with a pluck card flashing my name on it so did not had to wait. Location is superb Airport as well as Railway station is very close by.
For a single lady to stay in a hotel  will defineatly recommend hotel parle international.

title: Disgusting and Inhumane
text: Our family of 4 returned to Mumbai from our pilgrimage to Nasik and Shirdi on the 31st January about 5.30 pm tired, hungry but spiritually fulfilled. We were checked-in by a tall man wearing glasses who was impolite, mechanical and lacked social skills. Without making eye contact, he speedily completed the check-in and asked the porter to take our luggage to a building across the road to the adjoining street. When we asked why we had to move to an outbuilding he abruptly answered that the hotel has another wing. So we all picked up parts of our own luggage to take across as the porter did not even have a trolley to wheel our luggage across. The outbuilding looked old and delapidated. The lift was small and awkward. When we got to our rooms, we were greeted by a dirty room service tray that had not been cleared. The porter managed to open the room doors and abruptly asked which bags should be placed in which rooms. Once that was done, he looked at us expectantly for a tip for something that we had done ourselves - that is carry our own bags. We just thanked him and ignored his expectant look for a tip so he left feeling despondent. I buzzed reception requesting them to remove the dirty tray from the entrance to my room. We then went into the washrooms to take a wash and prepare for dinner and noticed that there were no hand towels. Again I buzzed reception and another front desk staff told me to ring housekeeping to arrange this myself. By this time I was annoyed as I had to arrange my check-in all by myself. Are guests expected to check that everything is in order prior to checking in? My family and I washed up and went all the way back to the main reception. By this time, my 73 year old mom was getting agitated that we had to walk back and forth several times even to get a proper meal in this place. Our booking was 2 Executive Rooms with breakfast and wi-fi and we had booked this via agoda. We were naturally expecting much better. The cost of the Executive Room at the hotel is Rs9500-Rs10500 but what we got was not worth even Rs2000. I finally gave the front office my voucher which he had refused to collect when I offered it to him during our check-in. We insisted that we were unhappy with the dog-kennel-like rooms he had put us in the outbuilding and that he is to give us rooms to the value we have paid. Another short man with glasses at the front desk intercepted and spoke abruptly, rudely and arrogantly and by this time we had had enough. We told them that we are going for dinner and that when we return, we are expecting to be moved to better rooms within the main building. Again the porter looked at us expectantly for a tip when we had to assist him to move our own luggage, but he got nothing as before. Wi-Fi in the main building was not working either and we had difficulty doing our online check-ins for our morning flights. We requested a scale to weigh our bags and that was not sent to our rooms. Breakfast in the morning was in a small room with not much room to move and not much variety to choose from. We just ate tea and toast and headed for the airport. The driver that dropped us off waited expectantly for a tip and got angry when he got nothing. We walked away wondering if the staff at hotel parle international were there to provide a service to their guests or merely there to collect cash handouts from tourists. Their staff are inhumane and the service is disgusting to say the least. Never again!

title: Hotel at Convenient Location but with Poor Maintenance
text:
Recently I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location is great - in front of Vile Parle Railway Station in East. Next to this hotel is Dinanath Mangeshkar Natyagriha and a market. I was allotted a room in the annexe building. The room was spacious; however there were number of small cockroaches roaming in the room. The bellboy tried to kill couple of cockroaches with the TV remote when I entered the room for the first time. There is lack of round the clock security at the entrance of annexe building. The rooms have become older with visible signs of poor maintenance. The room has noisy window air conditioner. Though located in Mumbai, not many regional channels subscribed for the dish TV.
The elevator of the annexe building was not working for couple of days during my stay.
The food was good and tasty. The breakfast menu has good variety; however the area is too cramped. I had to request the other guests to allow me to share their table.
 Overall an average kind of hotel.

title: Terrible experience
text: It all started when we reached the hotel. The staff was helpful in carrying the luggage to the reception. But, we were made to wait there for half an hour even though we had an online booking .Then they led us to a room .To my surprise the room hadn't been cleaned. It was stinking of alcohol and cigarettes . There were bottles lying around .They took another 30 minutes or so to provide us a different room. It was also stinking of cigarettes. It took them 3 calls to respond and we had to wait an hour outside the room.It even gets worse, the Air Conditioner was very noisy. The water wasn't warm enough. When i complained about the water ,  the person who came claimed that the water was hot and went away even though it was not. I had to call the service again . Luckily the second time, they provided us with buckets of  lukewarm water. I wouldn't recommend this hotel . Initially i was offered Room number 102 and after complaining they provided Room no 114

text: Completely 5 star hotel for all who like 5 star experience especially in Mumbai near vile parle station and also airport with very nice service with clean rooms and very Co operative staff I recommended it for commen people to book through apps like goibibo and enjoy 5 star hotel in very much affordable rates with special discount

title: Average Hotel
text:
Stayed in this hotel for a night and was not satisfied with this hotel.
Room - Cleanliness was OK, but looked very old and sad. Window ACs make a lot of noise and temp control was not working
Food - Below average
Staff - They are polite and friendly but very busy
Location is good....near the airport

text: It is a decent hotel, near to Airport & just in front of Ville Parle station, so you can get good connectivity. I feel staff could be more courteous felt a bit arrogant. Took breakfast in my 3 days stay, it was good.

title: Very happy! We will stay here if we come to Mumbai.
text:
Excellent location, well mannered employees, prompt service, clean rooms, good restaurants around and out of the world sunset in the Marine Drive- what more do you want?
We particularly liked the employees greeting us every time we went in and out. I found the staffs of this hotel are very friendly and courteous. We stayed there for 6 nights - they made us feel at home. Thank you.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Recommended on all fronts
text:
It is difficult to settle on a hotel in Mumbai. OK if you are willing to pay top dollar there are plenty of high end corporate options. For a mid price option we could not fault this hotel. Yes its a little quirky, access is by an old fashioned lift, a novelty in itself, made even more charming by the ever smiling front of house staff who are very helpful in arranging taxis at good value, at the drop of a hat. .It's a 40 minute taxi ride from the Airport which is typical for any where in South Mumbai. We stayed for 4 nights in room 429, super deluxe, it was spacious, immaculately clean, with a very comfortable bed,(one of the best we have slept in in India) clean linen and a bathroom with a good shower and it had a small balcony, ideal for watching the street life below. Breakfast was basic but adequate, some fruit juice would have helped, it can be taken on the rooftop or in your room.  AC was efficient as was room cleaning service.  Room service was prompt. After travelling we ordered some dosas from the Veg restaurant up the road which were delicious and arrived hot ! A 2 minute walk to Marine Drive and the Queens necklace, take a walk early evening and soak up the atmosphere with the locals. A 3 minute walk to Queensgate station and 15 minute walk to Colaba. No dining options within the hotel but plenty of good restaurants in walking distance. If you are a lover of seafood try Trishnas in the Fort area.
Thanks to all the staff for a very pleasant, hassle free stay.
Kate and Andy
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Wonderful Hotel-Nariman point
text: Had a business trip to Mumbai. stayed in Chateau Windsor Hotel for two days. One of the best located hotel near Nariman Point-Marine Drive. Cost fitting in the budget. Food served hot n nice. Wonderful staff.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Nice clean rooms excellent location.
text:
If you are OK with 70-80 older hotel like charm or prefer home like feeling over star hotel designer rooms, you'll like this hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. Toilet is clean and no shortage of water (in Mumbai). AC , TV are as expected (in contrary to come older reviews). 
Now lets come to the location : Its located just opposite to 'The cricket club of Mumbai', 2 minute from Church-gate station and from my room i could see the sea. Everyday we spent time before and after dinner on Marine drive.
The breakfast is basic but that was fine with me. There are so many restaurants all around i don't think it is needed. We ordered tea coffee a number of times and it was delivered without delay. I have no complaints over service.
You may feel the cost is a little too much, but that's for the location i guess. I wont hesitate to stay in that hotel again if i visit one more time.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good accommodation, great location
text: The hotel is located just a stone throw away from Marine Drive. Although it's not palatial like a chateau, the hotel is in an Art-Deco building with 1950s furniture and caged lift. It's clean and comfortable. Wifi is available but charge-able. So I opted not to be connected to the internet for 2 nights before I moved on from Mumbai. You can choose to eat your breakfast either in your room or on the rooftop terrace. I chose to eat on the rooftop terrace - the view not that great - but it's all right, not too hot. The reception can also organize transport arrangements or excursions for you, and the prices are reasonable. Opposite the hotel is a pizza restaurant with a view of Marine Drive but you may want to eat in the air-conditioned area if you wish to get away from traffic noise. Overall the hotel is a good accommodation in a great location!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent location for South Mumbai
text: Neat hotel. Responsive staff. Cost effective. Décor somewhat tired and could do with refurbishment. Externals need a coat of paint too. Great location for all points in South Mumbai. Will use again soon.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Fabulous location, affordable price
text:
We went there in May 2014. Its a great place to stay with MARINE Drive just a 2 min walk away and a 10 min taxi ride to fort/colaba. The service is prompt and courteous. It is not very jazzy and has an old world feel, however the rooms/ washrooms are clean and well equipped.

Must stay for official and leisure visits. Highly recommended.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: NO VALUE FOR MONEY:- AVERAGE  HOTEL
text:
Our first preference was Subha Place. They offered us the rate almost the same as this hotel. Since, our Mumbai visit materialized at the last moment, we did not book that hotel. When we reached their, no room was available. Then, we have tried Residency Fort over phone they also didn’t had the room. The taxi driver took us to two other hotels which were not good.  
Under such circumstances, we decided to stay in Chateau Windsor. We stayed here for two nights in last week of sept.14 in their (We are family of four  2 adults and 2 Kids) quadrangle room  which they claim is for four persons, but is not. The fourth bed is a “sofa”, it is only a sleeper berth as one finds in the train. Room has no luxury and even the interior is not good. There is no tea/coffee maker in the room. The hotel is very old and very normal/basic. From outside its look like a apartment building with old style lift and reception on the 5th floor.  Hotel does not even have its own restaurant. It only provide a fixed breakfast which is two pieces of cutlet, two bread pieces with jam and butter, one banana with a tea or coffee. You may choose omelet/egg instead of cutlet, if you prefer non-veg. 
They do not provide any assistance on information on local attraction. They don’t have any brochure or information paper which they can provide to the customer. Staff is OK, not enthusiastic. 
No free Wifi , you have to pay Rs.60/- per half an hour for using wifi. The room tariff is very high in comparison to the facility and infrastructure. 
Location is good, b/f provided is average in taste, sleep in the night is peaceful.
 I would say that it’s not terrible or poor but very average.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Buena hubicación
text: Lo mejor del hotel es la zona, en pleno Colaba y a mano para visitar a pie la mayoría de los puntos turísticos. Las habitaciones están muy bien y tienen una salita especial donde pudimos esperar cómodas hasta la hora de ir al aeropuerto, te ofrecen un baño con ducha  y todo por lo que podes pasear tranquilo y refrescarte antes de salir. Lo malo: te cobran el wifi.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: " worst and most costly hotel of my whole trip!"
text:
Firstly this is my first time writting on trip advisor. But i think this deseves to be shared! I was staying here for 2 nights, but that was plently for me to know i would not be staying here again! The first day i was given a room on the top floor rooftop, it was the only room on the roof. It might sound glamorous but it really wasn't! After already having to pay for wifi for the day, only to find that my room is too far to recieve the signal, so i had to sit in reception to use the wifi i paid for as they wouldnt give me a refund. They told me a technitian was coming early the next morning to strenghten the signal, but this never happened. Also the aircon mashines are very old and make A LOT of noise, so much that i turned mine off and used the fan instead. Then at 9am there were two men painting the rooftop,very noisely outside my window, so i was awakened by this. 
After sitting in reception for almost an hour using my internet, they asked me if i would like to move to this floor as there was a room free'd up. I gladly excepted only to have an even worse night sleep ever! Firstly, same noisey aircon, so i used only the fan. Also there is an open window that you can't close in the toilet so mosquitos can easily fly in. Secondly there were not bed sheets cover, just a thick blanket type thing, which after using for 10min made me really itchy and im sure there were bed bugs in it. Therefore i spent, the small amount of sleep i had with my towel as a cover. Finally the worst part! At 6.30am this droney noise, the service staff are using the lift (an old gate lift -see photos) constantly, you can hear the lift going up and down the cables and the gates being pulled to and fro at this early hour. I got up and went to reception asking them to use the other lift at reception (away from rooms) or the stairs as it was loud n keeping me awake, but they just looked at me and the noise continues. So here i am, early in the morning writting my first ever post of tripadvisor as people really need to be aware of this. After 3 weeks travelling around India on a budget, this is the most expensive and worst hotel of my trip! However, the rest of India has been amazing! Happy Tripping!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Hotel at great location in center of Mumbai
text: For Indian standards a great hotel in one of the better neighborhoods. The personnel was very friendly and accustomed themselves with our habits rapidly. The price is relatively high, but so are all decent hotels in Mumbai. Very recommendable for business trips or when travelling with friends on a lower budget .
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Strongly recommend!
text:
After researching and reading numerous reviews about hotels, we were worried about what we would find! The hotel put our minds at ease straight away. We checked in at 3 am & all the night porters were extremely helpful. I would suggest paying a little extra for the superior room as it was comfortable & very clean. 
The service was excellent and everyone was helpful & polite. The man on reception was a little moody, but Raj was extremely informative & explained the whole train system. 
If you stay here, go to the cafe 'salt water' for happy hour. $8 us all you can drink cocktails :) 
A great & comfy stay!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Pleasent Stay
text: We were warmly welcomed by the hotel team and the entire staff was so nice,even the gate keepers. The room was unexpectedly great and so much comfortable,very spacious in that rate and in that location. Best hotel to stay in that nice location of mumbai. Would love to continue my stay.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great location, reasonable price
text: The Chateau Windsor is a  good choice,  if you don't want to shell out big bucks for one of the glitzy, overpriced prestige places nearby. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Effective and quiet A/C and ceiling fans, fridge, plasma TV, filtered water in the room. You can take breakfast in your room or on the plain but pleasant rooftop terrace. The room had the best shower we had in India.    It was an 'executive suite' which was perfect for our family of three adults and a teen, since it had a private alcove, where one of us slept,  off the main room.  The staff was exceptionally attentive and pleasant but in a non-intrusive way. Only steps away from CW are several really good restaurants, a handy grocery store, several chemists, the Asiatic 'department store', the  Marine Drive promenade, numerous fancier hotels and the Churchgate Station - where you watch the dabbahwallahs work and/or  take a local train (but not at rush hour!). Most of the sights of south Mumbai are just walking distance away. We were really happy with this choice, made thanks to previous TA reviews. I'm happy we did NOT stay in Colaba - too many street hawkers pestering.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Замечательный отель
text: Замечательный отель. Очень приветливый и отзывчивый персонал. Чистые уютные номера. Вкусные завтраки. Ресторан на крыше с видом на море. Расположение удобное, рядом с Marine drive, не далеко от основных достопримечательностей. Один из лучших отелей, попавшихся во время нашего путешествия по Индии.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Awesome location
text: A great place for business people. Located in the heart of Mumbai... very near to marine drive... Makes this an awesome place and my only choice to stay when in Mumbai. Not recommended for a family n holiday people... Neat rooms n toilets n friendly people around makes this my favourite in Mumbai...
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: En España no pasa de una pensión
text:
Para empezar, la localización no está mal del todo, aunque hubiera sido deseable en ocasiones estar algo más cerca de los principales puntos de interés de la ciudad, hasta los cuales hay un paseito andando.

Nosotros ocupamos las habitaciones standar y superior y no encontramos apenas diferencias, salvo el precio y quizás el tamaño de la habitación (imagino que las de las fotos que se ven bien son las de luxe). Las camas no tienen sábanas para cubrirse, sino una colcha, por lo que da que pensar que las utilizan un cliente tras otro. Los colchones no están mal y las habitaciones se ven limpias. Sin embargo, su aspecto es anticuado y viejo. Tienen aire acondicionado y un ventilador, pero ambos hacen bastante ruido, por lo que si se es sensible a este, se encontrarán dificultades para conciliar el sueño. Además las habitaciones no están insonorizadas y las ventanas de aluminio y las endebles puertas dejan pasar todos los ruidos provinientes de la recepción, de otros clientes y sobre todo de la cocina, la cual no tiene ventanas, sino rejillas y da al patio interior de gran parte de las habitaciones, por lo que se oye nitidamente todo el ruido de platos y cubiertos desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta muy tarde en la noche.

Los baños también necesitan una reforma y las toallas de las manos son poco más grandes que una balleta de cocina. No esperéis muchos útiles de baño porque tan solo ponen jabón y un bote pequeño de gel. Así que mejor que los portéis vosotros.

Toda la inversión del hotel debe estar empleada en poner 4 personas abajo en la calle para saludar al llegar al cliente y para ofrecerles un taxi a la salida y muchos empleados por los pasillos y recepción, que tiene un aspecto más de oficina que de recepción de un hotel.

Además fuimos con todo pagado y se empeñaron en cobrarnos una ridícula tasa por el desayuno consistente en "x" rupias diarias (dependiendo de la inspiración del recepcionista o de lo poco o mucho que te quejes, o de si ese día hay monzón o no, no lo tenemos claro). El desayuno, por cierto, regularcillo, bastante sencillo (huevos, tostadas, mantequilla mermelada y cafe) aunque no es lo peor del hotel, desde mi punto de vista.

Ya por último, y para rematar la agradable estancia, la wifi es de pago (algo más de 1 € la hora, aunque sale proporcionalmente más barato si se contrata el día entero).

Personalmente no volvería a quedarme en este hotel, es bastante lugubre, cutre y la relación calidad-precio totalmente desproporcionada. Su clasificación en España no pasaría de una mera pensión.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A Very good hotel near marine drive / nariman road
text: Hotel staff is very courteous, prompt.  Their service is with smile. Hotel is very well nicely maintained. Interiors of rooms / corridors or neat and clean  It looks as if is just a new hotel.  Entrance at the ground floor, is little bit dull. Otherwise, the hotel stay gives value for money.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Comfortable and beautifully located
text: My husband is a first-timer to India and coming from Australia for a holiday we weren't sure how the reviews of this hotel would correspond to our expectations. We shouldn't have worried  - this hotel was absolutely wonderful! The AC was excellent, the overhead fan helped to circulate the cool air (much needed in the early June heat of Mumbai), the bed was large and comfortable (though a bit hard for my husband), the included breakfast was fine and the attached bathroom was very good. We had room 436 with a balcony, towards the back of the building and very quiet. We were not looking for luxury, but this hotel with its admittedly modest facilities managed to give us a sense of deep comfort. The location was absolutely right for us too. A short walk leads to Marine Drive, lovely for watching the sunset in the evenings. Within walking distance (or a short cab ride) in the other direction leads to many attractions. We particularly enjoyed walking to the Gateway of India and the Prince of Wales museum and discovering great cafes (Kala Ghoda Cafe) and restaurants (Burma Burma). Don't miss the understated but lovely Resham Bhavan Tea Rooms near the hotel, which serves beautiful teas and meals.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Well sited and well run
text: I obtained the name of the hotel in Mumbai from Trip Advisor and noted the reviews.  It was reasonably priced and near the sea but not on the coastal road.  The room was quite spacious with balcony.  Excellent aircon worked well and there was even an overhead fan.  A very comfortable bed with an excellent bathroom and good decor all made for a happy stay and the room service efficient.  The room was cleaned every day, bed made, sheets changed and the bathroom left in excellent order.  The security staff were extremely vigilant and polite and there was someone on duty at all times.  I had paid in advance and paid cash for room service so no bill to pay on departure.  A cab was ready and waiting to return me to the airport, rate agreed beforehand and it all added up to a very enjoyable stay.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Nice and comfortable stay
text: I stayed here for 3 nights mid of October. I haven’t used much of the facilities here except for the restaurant for breakfast which is quite nice. The rooms are neat and clean but quite small. There are some good restaurants in the vicinity. Quite closer to the airport which is plus for business travellers and is well connected by the metro.
ownerResponse/connectionToSubject: Mukund Kamat, Vice President – Hotels Division

title: WOW
text:
The Hotel Kohinoor Continental is a good 4-star hotel in Mumbai. The facilities are excellent, including a swimming pool, and a recommended Solitaire restaurant. The laundry service is OK. The hotel also features another restaurant and a bar. The air conditioning is good. The rooms was spacious and comfortable.
I would like to recommend Solitaire restaurant for its breakfast and high class service,team members are well trained to take care of the guests.they also give farewell to guests on departure.The meetha paan is the best after mint from this place. Specially would like to thank Mr Prathamesh, Suraj,Hilton, for their kind and loving service.

title: Pan Asian festival
text:
This review is about solitaire restaurant.
Pan Asian Food Festival’at The Solitaire Restaurant, Andheri from 25th September till 6th October.

We all know, how huge Asia is, and it is practically impossible to visit every country for a just culinary experience. So Kohinoor Continental is offering Pan Asian Food Festival along with top international cuisines made available under one roof.

The chef is Chef Jajo
Chef Jajo is a Pan Asian cuisine chef and has worked and gained experience cooking at Japanese restaurants for the last 10 years. 

Lunch 12:30 pm – 3:30 pm (Buffet)

Dinner 7.00 pm – 11:30 pm (Ala carte menu/TDH).

Now I come to my experience.

Service was good, but nothing great.

The food was very cold.

Sushis were very good and tasty.
There was live counter of sushi, momos and teriyaki.
All the three was nice.

Except that there was not much variety.

Nothing great for a festival.

But one thing I liked that the theme included few blackboard on which culinary scenes were dream with chalk.

Overall ok experience.

title: Pan Asian buffet at the solitaire restaurant
text:
Dropped here for Sunday brunch with couple of my friends as they had some amazing pan Asian buffet there,menu was curated by chef jajo which was very interesting and worth a visit,menu was well designed  with lots of option for veg and noveg with some amazing starters ,maincourse,live station of waffles,sushi ,tepenyaki ,momos and soup counter,dessert section was loaded with many desserts and other ice cream options.
Our table was looked by servers named Umesh,suraj and macdon .they were really helpful in getting right beverages and drinks to our table and taking every care of our requirements.they were really helpful and patient.also big thank to manager of restaurant Prathamesh for his courteous and calm gesture .do visit this place for Sunday brunch and very good experience.

Follow us on Instagram : food_travel_hog
Facebook : food_travel_hog

To sum up to my stay was 5*

title: Pan Asian food festival
text:
Kohinoor  Continental  Hotel is hosting  Pan Asian Food Festival" from 25th till the 6th October. 

One can savour the best flavors Asian Cuisine at The Sapphire fine dining Restaurant. The restaurant has been beautifully decorated with chinese lanterns, and other artifacts that give you a oriental feeling.  The music and lighting is soft and very relaxing 

MasterChef Jajo along with her team of specialized chefs will daily lay out an lunch/ dinner buffet spread with Pan Asian best dishes  from Japan,  Vietnam, Burma and Thailand and more. Every day the menu will be changed and planned to give diners the best dishes from all over. 
From soups, dimsums, sushi, teppanyaki grills, starters, main course and of course desserts, you don't want to miss this. 
*
*
Head Bartender IsaMohammed Pathan stirred up some amazing Asian style Mocktails too. Moroccan Mint iced Tea and Asian Pear Sparkler were both brilliantly prepared and went well with the food. 

Soups 
Both the  Duck soup and Clear Veg Soup were slurpy and well seasoned. 

The Buffet Spread 
From the entire spread the vegetarian dishes that impressed me were
1. Tofu steamed and  bamboo shoots in chili blackbean
2. Phad thai noodles
3. Water chest nuts marmalade 
4. Thai corn fritters 
5.Grilled Asparagus 
6. Burmese yellow tofu 

The non vegetarian dishes were packed with flavors too, especially the 

1. Chicken Kotsu - Fried chicken 
2.Chicken Yakitori 
3. King now Yeung yeuk - shredded lamb with ginger garlic n dry red pepper. 
4.Beijing chicken pot rice
The chicken Dimsums and prawn sushi were well executed dishes too.

Dessert Section

 Desserts

The dessert section had freshly prepared cakes, pastry and icecream.  I enjoyed the Orange Terrence, 
Sticky rice pudding , litchhi cake and 
Mousse cake. 

Ended this fabulous luncheon with a a well brewed Pondicherry Fruit tea. 
Healthy food with utmost taste. Perfect amalgamation for your taste craving buds.
ownerResponse/connectionToSubject: Mukund Kamat, Vice President – Hotels Division
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from Hotel Kohinoor Continental!

It was a pleasure to have served you, we look forward to having you with us again to have best time Pan Asian Food Festival.

title: Bad service
text: Me arrived mumbai 15th September and taken room in kohinoor continental andheri. Me select pool view Double room and paid. Next day me go goa. Room canceled. My extra money 4200 rs. With them. They said said to possible return money more than 2000 as cash. Actually there no cash. Any way I booked same type room dated 18th. Cash paid also same type room. When I reach they give to me same price A DOG SLEEPING ROOM. very narrow bathing room. Every thing bad condition. Me asked to reception they saying not available another room. I feel sad and left hotel next day. This is really cheating I feel.

title: Average Hotel
text:
I spend 3 nights at the hotel, my issue with this hotel, it is very smoker friendly hotel, I was offered smoker room with double bed or a non smoker with 2 single bed, I insisted on non smoking double bed, which they eventually found it for me 
on the + side, friendly staff, nice reception area and bar 
on the - side, the place has smokers bedroom and a room designated  for the smokers, the room were out dated even my duvet cover smelt of tobacco !

I am non smokers, I do not have issue with smokers, but surely should not be allowed to smoke inside the hotel?  It is scientifically  proven  that  people who breath smoke can develop smoking related diseases 

The hotel is paradise for the smokers, i will not visiting this hotel again

Nearby the hotel there are good eat outs as well.  Overall, it is very good hotel.

title: Only location advantage - All else is worst
text: Booked 2 rooms for 1 night through Travelguru.com. This is a very old hotel. Almost in a dilapidated state. The renovation work was going on. The reception and front block seem to be new and that is probably what they have uploaded on their website. Believe me, more than 90% of their rooms do not resemble even an iota of what you see on their website. The rooms are tiny. T.V was not working in either of our rooms. Window ac made a terrible sound through out. Cupboards were damp and stinky. The fridge was not working. Bathroom was of an average size. But they still have those cylinder sized geysers in their bathrooms. And age-old tiles and basins. The room had no exterior view. The breakfast spread was average. The taste was pathetic and puri was of the quality of leather. The only advantage the hotel has is probably its location. We did not take dinner or lunch. We instead enjoyed the food at the near by Sukh Sagar restaurant.

Otherwise, in terms of location, service general appearance, the hotel is good.

text:

Mainly this is a Business Hotel nd one can get every conveyence from here..
very Near yo domestic Airport--1.3 kilometer
They serve Buffet Breakfast in their 24 hours coffee shop..
They provide Taxi of their own for full day work..
OverAll very convenient Hotel especially for the Business..
Lot of Restaurent with different cuisines are near Bye..
One need to BArgain Hard for the discount...

text: The hotel has location advantage as it is near to Mumbai airport, Mumbai helibase as well as very near to Parle railway station.Very useful for the persons on office tour who needs to move around in Mumbai to different locations during a short trip.Rooms are just OK and complimentary breakfast has limited options. Free airport pickup & dropping is added advantage.

title: A Good Basic Hotel
text: At prominent place like South Mumbai, this hotel serves the purpose of business travelers with attractive room rates, choice of rooms and its location is a good attraction. This hotel is very close to the Church Gate Station and Marine Drive too. This hotel does not have any restaurant. Staff are courteous and rooms are ok with basic amenities.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good hotel, good price, helpful staff
text: This hotel is next to marine drive. It offers erverything you need. Rooms are clean. The staff is helpful. The charges for wireless lan are good. The hotel is safe. Next to the hotel are good restaurants.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Perfect Location, Nice place!
text: We have stayed here earlier and will again. Its location, next to Ambassador Hotel makes it very convenient, one can just walk around to Marine Drive or cab it elsewhere. There are also some great restaurants like the Tea Centre on the same road and Pizza by the Bay right across. In addition, its helpful 24 hour staff make it a really good place to stay. Breakfast comes with the room and is good, though one could wish for more Maharashtrian options. Laundry is reasonable and absolutely punctual. All in all, a good experience.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Excellent Place to Stay!
text:
Pros:
a. Damn great location! Right next to the marine drive.
b. Great rooms! (Albeit the new ones)
c. Courteous staff!
d. Perfectly safe!
e. Economical!
;)

Cons:
a. You would be doubtful by the exterior looks that this was a hotel!!!
b. I don't remember exactly but there was little in terms of food. However, there are a couple of nice restaurants/bars etc at a walking distance.
c. Remember to take the renovated rooms only. The old ones are small and not that good.

I had stayed at this place for about 3-4 days about 2 years back. Always wanted to write about the great experience I had, just never got around to it!
Anyway, this is one of the best locations you can stay at in Mumbai within a reasonable price.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Hidden gem! Great hotel great service
text: We arrived at chateu to a building with no sign at all and panicked just a little.  Then we went up in the tiny lift to level 5 and were pleasantly surprised.  We stayed in the room on the roof top 526 I think and it was well worth it. In the day you could sit on the roof top abd look out onto the street at the stadium or down to the water. The reception staff are very good they go out of there way to provide great service constantly asking if you need any drinks etc. Thr beer here was the cheapest we got in mumbai.  Breakfast was incl and great aslo.. well worth it.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Feel like a Lord in a Chateau
text: Great location, tidy rooms, responsive staff with super view of the sea at the breakfast area.  Close to the happening places away from the maddening rush of Mumbai.  Even if you wish to go far, Local train station is just 2 minutes walk from the hotel.  Taxis are plenty around and the hotel staff were so helpful to extend change from their pockets to pay the taxi.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: good choice for tourist sights
text:
this hotel is located in a good part of mumbai - close to the touristic sights of mumbai / colabra area. The hotel is clean, tidy and comfortable - and acceptable for the price. 
The staff are generally efficiency and helpful - although sometimes you need to push them to be helpful. 
The breakfast was basic, but acceptable for a few days.
If you are looking for a good value basic accommodation in the tourist area of Colabra/Churchgate then this is a good choice. If you are looking for more western style restaurants, bars, coffee shops then i would recommend staying in Bandra /Pali Hill area of Mumbai.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Value for money
text:
Stayed at the Chateau Windsor from 24th April for two nights.  I would definitely recommend this place;  All staff are prompt and willing to go that extra mile to ensure your stay is perfect.  We were not happy with the initial room allocated to us which was near the kitchen.  However the reception was more than happy to comply and immediately gave us a better room on the 02nd floor.

Rooms are clean and spacious.   As for room service the hotel has menus from various restaurants around the area; the reception is more than happy to order for you.
Location is perfect.  The only inconvenience I faced was while using the business centre to access my mails- they have only one printer which doubles up as a fax machine.  When we needed some prints in the night it just wouldn’t work and it was quite frustrating, but the staff made every attempt to help us out; which was appreciated.

All in all highly recommended.  Felt safe at all times.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Very good and clean
text: Excellent location.  We were given a choice of rooms, but chose the old-fashioned formica room which was en suite, as opposed to the more modern room which had a bathroom across the corridor.  Spotlessly clean.  Excellent service.  Breakfast basic but adequate on the concrete roof.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Wonderful location, Excellent value for Money
text:
Stayed 3 days back for 2 nights. It was our 2nd stay , the 1st was 8 years ago.
This stay was even better because the hotel has been renovated. Check in was smooth and fast. We had booked a triple seater room and were shown two rooms- 302 and 304. 302 was much bigger but the bathroom ( dedicated to 302) was in the corridor. We chose 304 which had an attached bathroom.
Very well renovated rooms. Very clean. Comfortable mattress.  No electric kettle in the room. But tea and snacks ( very limited menu )  and breakfast are served in the room as well as in the roof top restaurant.
There is a hair dryer in the bathroom.
The breakfast menu is fixed ( included in the room rent). Lunch and dinner are not served, but can be ordered from the innumerable eateries close by.
The staff are very helpful and polite.
The location is its USP. A stone's throw from Churchgate station and Marine drive, it is walking distance from many attractions. A walk along the sea is so easy due to its location.
Car parking is in the hotel compound itself, which is a luxury in Mumbai.
This hotel is excellent value for money.
We will happily stay here again.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Highly recommended
text: Creaking up and down in an antiquated lift "driven" by a smiling attendant adds to the charm of this place.   Whilst it does not have the appearance of the average hotel, the location is nevertheless very convenient and wonderfully close to the seashore.   The service provided was wonderful, and any request was instantly dealt with by a very efficient young lady on the reception desk.   Room service could not be faulted.   We arrived in the early hours of the morning, and the receptionist was charming and prompt.  Having (again!) left my mobile 'phone in my room the hotel telephoned the taxi taking me to the airport to have me recalled!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Das beste Hotel unserer Reise in Indien
text: Wir waren am letzten Tag unserer Reise in diesem Hotel(Im März).Waren sooo positiv überrascht.Schade dass wir nur eine Nacht da verbracht haben.Personal sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit.An der Rezeption sind uns alle entgegengekommen nachdem wir nach Taxis, Shoppingstipps und Restaurants gefragt haben.Lage ist perfekt!Marine Drive 3 Minuten zu Fuss erreichbar auch die bekanntesten Sehenswürdigkeiten nah.Wenn man keine Lust hat zu laufen kann man immer die schwarz-gelbe Taxis mit Meter nehmen-kostet alles um 60-70 Ruppies.Sehr schöne und sichere Umgebung.Wir hatten DeluxeRoom -suuuper sauber, schöne Ausstattung,sauberes Bad.Top Hotel wo man sich gerne aufhält!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Lovely but expensive
text: We are gap year students and after having a few poor nights sleep in some terrible hostels we checked into chateau windsor for a bit of luxury! Overpriced for what it is, but great staff, clean and spacious. We recommend punday as the driver to use who parks outside- a non-scammer, who allows you to visit the city at a fair price.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Convenient location but...
text: We stayed there for 3 nights on January 2011. The hotel is situated on the upper floors of a large ugly building and in the entrance nothing reminds of a hotel. We felt a little bit worried but then the doorman accompanied us in an old fashioned elevator to the reception on the 4th or 5 th floor. Reception was like a public office but rooms were located on a renovated wing. Our room was spacious and clean, in a good condition but the bathroom was outside. It was a private bathroom but we had to go out on the hall to get access to it and this was quite annoying, since we were not informed about that when we made the reservation and since the price was not cheap too( about 80 euros per night). I asked for another room but they told me they hadn't anything available. Our room was also quite noisy, both from the main street and from lack of soundproof between rooms. We liked the rooftop were breakfast was served, because it offered some nice views to the city and the sea. Breakfast was simple(eggs, butter toast) but ok. The hotel is located in a very convenient location, in a walking distance from Mumbai's main attractions and just a few steps away from the marine road where you can have a pleasant walk in the evening, see the sunset, come across with local people and dine in one of many restaurants located on the marine drive.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Bien situado
text:
Hotel bastante paticular al estar situado en edificio que no ocupa por entero
Tuvimos una habitación triple superior reformada muy confortable y amplia

La situación es ideal a pocos metros del mar
Un poco caro pero teniendo en cuenta que es Bombay y que reservamos con un solo día de antelación
El personal muy agradable
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Pratique et calme
text: La chambre est très agréable rénovée elle correspond à un trois étoile français, mais en Inde la touche réception au 5eme étage, très administrative...le vieil ascenseur... Le toit terrasse est très agréable pour lire le soir ai soleil couchant pour le petit dej aussi dommage que celui ci soit si sommaire pour le prix il pourrait être mieux... Autre avantage son emplacement proche de la gare de la baie, nous avions une chambre sur le côté très calme parfait pour démarrer le voyage !
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Bof
text: On avait réservé quelques jours avant sur booking car il avait une super note. finalement ça ne correspondait pas vraiment à ce que l'on attendait et ce que l'on avait vu sur booking. la réception est dans les étages (elle ressemble à l'accueil de bureaux administratifs), ne prenant pas l'ascenseur il a fallu batailler pour qu'on ouvre les escaliers. Chambre propre mais très sommaire. pour le prix on a préféré aller ailleurs le lendemain. le petit déjeuner est vraiment pas terrible et très sommaire également. la terrasse laisse vraiment à désirer. beaucoup d'efforts à faire si l'on veut s'appeler château windsor
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great find close to the beach and shopping areas
text: We were greeted by extremely welcoming staff. Our room was spacious can very clean there was good hot water! I really liked this hotel only thing is that the wifi is not free and also did not work very well - too slow so could not get on. Breakfast is a very simple affair served from the rooftop where there are great views over the city
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good Location Good Service
text: In a really good location with nice rooms and good service. We were there for 3 nights and loved it all. It's a little funky because you have to take the elevator up to the hotel which is on the upper floors. But they were very nice and accomodating. The price is reasonable and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast on the roof is a definite plus although everything arrived cold because the kitchen is on a lower floor. They did everything we asked - found us a good guide, recommended restaurants, etc.
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Triple Room - Fantastic
text: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel! Its about a 5 minute walk from Churchgate station and 2 minute walk to Marine lines. Really convenient if you want travel to Mumbai's major attractions.. Clean, comfortable, spacious and friendly staff!! Loved the hospitality shown from the doorman to the receptionist.. We had the superior triple room (3 adults, 2 kids) which was more than enough.. Clean rooms and toilets are not a given in Mumbai and we were lucky that this fit the bill.. Will definitely stay here again! Oh, there is also a vodafone store within 2 minutes if you want to grab an indian simcard (very helpful)!
placeInfo/address: 86 Veer Nariman Road, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Short Stay
text:
Stayed at Parle International recently and was pleasantly surprised at the service received. Pick up at the airport was prompt and efficient, given that I was travelling with my Mum who is a senior citizen. Our room on the 4th floor was spacious, clean and very comfortable. Housekeeping was good. The complimentary breakfast was great. Thanks to Executive Chef Yatin for the excellent spread of tasty dishes and Prashant personalised treatment. Prashant was attentive, accommodating and very courteous. A special mention of Nilima in Reservations for her warmth, quick response and helpful approach to our needs. 
Thank you one and all for the lovely stay!!! Would recommend this hotel and will definitely visit again.......Keep up the good work guys!

title: Good Hotel for budget pricing
text:
Stayed for two days. Nice hotel withclean rooms.Bathroom comes with a bath tub.Coperative staff n hood keals .Also very near to local parle station and decent locality.
You can choose this hotel if you need a quiet , clean and decent service...ideal for short stays

title: never never use this hotel for party
text:
The proximity to the airport made me stay here   The rooms looked tired ,dated and dirty with marks all over the carpet and furniture. At the breakfast buffet there was absolutely no help from the waiters or the manager you just had to fend for yourself. the breakfast realy bad please avoid breakfast and meals at parle hotel, bad quality and no taste in food

Stayed November 2014, travelled solo

title: Complimentary Buffet BF, Free airport drop and pick up, small rooms
text:
The rooms are small, but clean and well maintained.  They have free buffet breakfast - south indian, continental etc.  The hotel is 2-4 Km from the domestic and international airports and stone's throw from the Vile-Parle railway station.  Shops selling all kinds of things - from grocery to clothes are within walking distance.  Many restaurants and street food vendors are very very close.  Since room service food in this hotel is very very costly (and quality is so so), we always ate in one of the restaurants that are outside this hotel.  A few names that come to mind are - Jeevan, Ramakrishna and Shivsagar near the station, Mee Marathi opposite Parleshwar temple.

In short, stay here if you can afford, but other than the complimentary breakfast, do not eat here, since there are better options outside.

title: Pleasant Stay stone's throw away from the airport
text:
I stayed in this hotel for a night and found it nice. The hotel seems to be very old as they still have window AC; however maintained properly. Bathroom had a tub and modern amenities. Best thing is that they have hotel pick up and drop facility. My flight was delayed and i reached around 11:45pm but there was guy waiting for me to pick up.
The morning breakfast is typical south Indian and Maharastraian.

I would definitely stay in this place again.

NOTE:- I booked this hotel through Clear trip and when i contacted the hotel they were clueless about it. Fortunately i contacted them 2 days prior to my date of stay. They figured out my booking later and confirmed it.

title: Bitter sweet experience
text:
The vicinity to the Airport is the high point of the hotel. The airport transfers to and fro saves a lot of hassles.  The staff is friendly and efficient, but then this is very much expected in Mumbai.  The rooms were fairly clean, though cramped by the standards of the rates they charge.  

It is located in a nice suburb and one can always pop across the road for a quick meal. It is a business traveler  hotel, not for holidayers or family trips.  Most of the Mumbai hotels gives you a feeling of being  ripped off,  this is one of those hotels.  The breakfast was average. 

All right for a short stay, but not a hotel one would go back to again.

Staff was good . Excellent Airport coach transfer.
In the heart of suburb Vile Parle close to markets and railway station.
Very clean and good rooms.

title: Unprofessional staff at the front desk.
text: So tonight i went in to chekout this hotel as i was looking for a place to stay for the night. Upon asking the front desk person (Mohammad Ali) to show me the room, he was polite enough to ask a bellman to show me a room. At the same time my partner had to use the restroom so she did and i went upstairs alone. After reaching the floor my first impression was as if i am in a HOSPITAL and thats exactly what it smelled like. So i came down and told the front desk person that i dont think so i would be staying in a hospital and paying Rs 7000 for a night which he coated me in the first place. Upon me telling him that it smelled like hospital his first comment was if you wanted to use the washroom you should have asked me instead making up excuses. What kind of professional way is this to treat your customers, i have been working in hotel industry for the past 7 years and have never come across such rude and arrogant front desk person. Wont suggest this hotel to anyone.

title: Spectacular service at this classic accommodation with modern amenities
text: This elegantly styled accommodation offers a staff that provides excellent service that goes out of its way to assist it's guests.  The hotel's cleanliness, convenience to airport via shuttle, and great informational resources make it stand above others. My father and I stayed here from New York to visit my grandmother who lives nearby.  It offered wifi access, clean and stylish rooms, was walking distance to shops, and an airport shuttle was also provided.  It was monsoon season and while it was raining we were very happy we could walk to the adjacent vegetarian restaurant which offered unlimited quantities of good food.  At one point, the manager even lent us his umbrella!  Whether for business or for leisure... We highly recommend this great hotel!
